text: Flaska systembolaget. Grumlig orange kulör. Doft av citrus, örter och jäst. I smak känns örter, äpplemos, aprikos, jäst och vete. Len och uppfriskande

From 50cl bottle. Pours fully hazy dark intense gold with abundant white foam, irregular. Aroma is fruity but also herbaceous, the latter moderating the typical weizen aroma of banana, which here is not straightforward. Body is average. Taste is not as sweet as typical weizen, but displays a pleasant bitterness as well. Finish is short.
Bottle from Geers. Hazy yellow/amber colour, white foam. Sweet nose of banana, wheat, citrus. Bitter, sweet and light wheat tart. Balanced. Nice and refreshing hefeweizen.
Hazy orange color with stable white head. Aroma of wheat, banana and yeast. Taste is medium bitter, sparkling mouthfeel. Well balanced and very nice hefeweizen.

Yet another superb offering from Schneider-Weisse, who has quickly become our favorite German brewery. It pours a lovely golden cloudy orange with medium head and a rich lemony, wheaty, bubblegum smell. The taste is rich, refreshing, zesty, and surprisingly hoppy. It manages to dance across several flavor profiles like a beer equivalent of Mariah Careys vocal range. Good for washing down some Burger King after a long days journey into the heart(ford) of death metal with your sleepy wonderful boo boo.
Boca 0,5L - nisam oduevljen kao sedmicom ili esticom ali i ovo je moje prvo bio pivo tako da nisam upoznat sqa stilom i kakav bio on trebao biti...pomalo kiselkasto, banana je tu, OK pivo
Hazy orange colour with large white head.Aroma is frutiy of citrus and bananas,sweet and fresh with note of honey and bubbelgums and good nots of yeast and hops overall very good beer.

Lys sirupsfarvet German Hefeweizen med flot hvidlig tætskummende top, som langsomt svinder til landskaber. Ufiltreret og perlende. 
Gærnoter er det første, det rammer næsen. Dernæst noter af banan og citrus-lignende frugt. Senere igen fremkommer humlearoma af blomster. 
Første smagsindtryk er en mere humlet hvedeøl end andre af Schneiders lignende øl. Mere bitter. Stadig med hvedeøllets karakter i spil, men klart mere bitter og krydret. Smagsnoter af noget diskret koriander. Middel bitterhed med lille til middel sødme. 
Lidt kraftig karboneret, men det kan afhjælpes med lidt "stirring". Ellers frisk og lettere blød på samme tid. Olieret konsistens og med en bitter kort afslutning. 
Overall: Dejligt humlet indspark fra Schneider. Hvedeøl kan de jo til perfektion, så denne øl er klart et godt alternativ uden at gå alt for meget på kompromis med hvedeøllets gode egenskaber. 
0.5 l, flaske, 6.2 % ABV, BB: 16/01/18, købt i Systembolaget i Malmö, Sverige. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Pours deep golden with white head. Apart from the usual banana and yeast there are some honey, hops and spicy notes in aroma. In taste its banana-honey sweet with underlying bitterness to it. Complex, delicious beer.

500 ml bottle served in Weizenbier glass. Pale dark orange colour, medium white head. Coriander, hops, lemon, yeast, grapefruit, a bit passion fruit. Hoppy bitterness, light sour. Medium body. oily texture. Lively carbonated. Could be the little brother of "Meine Hopfenweiße".
Orange uklar hvedeøl med flot langt hvidt skum,. Gær, banan og citrus i bnæsen. Sødme, banan og noget floralt i smagen.
The banana and nice opaque hue definitely make this beer somewhat stand out in an otherwise dull beer style for me. If youre into the weize a solid choice, but not close to my favorite tap, #5.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2017 Opalizujące, pomarańczowe, mętne piwo. Dość gęste. W zapachu bananowe, z lekką przyprawową nutą. Smak to głównie banany. Rześkie, lekko kwaskowate, pełne. Fajna goryczka, wyraźna. Bardzo dobre.
Bottle. Opaque orange, thick white froth. Yeasty banana aroma. Sweet flavour, yeast, banana candy and some caramel. Not my favorite style, but this one is rather nice.
On tap. Lots of banana in aroma, a bit of clove. Light bitterness. Lively carbonation. Pretty standard weizen, good.

Guldgul rejält grumlig, med medelstort skum. Doftar skumbanan och kryddnejlika i långa banor. Smak är frisk och fruktig med torkade aprikoser och läcker jästighet, sköna kryddor med kryddnejlika som dominerar. En härlig veteöl med massor av smak!!

Fizzy head over a deep cloudy gold body. Fresh floral aroma. Herbaceous hops, light spicy notes. Has an almost medicinal quality. Backed up with sweet honeysuckle and deeper tones of dark honey. Flavor starts with a burst of bright hops, that pairs well with the refreshing minerality. Grassy, slightly sweet flavor, that hints at clove and vanilla but doesnt quite muster the complexity I crave. Ends on dry, slightly bitter note that finally resolves into a lingering burnt caramel aftertaste. A refreshing palate cleanser with just enough bitterness to cut through the fattiness of a bratwurst.

Bottle from Bottlecraft, Hanley. Pours a clear deep golden colour with a thick foamy white head. Aroma of pepper, fruit, some banana, slight clove, a little herbs and subtle orange peel. Taste of fruit, pepper, herbs, some banana, clove, slight orange, a hint of vanilla and subtle floral hops. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and a chalky texture. A dryish, floral hop bitterness in the finish with a herbal aftertaste. A well hopped weissbier, can get the citrus, fruit and floral hops flowing through the smooth and yeasty malt base. Really surprised by clarity of this beer, maybe just mine.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2017 Look: hazy beige (ugly imo). Small head. Smells lots of yeast, citrus, banana, cloves. Taste: yeast, pilsner malt, not so spicy, a bit bland and it somehow taste mass produced. Mouthfeel: smooth
This is the perfect hefeweitze. Light yellow appearance cloudy. Tested it Im Munich Weisses Brauhaus im Tal.

Aroma is banana, clove, earthy hops, pine, dank, musty, eh. Appearance is golden amber, clear, white head. Taste is earthy hops, pine, banana, clove, bitter, dusty. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, clove and earthy hop aftertaste. Overall, the color is off and the aroma isnt great, but the flavor is good for this style.
Butelka 0,5l. Aromat goździkowy, przyjemny. W smaku delikatnie wodniste, goździk. Delikatna goryczka.

500 ml bottle.
Tastes very sweet with but also has a bitterness from the hops clearly present. Aroma is mainly fruit and yeast. Taste is sweet with hints of banana and other fruits, yeast and a hop that is not very lively. Kind of sticky mouthfeel. Carbonation is generous.

500ml bottle at home. Aroma is banana, malt, light yeast, gorgeous. Appearance is cloudy orange with a frothy white foam. Taste is light bitter, some sweetness, very light sour. Perfect balance, soft to medium carbonation. Light dryness. An incredible Weißbier.

0,5l bottle. Hazy dirty/mudy yellow colour with medium lasting thick creamy white head. Aroma: Very strong and intense banana, biscuit, citrus with cheese notes. Taste: Oh my god!! Very spicey and sweet malty start with herbs. Has a lightly bitter a bit sweet and a bit tarty well-balanced mouthfeel. Almost like a cream on a dessert. Has a very creamy texture. Medium body with soft carbonation. Long pleasent bitter and soft finish. This is the best hefeweizen that I ever tasted. Amzing beer for sure.

Cloudy as hell. Yellow in the thin spots, orange in the thick ones. But absolutely opaque throughout.

The aroma is amazing: citrus fruits, tangerine, orange peel, yeast that manifests itself as lemon and cloves. Dried fruits, like apricots. Grassy with some black pepper. Apple skins. Im in love with the scent of this beer. Im surprised how tropical it is.

The yeast is a lot more pronounced in the flavor. There is a more earthy presence: dried leaves, some caramel. The hops are bittering/Euro stuff, but complement the esters and dried apricots; a touch of honeydew melon. Some of the barnyard/hay stuff comes out. The malts are bready and biscuity; just a little nutty.

The feel is thick and puffy/pillowy. I just love this beer: it is exemplary of the authentic German Hefeweizen style: full of flavor, and not another goddamn banana bomb. Its bright and really terrific.

Cloudy , golden color. Big , white head. Banana, clove , wheat and herbal notes in aroma. Classic taste of German weizen with some herbal bitterness at the end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle as a gift. BB 06.26.2017. Pours hazy, very beautiful deep yellowish golden. Heads thick, creamy white. Aroma of ripe bananas and a dash of floral-grassy-citric-fruity hops too, and quite a lot of bubblegum later on... The wheat comes across as a sweet pastry product I loved as a kid, in Estonian we call this the Viennese boat (Viini lootsik). So good. Tastes along the same lines, its surprisingly bitter in the finish, but overall rather sweet of the ripe banana, wheat pastry and bubblegum flavours. Soft mouthfeel, carbonation rather active but in a way soft too, quite dry and biscuity grainy on the palate and especially in finish. I dont get to try world class Weizens too often so when ever I do I fall in love. This is really good. I especially love when theyve not been shy in the hop department.
Golden, medium body Hefeweizen that has flavors of banana and citrus. Still very German and looked perfect in a Schneider Weisse half liter glass.

Bottle from the Schneiderweisse Kulturbox. Pours hazy orange with slow depleting head. Nose is excellent banana, floral, herbs, resin. Palate is bitter banana, citrus. Very good Weizen, but a bit too bitte in the aftertaste.

500 ml bottle from Greenwich Union. Pours cloudy orange with white, lasting head. Aroma is corrianer, banana and cloves. Taste starts off as typical hefeweizen, but finish is long and citrusy, mostly lemon. High carbonation, long-lasting taste, refreshing. Very good hefeweizen.
Hefetrübes goldgelb mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, fruchtig, tropische Früchte, Litschi, Kräuter, blumig, Nelke, spritzig.

Pours a golden color with a white head. Aroma is grain, wet grass, banana, and clove. Soft mouth feel, fair carbonation, semi dry finish. Flavor is a tad mellow upfront. Lower side of medium sweetness, low bitter, bready, mild overly ripe banana, herbal/grassy finish. Not my favorite weisse.

Ar: Banana and peach, medium-high intensity; clove notes; a bit of pineapple. Ap: Cloudy golden-amber; large, pure white head with phenomenal retention, very fine bubbles, and remarkably good retention; the head is an absolutely perfect picture. T: Bright, tangy banana with stone fruit up front; soft, bready notes with a medium-low sweetness; low bitterness, slightly grassy and herbal hop flavor; mild cloves with very slight cinnamon and juicy-fruit notes. P: Medium-full body with high carbonation; silky-smooth, full mouthfeel; crisp finish. O: Spectacular German hefeweizen; bright, distinct banana, stone fruit, and clove notes without being overstated; the light maltiness, rich yet crisp mouthfeel, full and rounded carbonation, and beautiful appearance all come together to create a truly great drinking experience.
Schönes Aroma mit viel Hefe und Weizen: frisches Brot, Banane. Geschmack intensiv mit Hefeteig, Banane, Früchten Gras. Etwas nachhängende Bittere.

Goldig, leicht trüb. Geruch weizen, leichte Hopfennote. Im Geschmack ebenso. Recht bitte für ein Weizen. Gute Hopfennoten auch im Antrunk, für ein Weizen aber in dem Maße eigentlich nicht stilgerecht.
Scent of a sour dishcloth. Sur and banana taste. Good bitterness which fills the upper part of the mouth a weak moment. OK beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

14.12.2016 - I usually dont like Weizen but this is just a great beer. No heavy ripe banana ester aroma. Shy fresh banana and tropical fruits in. Also in taste together with pleasant wheat palate. This is a Weizen I would like to enjoy a second time.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2017 500mL bottle. Pours a hazy orange-tinged gold with a fluffy, medium white head. Aroma is wheat, clove, lemon, grass, spice, and yeast. Taste is wheat, citrus, yeast, subtle banana, spice, some bread, and just the lightest trace of bubblegum. Very light citrusy/lemon tartness. Dry finish, with soft lingering spice and grass. Relatively bitter finish for a hefeweizen. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Silky smooth mouthfeel.

Dark golden to light orange, not too hazy, visible carbonation, big white head, nice retention and lacing. Smell is softly/yeastly citric, herbal/grassy notes and a bit of spiciness. Quite interesting (not your standard hefe) but not too vivid. Taste opens sweet with soft white bread and slight bubblegum. Citric notes are also pretty evident. Of course a touch of clove. Finishes with a surprising, slightly bitter, herbal/grassy note. Its still wonderfully refreshing though, thanks to a slight hint of tartness. Light to medium bodied (pretty light for the 6.2% abv), average carbonation for the style, very smooth and easy. Its pretty rich and interesting. Not too classic but still preserving hefes classic drinkability and refreshing feel. Excellent
Хорошее пшеничн& пиво, хороший аромат, хороший вкус но непродо& и слабое послевк& TAP4 Meine Festweisse. Дата розлива 04.05.2016. (Bottle 0,5/ 6,2%)

Tasted at Craftbeer Fest Wien 2016.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours hazy golden, nose is banana, herbal, citrus, taste is chewy toffee, banana, pineapple. .

0,1l from tap at Craft Bier Fest Wien shared with a friend. Amber hazy colour, small white head. smells citric, bread, peach, spices, light cucumber. bit weird smell, but overall ok. Medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of cucumber, spices, caramel, light banana. fishes lightly bitter with notes of cucumber and spices. ok, but not totally my thing.
Bleekgeel bier met witte kraag. Wee?g, zoet. Licht bitter. Zuurtje. Aroma van hop, gist, tarwe.
0,5l bottle. Pours murky orange with big white head. Banana and wheat, a little bit of spices. Not the best hefe for me, but quality none the less.
50cl bottle. Nice beer from the Schneider brewery, full of flavour, but not good enough to get a permanent spot in my fridge

On tap. Pours an orange colour, a big head with great retention, ARoma is the usual for these beers, banana, citrics, the difference is that theres a lot of clove that almost fades everthing. Medium body. Taste is the same as the aroma, with cloves burying everything.
[backlog] 12-06-16 // 500ml bottle. Pours a cloudy dark orange colour. Foamy head. Strong yeasty body with banana and clove. Finishes with a light citrus herbal hop bitterness. Amazing.

Grumligt orangebrun med fint vitt skum. Doftar kryddor och lite koriander. Smaken fyllig och förvånansvärt kryddig. Eftersmaken hyggligt lång, torr och återigen kryddig, lite skarp och besk. Annorlunda weisse.
De geur valt mee. De kleur is donkerblond. De smaak valt ook goed mee, een beetje bitter.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2017 0.5l bottle. pours a murky orange amber with a steady creamy head and a nice lacing. aroma of banana bread, cloves, citrusy hops, spices. flavour of not too dominating banana, cinnamon, nutmeg. a weizen with some grassy bitterness, a bit harsh, but interesting.

Pours a hazy straw yellow with a thick foamy white head. Tastes more like a Witbier than Weizen. There is more wheat flavor and not much spice. Fairly smooth but not as refreshing as I had expected. OK but nothing special.

Citrus and herbal notes, some clove and banana, bit of caramel, toffee and biscuity notes. Lively lemony/zesty tang brights up this beer. Fairly carbonated with creamy and smooth texture, medium-full body. Perfectly drinkable.

Bottle. Slightly cloudy golden amber pour, small white head. Aroma is lightly fruity with a bit of caramel, definitely some apple cider notes, cloves and other subtle spices. Taste is much the same, starts a bit sweet but finishes light and balanced. Very similar to the Schneider Weisse Original, but I like this just a touch better. It has a little bit of brightness that the other lacks. Quite nice.

Hazy golden color with a super strong amount of activity. Creamy and frothy white 2 finger head, lasting around 10 to 15 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas of citrus, caramel, cookies, and faint banana yeast. Flavors of lemony citrus, toffee, faint ester fruits, roasted grains, faint coriander and noble spices. Perfect zesty sharpness with an incredible sugary bread taste.

Smooth creamy oily full body with champagne like heavy carbonation. Medium strength finish, ending with a roasted malts feel, citrus tongue coat, toffee feel, a little grassy, and faint oak.

Overall exquisite quality craft. Delicious complex flavors that are perfectly balanced and intensified. Insane bread and wheaty feel, best ever tasted. Incredible citrus sharpness, almost feels like a witbier. Thick satisfying body that is very filling. Would drink this all day long, one of the best beer ever.

Samea, oranssinkeltainen olut kohtalaisella valkoisella vaahdolla. Tuoksu hieman banaaninen ja hiivainen. Maku hieman banaaninen, mausteinen ja yllättävänkin kuiva, katkera sekä hapan alusta alkaen. Raikas janojuoma kesähelteille, mutta oman hefen nautin mieluummin hieman banaanisempana.
Geur van banaan en kruidnagel . Zachte subtiel zoete smaak, de kruidnagel komt nadrukkelijk terug in de smaak gecombineerd met banaan. Donkergele kleur, weinig koolzuur. Goed te drinken.

Bottle.
Hazy, yellow, white head
Aroma of banan orange
Taste sweet banana, quite bitter, 
Alcoholic taste.
Bottle - as Mein Grünes - Hazy golden color, large head. Taste is spicy, some fruity notes, some wheat malt, less but some banana. Rather dry finish. Nice and unusual Weizen.

Hazy, orange yellow colored, medium to strong creamy white head, nice lacing and long lasting. Aroma is of wheat, some banana bread, cloves, phenolic spicy yeast and herbal hoppy aroma. Taste is medium sweet wheat, some clove and banana bread, lots of phenolic spicy yeasty notes and moderate fresh herbal hoppiness, medium bitterness, dry finish. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, light creamy. Fresh hops, strong spiciness, refreshing stuff. Excellent when you run out of Tap 5!
(bottle)

Jun 16. A 0.5 l bottle that poured a beautiful hazy orange body with a big head. Fine banana and bubblegum in aroma with some herbal notes. Lightly bitter herbal flavor, even vaguely soapy from the bitter hops, otherwise extremely pleasant strong Weizen taste. Orange, banana, cloves, lactic... Full bodied with quite a high carbonation. Long, bitterish finish, herbal, peppery, besides banana, yogurt, chalk. Very nice Hefeweizen, hops werent too intrusive at all, just spiced it up and rounded nicely! Not among the best Ive had though.

Multi historic. Gorgeous wheat beer. 6.2% but moreish. Bananas, bread, so tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled from Biernavigatie. Golden/orange colored, thick head. Aroma of wheat and hops, spicy. Hoppy flavor, sharp, wheat in the background, quite spicy. For me an overload of hops just doesnt fit the style of Hefeweizen. Not my kind of beer.

Bottle @ dnd w friends/Don. Appearance: pours unclear orange with good white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: wheat, banana, bread, light spices and some faint mineral notes. palette: medium yeasty aroma, low to average carbonation, medium body, medium to notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by a low to medium bitterness, average duration and a watery texture. overall: Quite decent weizen with some spicy hints.

Sweet bready malts, some fruity action, light floral and herbal hoppy notes, light spices into the close. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy golden color with big foamy head. Amazing aroma of bananas, combined with wheat malt and touch of spices. Soft hops on taste, mixed with bananas, cloves, wheat, citrus. Soft carbonation. Wow! Quite impressed. So traditional yet well balanced. Straight to one of my favourites!

Bottle 50cl. Poured into a weizen glass. Hazy medium amber, lot of tiny bubbles, tall frothy off-white head, long lasting an heavy lacing; aroma wheat, banana, yeast, grass, flowers, clove notes; taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter and even a rumour of acidity, yeasty, fruity, cloves notes; in the aftertaste more herbal bitterness (grassy and floral hops) and also cloves more prominent; medium body, watery to creamy texture, soft carbonation; very well executed hefeweizen, complex, fresh, tasty.
How : bottle Appearance : hazy pale golden with a medium white head. Aroma : banana, bread, orange peel, floral and honey. Palate : medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle from Geers, Gent - BE. Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and high white foam. Smell: malt domination. Sweet cereals notes balanced with floral and grassy hoppy notes. Taste: medium body with caramel malt. Bread notes, good attenuation and really drinkable. Hoppy and grassy finish. Really nice beer. Aftertaste: wet bitterness and cereal notes.
Pleasant bread lemon and banana aroma. A golden body with a mild haze. Capped with a thick tiny bubbled head. Sweet tart lemon banana bread taste. Silky smooth feeling. Delicious.

Wait, this may be THE beer for me, i love weizens as much as i love hoppy IPAs and the 6-7% ABV. HUGE expectations here.
50cl bottle at Mosquito poured into a weizen glass. Murky dark yellow to orange color, majestic offwhite head, nice perfume. So far so good as a weizen usually goes for. Aroma is full of weizen malts, dough, yeast, lightly fruity and spiced and the hops does come out. It has something in common with american IPAs indeed. The taste is very well balanced, malty sweetness and powerful hops. Creamy texture, average carbonation, medium to full body, the finish is also a pleasure. This was a sure hit, bulls eye.
500ml bottle. Hazy dark golden color with one finger head. Very big banana and clove, bread aroma. Taste is similar with some more spice and slight citrus. A very nice version with something extra.
Bottle. Orange color, hazy liquid, white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, citrus, bread. Bitter - sour finish. Not my favorite style, but it is highly drinkable.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Slightly copperish gold with a huge soapy head that lingers. Banana bread, clove, nutmeg and peach aromas all are present. Nice refreshing carbonation with a medium-light body. Nice peppery, hoppy finish that adds just enough of a hoppy bitter bite to keep it interesting. Great stuff.

Cette bière blanche à la robe foncée me comble de joie par cette journée caniculaire sans soleil. Présence dun collet blanc persistant et plutôt collant. Effluves de pain aux bananes, de canneberges, de blé frais, de miel, de pain doré et de cannelle. Je suis ébloui par un tel nez dans une bière de ce style. Présence importante de bulles en bouche et dans lestomac. Saveurs épicées de clou de girofle et de muscade. Je préfère laromatique aux saveurs qui maquent à mon avis de nuances, si on les compare aux arômes. Longue en bouche, claire, facile à boire. Une très grande Hefe!
Along with Yves at his home gold blond colored body with a white head and a floral spicy hop aroma a spicy herby yeast hop taste with a slight bitter finish
Angenehm herbes Bier mit Bitternote, welche irrtümlicherweise hohen Alkoholgehalt vermuten lässt. Schöne Konsistens, nicht wässrig.
hay, bread, citrus, grass, dough, cheese, banana, cooked vegetables, frothy, cloudy, amber, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Pours rich gold and cloudy. Aroma is fresh and floral: lavender and wheat fields.

Nice head, disappeared quite quickly but nice lacing. Looks thick and rich: some yeast is visible and floating in the beer. Lovely. 

Taste is rich and chewy. You can tell it's got more alcohol than a normal Weizen. But really a nice sweet rich toffee banana taste and texture: it almost feels like its coating on your tongue. With a kick of bitter and almost ale like hops it ends off beautifully. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared with wim at my home. Hazy goldblond colored beer with small white head and no carbonation visible. Malty fruited aroma. Full sparkling and creamed palate. Finish is sweet fruited herby.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
(50 cl bottle in large tumbler.) I am not a big fan (yet) of wheat beer, but I enjoyed this one today. Hoping to start enjoying these types of beer more to unlock another world of delights :)
Bottle. Pours is cloudy orange with medium white head. Sweet aroma of wheat, banana, peach. Taste is moderate to medium sweet, fruity mouthfeel. Medium body, sticky texture, fruity sweet finish.

0.5L bottle. Cloudy orange brown colour with two finger white head. Aroma of wheat and yeast, hops, spice, banana, floral. Taste is wheaty and yeasty, banana, cloves, slight bitter floral hop finish. Good carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. Amazing.
Deep gold, little white fuzz. Nose is yeast and soft fruit. Little sweet. Middle is bananas, light citrus, creamy wheat. Finish is soft grain.

Pours a hazy, fizzy gold with big frothy head. Aroma is of citrus, spice, wheat, dank, and gum. Tastes of gum, banana, coriander, citrus, peaches, and honey. Has a chewy medium body with lively carbonation.

From a 500ml bottle on 23/4/2016. Pours a cloudy dark golden with a smallish uneven head. The nose features some clove, spice and some slight basement notes. Flavour wise, its quite bold for a hefe - sweet banana, zesty lemon, and a good dash of spice make for a lovely balanced affair. More bitter than typical for the style, but this just adds to the experience. Full bodied, with slightly above average carbonation. A fantastic hefe. Everything Ive tried from these guys so far has been excellent.

Exclusively brewed in reminiscence of Georg Schneiders privilege of being part of the world famous Munich Octoberfest until 1942 when his renowned "Weisse Brauhaus im Tal, Munich" was destroyed. Enjoy and celebrate!

Whenever I like the style of this beer! With incredible quality, I think this beer is the best of this style. Balanced with just the right touch of complexity, a pleasure. Color, taste in the mouth, flavors ... what a great beer!

Dorada anaranjada, turbia, de bonita espuma que no permanece mucho. Típico aspecto. Levadura y especias en el aroma. El sabor prolonga el aroma, clavo típico notas de plátano y rica base de maltas. Dulcemente frutal y especiada, de cuerpo cremoso. Entre dulce y seca. Muy agradable.

the yeast is reallly in front in this beer. Very light spruce aroma. raisin vert. Cloudy with nice white head. Light in sweetness, bitterness an sour. Good balance. Oily with average carbonation and got a long finish. A standard in the genre.
From a bottle. Good example of style, nothing flash or crazy just a decent, well made beer.
Good weissbier. Maybe too light of a body. Hops arent strong and the maltyness isnt a big deal. Good, but not the best in the genre.
Really good weizen, all tough it should definitely being drunk cold, as the tastes gets very unbalanced when drunken too warm, too sweet and hangover taste.

#499Tap at Němý Medvěd, Mělník, CZ. Hazy deep gold to amber body, high creamy white head. Aroma of yeast, wheet, spicy notes, without banana. Taste is sourish with slightly bitter finish. Yeasts, apples, wheet, spices. Medium body and carbonation. Well balanced smooth weizen.
Draught at Němý medvěd, Mělník. Very hazy, light amber colored. AROMA- wheaty and yeasty. FLAVOR- lightly sour, dry, refreshing, well balanced weissbier. Medium bodied. Good.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Hazy dark golden with creamy white head. Spicy yeast, dough, quite hoppy, caramel, flowers, dried citrus peel, orange. Light sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied with creamy feel. Nice stuff, surprisingly hoppy.
Bottle shared at home. Clear golden, white head. Sweet, barley, banana, chalky, toasty, bitter. Medium sweet, light bitter. Full heavy body, fat and chalky, light carbonation.
Bottle from Bradleys. Amber colour with an initially frothy head. Usual weizen aroma with a punch of citrus behind it. Some banana sweetness with a nice dry and bitter hoppy finish.

0,5l Flasche. Hellbraunes Bier mit relativ kleiner Schaumkrone. Grasiges frisches Aroma, das typische Bananenaroma gerät in den Hintergrund. Auch im Geschmack eher floral frisch, Hopfenbetont. Angenehm anders..

Aroma:

Malts, wheat, banana, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid golden/amber beer with a slight/medium white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, wheat and banana; ends slightly bitter with hops and citrus.

Orange brown cloudy, almost muddy color with solid white foam head. Wheat and light hop flavors in the nose. The taste is super calm and milky with fresh grass hop notes in nice balance with the wheat character of the beer. Calm and light alcoholic aftertaste.

Hazy honey-like colour. Tall rocky head. Good retention. Very spicy nose with floral notes. Banana only in background. Honey. Nice smell. Light to medium body. Oily texture. Honey, clove, floral & spicy hops in taste. Phenols also present. Light to medium hoppy bitterness. Very smooth. Its not a typical Hefe. Its much better than a typical Hefe. Perfect.

500 ml bottle as Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes bought at EG Plus Ltds booth during the 13th Hong Kong Food Festival 2015 in HKCEC, Wan Chai.
Looks: Cloudy hazy golden honey colour with a ring of dirt-like yeast sediments; One finger head with white foam which lasted for 2 minutes; Very good sticky lacing and fizzy small carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragment malt, with strong banana, strong vanilla, light pineapples, strong honey, fairly strong wheaty tartness, caramel, light toffee, sugar, strong cloves, spices, bread, strong yeast, light lemon and strong grass.

Taste: Mid to light sweet strong malt, with caramel, floral, strong wheaty tartness, strong molasses, strong phenolic, cloves, strong spices, strong yeast, lemon, strong bitter hops and very sharp grass.

Body: Close to medium body. Thick and smooth palate.

Mouth Feel: Strong maltyness in a rich and smooth background. Strong wheat and tartness. Fruity ester is close to minimal, but malty caramel and floral hops taste abound. Lots of nice sweetness and clovey spices. Not as yesty as most Hefeweiss, but good lemon to round. Very nice!

Hoppiness: Light floral, strong honey, spices, lemon and grass in nose. Much the same but with much stronger grass in taste. Bitterness is strong for a lasting, high astringent bitter sweet finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Rich and strong bitter to mouth.

Comments: After Tap 1s disappointment, this organic Tap 4 really kickass: rich smooth body, strong maltyness, big sweetness and strong Cascade hoppiness in floral and bitter grass. Only a couple steps from being a nice Weizenbock, we need strong Hefeweiss like this one. Lovely!

Tolles, frisches Weizen.
Wunderbare Hopfennote, weizentypisch wenig bitter.
Viele Zitrusfrüchte im Aroma und Geschmack. 
Das Malz bildet eine schöne Grundlage, ist aber nicht zu intensiv. 
Toll

Appearance: cloudy medium gold with heavy lees, a short, short-lived ivory head, patchy lacing. (3/5) Aroma: yeasty wheat, apricot, clove. (5/10) Taste: moderate sweet, low bitter, light tart. (5/10) Palate: medium body, soft carbonation, mild tart finish. (3/5)

OK, this one is probably way too old. My defence is, it took some research to puzzle out the date code. (Two lines:12.145 3, and 0227 2724. Im guessing its a Julian code for the 145th day of 2012.) So, Im guessing its more than three years old - way too old for the style. I considered not reviewing it, but screw it: if youre not gonna put a human readable date code on your bottle, thats your decision, live with the consequences. Not terrible as it stands, and I suspect its a lot better fresh, but there it is. (11/20)

Look: amber, hazy with strong white head.

Aroma: sweat malt, ethers, some spices (cloves, nutmeg).
Taste: light swettness with some bitterness and astrigency, light sourness.
Flavour: wheat, cloves, nutmeg, light sweet fruits, ripe apricots, very light grassy and zesty notes.

Good but I expected more hops. Something more like Tap5.

0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: Leicht alkoholisch, würzig, hefig, blumig, babanig, hopfig frisch. Erscheinung: Oranges, trübes Bier, feinporige, weiße, mittelgroße Schaumkrone. Geschmack: Hefig, leicht säuerlich, leichte Bitterkeit. Nachgeschmack: Leicht süßlich, bananig. Gesamt: Gutes Weizen.
Medium white head, cloudy dark orange colour. Flowery/grassy sweet honey and banana aroma. Fruity taste and a lasting, bitter-sweet palate. Good one!

Bottle at home. Aroma is wheat, yeast, a bit grassy, spicy notes, clove, fruits, hoppy notes. Flavour is light sweet and light bitter with a hint of wheaty sour. Body is medium. Refreshing lightly hoppy Hefe.

500ml bottle Apperance : Hazy golden with one finger white head. Aroma of citrus, wheat, yeast, banana, cloves and citrus leaves. Taste: Moderate, light sour citrus and wheat tones. Fres Citrus, Some whear and banana in the back, peppery yeast and cloves. medium bodyl, prickly medium carbonation.

Not the best Schneider beer. This was a bit bland.

Flasche 0,5l: Relativ dunkel, Braun, kräftige Trübung, etwas fester feinporiger Schaum; in der Nase sehr frisch, grüne Hopfennoten, leichte Süße, grüne Bananen, leichte Vanillenoten; im Körper schöne Würze, kräftige Hopfennoten, angenehme Bitterkeit, leichte Süße, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, Grapefruit-Zest; angenehme Bitterkeit im Nachgang
Bottle. Pour is gold with a frothy head, aroma is malty. Taste is malty, bitter, balanced. Good
Flaske. Farven er dybgul og skummet er ok. Aromaen er citrus, hvede gær og banan, medens smagen er citrus, hvede og banan.

500ml bottle as "TAP4 Mein Grünes". Hazy golden with one finger white head. Aroma of citrus, wheat, yeast, banana, cloves and citrus leaves. Taste is fresh citrus with a background of wheat and slught banana as well as peppery yeast and cloves. Smooth medium mouthfeel, prickly medium carbonation snd clean wheat aftertaste.

Reading other reviews, I had high expectations. In fact, I was not disappointed. On tap (for my money, always the best way to appreciate a beer), nice if slightly unusual aroma--words escape me to characterize it. Big foamy head, resistant to settling. First taste is butter-smooth on the tongue... A winner! If Schneider makes a bad beer I havent had it. High quality, nice experience. Recommended.

Yeast green apples esters dominant aroma, some green grass sharp hops aroma and flavor, high to moderate carbonation. Texture is a bit sharp and creamy, sweetish overall. Pleasant but one time try. More than medium body.

Čapované v Beer Time Nitra. Medovo zlatavá, jemne zakalená farba, hustá krémová pena, krúžkuje, aróma zrelého ovocia, banán. Stredná rezkost, plná chut psenicného piva, sušené ovocie, slivky, banán, na konci jemná horkost. Parádna pšenica!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Farbe: typisches trübes dunkelgelb
Schaum: geht, schnell reduziert.
Nase: wenig.
Geschmack: recht spritzig und bitter für ein Weißbier. Abgang ist erdig. Mit Weizen.
Bitterer Nachgeschmack. Nix für mich.
0,5l Flasche "mein Grünes". Kastanienfarben-golden. Fester Schaum. Kräuter, Citrus und Hefe Duft. Geschmack recht herb.

The rich aroma of fruit, partly cured tone, spices, notes of berries and yeast.
Taste surprisingly refreshing with nice berry-wheat sour, light fruit and caramel sweetness, mild hop bitterness with a delicious, yeast and wood tones.
The bitter aftertaste still a great game, lasts long, it harmoniously accompany berry caramel sweetness and acidity.

Couleur jaune trouble, légère mousse. Nez fruité (un peu banane), raisin, légères épices (clou de girofle), note de menthe sauvage et paille. Gout fruité, levuré et épicé, avec banane, clou de girofle, legere menthe le tout bien houblonné frais. Corps legerement onctueux. Fin bien fraiche, épices et herbes. 
Une hefeweizen vraiment superbe, comme dhabitude avec Schneider.
Bottle from Hopology, Nottingham. hazy golden amber colour with a thin white head. Wheat, citrus and yeasty aroma. taste follows these aromas. with a bitter sweet balance.

5cl Bottle.

Pours hazy dark yellow/orange, big and consistent white head.
Classical Banana+Clove, phenolic aroma. Some floral and spicy in here too.
Taste follows the aroma, orange/grapefruit in the aftertaste.
Medium body, med/low carb. 
Well balanced beer, alcohol hidden by the malty sweetness. Spicy aftertaste that lasts...

Bottle from BottleDog, Edinburgh. Hazy bronze body with a thin white head. Great lacing. Aroma of orange peel, soft malts and grass. Flavour of rhubarb crumble, mushy apple and a faint spice on the finish. Medium body with a smooth, creamy texture. Light fizz. Juicy and refreshing.

Amber coloud and a nice head. Nose is subtle but still kind of distinct and the taste is wheat but with so easy floral notes. Nice companion for a meal and not taking all attention. Can be recommended.
Woaw, nice surprise, super sweet floral with banana taste. Kind a light aroma, but taste - outstanding. One of my favorite Weissbier. Great ballanced brew.

Lovely subtle banana, intense wheaty, spices, some clove and light cinnamon, noticeable yeast presence, some light herbal hop touch. Moderate sweet all the way with light bitterness. Bit different, yet well balanced and enjoyable.

Cloudy orange gold color. Large rocky white head. Fruity, metallic wheat malt nose. Hints of tangerine and floral hops. flavor is slightly bitter with notes of bread, clove, banana and grapefruit. More robust and hoppier than traditional Bavarin Weisse beers. Dry peppery finish.

Bottle from Supervalu, Athlone [260915]
Yellow orange, hazy, frothy white head that dissipates, soft lacing
Aroma of yeast, very spicy, cloves, peppery, aromatic, pungent nose
Taste as aroma, some soft sweet malts, soft fruity, more robust than the Original
Palate - Medium carb and body, quite sweet, alcohol very well hidden. Finish a bit dry, peppery spicy linger
Overall - Better than the Original. I like it.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2015 Bue après 4 mois en bouteille. Robe jaunâtre très trouble faisant penser à une compotte de pommes. Fin col de mousse bien persistant. Arômes de levures allemandes, bananes, muscade, sucre brun, citron. Nez très doux et sucré, typique des weizen. En bouche, levures, banane, léger citron. Un bon fond sucré juste à point. Un peu de muscade et de malt. Finale plus amère et légèrement acidulée.

Bottle from the Rugby Tap. Strong clove, phenolic, banana aromas. Taste is creamy malts, some grapefruit bitterness, clove, floral, slight spiciness. Nice finish which lingers. Pretty heavy mouthfeel. Good stuff.
Cloudy and golden colored with a nice and creamy texture. Falvours of banana and sweet oranges. My favorite from Schneider!

Cloudy yellow color, average sized white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, cloves. Taste is the same plus some herby touches and weak hoppy character. Very pleasant stuff. Medium body, average carbonation. OK.-- rated with beerbasher/winphoneEarlier Rating: 9/30/2015 Total Score: 3.4Cloudy yellow color, average sized white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, cloves. Taste is the same plus some herby touches and weak hoppy character. Very pleasant stuff. Medium body, average carbonation. OK.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

500 ml bottle. Cloudy, orange-yellow with good foam. Aroma: cloves and other spices, yeast, banana and a hint of noble hops. Taste combines wheat-malt sweetness with yeast and fruits light acidity, banana with cloves, very good beer.

Bottle to tulip
Ginger ale, fruity esters, raisin bread, wheat, light pepper and yeast. Pours a nice golden colour with a 2 cm white frothy, yet creamy, bright white head. Theres a good amount of effervescence and a smattering of lacing. Taste is sour and wheaty, with apple and a peppery, bitter aftertaste.
ámbar turbio y espuma blanca compacta y duradera. Aromas Intenso de plátano, ligera piel de naranja y clavo. cuerpo medio, sabor dulce de plátano y final seco moderado.

500ml bottle pours semi clear toasted amber with small head. Nose is banana, bread, soft spice. Taste is medium bodied, light mouthfeel, rohnd toasted bread, banana, light spicy grain. Finishes dry, bready crust, toast, touch of honey, banana, cereal, bread.

Golden color with a white head with medium duration. Aroma has notes of wheat with some banana. Flavor is slightly sweet, notes of yeast and wheat are present with some coriander hints. Light sweet final with a creamy mouthfeel.

Maker: Weissbierbrauerei G. Schneider & Sohn, Kelheim, Germany ***
Beer: Schneider Weisse TAP Mein Grünes (aka: Schneiders Wiesen Edel-Weisse) (bottled, unfiltered, 500ml) ***
Style: Hefeweizen (German cloudy wheat) ***
ALC.VOL.: 6.2% ***

"Exclusively brewed in reminiscence of Georg Schneiders privilege of being part of the world famous Munich Octoberfest until 1942 when his renowned "Weisse Brauhaus im Tal, Munich" was destroyed. Enjoy and celebrate! " [brewery note] ***

Colour: Bright hazy orange; big, fluffy white head. ***
Nose: Yeast, some citrus, some banana,m some clove. ***
Texture: Medium body, not watery. Very moderate carbonation. ***
Taste: Surprisingly dry for a Hefe, with a little banana, some citrus, and a lot of hops. Yeast. Towards the middle it gets more bitter(!), with floral hops (clove), the expected yeast notes, some bubblegum. Moderately bitter, yeasty finish with a hint of bananas and clove. After taste is clove. ***

Impressions: Much hoppier than most Bavarian cloudy wheat beers, more bitter than any I have encounted, leaning towards clove notes a lot. Definitly different, but not a cloudy wheat I would drink every day.

Bière de blé limpide, à peine particulée, robe jaune limpide, mousse blanc cassé.

Censée être plus houblonnée quune Weiss classique.
Pas dans ma période weiss mais elle ne me semble pas être à la mesure de ce quelle promettait.
Это - точно, если не самый лучший - то один из лучших хефе. Даже не думайте - берите.
Another excellent offering typical of Schneider. Sweet wheat flavor, some banana, a little bubblegum.
500ml Flasche. Orange mit dichter Trübung und ganzen Partikeln. Eher kleine Schaumkrone. Zitrusaroma mit blumigen Nelkengeschmack. Fruchtig herber Nachgeschmack. Sehr hopfig.
Bottle 50cl, Tap 4. Golden, cloudy with a medium white head. Nice fruits, wheat and straw aroma. Fresh bitter taste, light sweet with a wheat/fruits end. Fav. Tap?

Bottle. Pours a darker golden beer with a big white head on top. Aroma has slight fruity yeasty aromas, some banana and vanilla and a decent malty base. Flavour is medium sweet, full, typical subtle sweet and sticky mouthfeel with decent carbonation. Aftertaste is very malty and sweet. Good one.
500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden, big white Head, leaving lots of lacing. Fruity aroma, banana, yeast. Taste of sweet fruit, banana some orange and hay. Crisp finish.

Pours a hazy orange topped by a finger of fluffy white head showing good retention and lacing properties. The nose is wheaty, fruity. bergamot, ripe mangos, peaches, banana, bubblegum. Faint hops coming through, but they get lost in all that sweetness. The taste stays in the same lane, but the earthy hops get more room to shine. Medium body. Wide wet soil finish. Pretty good. Cheers!

0,5 Flasche von bier-deluxe. Mandarinen-farbend trüb, wenig Kohlensäure. Riecht fruchtig nach Bananen und Maracuja. Schmeckt fruchtig nach Bananen und leicht nach Maracuja, dann leicht trocken hopfig-bitter und wenn ich mich nicht täusche leicht nach Grapefruit. Sehr gelungenes Bier!

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, zmętnione. Piana średniej wysokości, drobna. 
AROMAT: Mało intensywny. Nuty zbożowe, trochę bananów i goździków. W tle świeże nuty ziołowe.
SMAK: Goździki, banan, zboża - standard. Goryczka niska, krótka.

0,5L Bottle "Tap 4 Mein Grünes" from systembolaget - Aroma comes off with tons of really nice banana bread with herbs. Flavor-wise this beer has a nice amount of breadyness with some banana on the back-end. Some clove, herbs and citrus as well. Quite tasty.

0,5 bottle. Pours hazy amber color with high, mostly lasting white head. Complex aroma of clove, spices, wheat, citrus. Flavor is medium to high bitter, light sweet, spicy, slightly sour. Medium to full body, average carbonation.

Slightly hazy orange-yellow pour with large off white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, citrus and faint hops. Taste of wheat, lemon citrus, floral notes and a slight hoppiness to it. Medium bodied, medium carbonation, citrusy hop finish.

Bottle 500ml (Alko)
Hazy orange-yellow color, decent cloudy white head. Wheaty with some citrus in the nose. Medium-bodied. Flavor is dominated by citrusy bitterness with some banana fruityness. Organic character. Cascade with pine and citrus is evident here and makes this quite different than normal standard German hefes - this is more new wave. Myself I prefer more banana fruity than citric hefeweizens.
Pours hazy orange with white head. Aroma is citrus, banana and wheat. Aroma is alcohol, wheat and banana.

500ml bottle. Hazy, deep golden to amber colour with average, fairly lasting and lacing, off-white head. Yeasty, wheaty aroma notes of banana, and clove, herbal hoppy overtones with a touch of orange. Taste is moderately sweet wheat malty, yeasty spicy and herbal hoppy, hints of banana, intense notes of clove. Already too rich in content to be called "refreshing". Good.

Das Bio-Weizen ist orange-braun trüb. Geruch nach Banane, aber auch Zitrus. Geschmacklich hebt sich das Bier durch eine deutliche Bitternote ab, die auch Aromen von Grapefruit mitbringt.
Gut!
Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is yeast and grass with light citric notes. Taste is yeasty and bitter with refreshing crisp finish.
Schöne Trübe, leider kein Schaum. In der Nase lecker Banane, ein wenig Gras. Im Trunk süffig, sehr bananig, im Abgang süß, etwas bitter, Zimt. Ausgezeichnet ausgewogenes und dennoch komplexes Weizen.

L:
-pours a cloudy deep-golden colour with a medium,creamy,white head
-High carbonation visible
S:
-lime,lemon,white pepper,coriander,rosemaryn,elderflower,bubble gum,clove,ginger
-smells like a field full of herbs
T:
-Follows the nose plus a mild hop bitterniss
F:
-medium body,high but soft carbonation
-unfortunately pretty warming for a Beer in the low 6s
O:
Schneider Weisse does amazing things with their Beers.
This is just another example.

Fresh and floral beginning. Nice fresh clove, not too fruity with nice herbal hops on a moderate bitter basis. Round and fresh, herbal floral hops also in the clove-like, Weizen-smooth aftertaste. Nice.

Appearance: Hazy yellow golden, some fizzy white head.
Aroma: Wheat and banana.
Taste: Wheat, banana, sweetness. Slight citrus. Good.
Bought: Trade with Erzengel - thanks!, 500 ml
Info: 7/6-2015, 79/300M, BB: 21/8-2015

Bottle from Humulus et Fermentum, Heisdorf. Pours a hazy golden yellow with typical weizen head and yeast clouds in the glass. Nose is yeasty, cloves, fruits, flour, lemon. Taste is surprisingly bitter and hoppy, followed by malty sweetness. Finish is again bitter, somewhat orangy. Mouthfeel is smooth and silky. Very interesting weizen, very atypical, but good.

From the Weisse Brauhaus. Very hazy orange color with big white extremely dense head. Nice hoppiness in addition to the original Weizen base. Aroma hops have been here! Some citrus, maybe litchi. Taste is Weizen with a very green grassy hop kick and a nice bitterness. Perfect silky mouthfeel. A pleasant Frühlingswiese/Grünzeug aftertaste. Nicely balanced, superb drinkability. Probably one of the most interesting Bavarian brews. It?s very different. I would not have thought that Schneider can still surprise me.

Bottle, 500mL. Home. A pale yellow beer with orange hues ; few bubbles ; medium white head with a poor retention. Herbal aroma, cereal, fruit (litchi, citrus), floral ; light clove and vanilla ; skunky. Medium sweet, light to medium dry bitter ; refreshing. Light body, thin texture, soft carbonation ; prickly ; dry fruity herbal finish. Overall, OK ; very drinkable ; refreshing ; a bit puzzled by this aroma ; I will have to taste another bottle to check this skunky note.

50 cl bottle. Pours hazy golden brown with medium head, good lacing. Aromas of banana, cellar and fresh bread. Taste is fresh, well-balanced, good bitterness. Lots of carbonation, oily palate. Aftertaste is fresh and a bit bitter. Great weizze.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow-orange. Large, lively white head. Aroma is banana, yeast, bubblegum. Flavor is more bubblegum, banana, sweet beginning with a slightly bittering end. The head is less substantial feeling than it looks. Highly carbonated, but not sharp. Long lasting hop flavor that is a welcome addition to the German yeast styles. An excellent one from Schneider.

Bottle from Systembolaget
golden, cloudy, white foam, dough, hay, banana, spruce, grass, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
Really nice and refreshing. Really hot day and this was perfect for it. Really good.

Bottle, traded with McTapps and MichaelAwesome, thanks! Quite aggressive, hop-forward (grassy) aroma, backed by clove and only little banana. Soft mouthfeel, not really intense in terms of flavour. Heavier than a regular hefe but then again - lacking the depth of a proper weizenbock. Quite nice but as a middle-ground beer not entirely convincing.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours cloudy amber with a white froth. Good easy drinking mid strength wheat beer. Plenty of banana, clove, very fresh. Good stuff.
Dark gold with medium creamy head. Classic weissen aroma with notes of bread, banana and herbs. Very refreshing with some bitterness and some sweetness.
Hazy golden with a white head - wheat aroma - good body with wheat flavours and some hints of yests - The wheat flavours goes into a sweet finish - This was nice

Hazy, orange colour with medium head. Moderate aroma of banana, some cloves, some grassy bitterness and quite strong yeastness. Taste is medium sweet, low sour and low bitter. Over medium carbonation. Low to medium body. Not bad, but Ive expected more.
This bloke down the Pig used to sell taps. Lets call him Dave because that was his name. If hed sold Tap 4 Id have been more interested. Cracking beer. Tap that...and party.

Unclear amber colored beer with a white head, high carbonation.
Tastes like bread, citrus, malt, hops, wheat, orange, banana, herbs
A Hefeweizen but now with some more herbs and hops.
Bottle 50cl, Geers. Pours hazy, slightly orange. Dense white/yellow head. Citrus tangy weissen nose. Bread & toast. Spicy aromas. Well carbonated quite slick. Good
Shared bottle at a bar poured a cloudy golden colour with a white head. Aroma of banana, graines, gut grass juicy citrus, yeast, cloves, lots of banana coming trough in the taste. Enjoyable weisen

Basement aromas is full herbs, ginger, at a moment bready and nuts and 
, bread, caramel with bubblegum
Taste is caramel, brady with banana and leaves. Can fell banana and butterscotch in taste, but aftertaste is a bit to alcoholic. Superb beer.
UPDATED: MAY 18, 2017 Light brown colour with compact creamy head. Aroma of citrus, some herbs, bananas, lavander etc. Similar is the flavour with excelent hoppy notes. Very good weizen beer.

bananas and cloves in the aroma with hints of fruity tartness. The cloves dominant. Appearance is a cloudy gold with a large head with excellent retention. Flavor favors cloves over the banana. Notes of bubblegum are present. Malt tastes bready. Mouthfeel is medium high and creamy with medium high carbonation. Overall, it's an ok hefeweizen. I'd prefer more banana though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.5l bottle. Hazy deep orange body, quickly collapsing white head. Huge banana notes in the aroma with some peach, honey and some cloves. Taste of banana, lemon zest, cloves and grass. The carbonation is too weak, but still a nice weizen.
Flaske fra systembolaget. Gylden, noe uklar farge. Moderat karbonert med hvit skumtopp. Smaker banan, nellik, hvete, gjær, gress og noe sitrus. Ganske god

50cl Bottle at Delirium Café. Hazy deep golden-amber colour, creamy thick off-white head. Aroma of creamy sweet banana, light spicy, some honey, quite hoppy, grassy and herbal. Flavour is grassy, banana, herbal, some lavender, honey, clove, firm hoppy grassy herbal bitter finish, some citrus. Medium bodied, creamy. My new favourite Hefeweizen. Great.

500ml bottle as "Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes" at BeerHouse Sviblovo in Moscow. Pours cloudy amber with a big white head. Aroma is banana, clove, citrus. Taste is banana, malts, wheat and yeast.
Excellently balanced beer and richly flavoured. Surprisingly well hopped. Pure and perfected
Aroma is fresh from bananas and wheat and herbs. Pretty dry in the mouth, but at the same time a mild fuzzy sensation. Esters and banana walk hand in hand towards the sunset.

Bottle from Systemet. 
Very cloudy/yeasty. A bit weak taste but nevertheless, a very nice Weissenbier. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhoneEarlier Rating: 9/27/2013 Total Score: 3Bottle from Systemet. 
Very cloudy/yeasty. A bit weak taste but nevertheless, a very nice Weissenbier. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy honey-amber with a fluffy lasting white head and moderate carbonation. Aromas of orange, flowers, banana, coriander, bubblegum and a bit of pepper. Taste begins with slightly drying burnt orange and pepper before a juicy citrus wash kicks in. Finishes with a bit of banana and some floral notes. Lightly peppery aftertaste. Really good stuff.

Cloudy orange-gold with small white head that persists as skim.
The nose is banana, clove, a hint of vanilla, but also herbal/grassy notes.
On the palate, it strongly hits all those hefeweizen notes, plus a passing bit of bubblegum and a consistent spicy, peppery tone that adds a further dimension.
Medium bodied and smooth, with a well-gauged bit of bitterness, this turns out to be good company for Thai food.
-n Munish. The aroma is banana, gum, light hops. The appearance is hazy yellow, wjite ehad. The flavor is very spicy, hoppy. The fiinish is bananan gum, spicy. Awesome.

13.5.2014. Very hazy yellow-orange with noticeable yeast coming from the bottle. Attracting aroma of banana, citrus, yeast, which are also present in taste. Nice, a bit stronger and fuller wheat beer than many lighter counterparts.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours hazy blond with low-medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of bananas, fruits, spices. Taste is of fruits, bananas, bitterness, spices. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Nice silky texture. Refreshing. Overall: Very tasty. Awesome palate. Feels fresh.

Bottle (500 ml). Bought @ SAQ. Split 2-ways with Minderbinder.

Appearance: Hazy yellow/golden with a small white head and some lacing. 

Aroma: Banana, cloves, german yeast, herbal/leafy presence, peppery notes and wheat. 

Taste: Taste is moderately spicy (cloves, peppery notes) with bananas, light acidity, wheat and herbal presence.

Palate: Medium body. Medium to high carbonation. Prickly. Moderately spicy finish. 

Overall: Very good German Hefeweizen. Well balanced despite the place taken by the spiciness. Tasty and quenching. I would be curious to try a fresh bottle of this.

0,5 l bottle from craftbeerstore, bottled 19/12/2014 (as "Mein Grünes"). Murky, brownish orange with a huge, foamy, slowly diminishing, white head. Heavy aroma of banana and cloves with notes of vanilla. Taste is banana and cloves, maybe some hints of vanilla. Medium long, rather bitter finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Typical hefeweizen, but a very aromatic and good one. I expected a little more exciting hop aroma but do not want to moan too much. Thumbs up for the organic approach.

0.5l bottle from Warners at the Bay. Pours (with adding the yeast, of course) cloudy yellowish brown with a big head. Fresh wheaty nose, not much bananas. A bit more bananas in the taste, but still very refreshing and tasty. Clearly more refined than Tap 1 or Tap 7.

(Schneider Georg Schneiders Wiesen Edel-Weisse) As Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes, 200ml teku glass from the tap, at tap takeover, Cafe Caspar, Arnhem.
Very hazy body, dark orange in colour, with a tall thick off-white head, with great retention, leaving medium lacing on the glass.
Aroma of clove, plenty of other spices, ripe pears.
Nice taste with clove, other spices, very yeasty though.
A numbing feeling on the palate, good carbonation, medium body.
Good.
Relatively clear for the style. Only slightly hazy. Aroma is banana, cloves and perfume. Slightly flowery taste. Reminiscent of a hefeweizen but has a nice hoppy bite on the end

50cl bottle shared with 2 friends.
Thin white head. Hazy blond pour. very easy drinking.
At Schneider tap take-over with Douberd. Found this the best Schneider that evening, overall. Lasting creamy foam head, strong grass aroma and taste. Loved it. (Velp 201502)

Grumlig mörk orange nästan brun öl med fet vit krona. Älskar veteöl och det här är inget undantag, riktigt bra! Doftar sött och vete, jäst, malt, frukt med bla lite banan. Smak är relativt lik doft. Mild men smakrik, bra sötma, beska och eftersmak. Flaska från Systembolaget. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Barwa: złota, może delikatnie w kierunku ciemnozłote, zmętnione.
Piana: biała, obfita, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa, trwała.
Zapach: intensywny banan i goździk. 
Smak: bardzo orzeźwiające, głównie wyczuwalne nuty goździka, bardzo przyjemna goryczka o przyprawowym charakterze. 
Wysycenie: jak na styl przystało wysokie.

Bottle. Pours murky orange with thin white head. Wheat beer aroma. This is probably a solid wheat beer choice but it's not my style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2016 No surprise that another Schneider weisse beer is delish, but this is really unique. Lacks the typical banana and clove heavy aroma and taste. Much more dry and hoppy. Not bitter hops but fresh and floral. Really enjoyable, but not as good as the Blonde and Original.

From 0,5l bottle, BBD: 28.9.2015, Pours nice deep cloudy orange golden liquid, medium creamy white head, Aroma: light banana, light wheat, floral, very fresh spring aroma, citrus, light clove, hints of strawberries, Taste: light to medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light shour, fruity, bit sweetish, banana, clove, citrus, strawberry, very fresh, easy drinkable, but at the same time very tastfull and harmonic. Palate: light bodz, creamy texture, soft carbonation, long fruity bitter aftertase, Overall: verz good, very drinkable, harmonic fruity bavarian wheet,

#4400. 500 ml. bottle @ home from Dranken Geers. Bottled on 27/09/2014. Clear golden, solid egg-white head, one finger big. Looks like something out of a beer commercial. Nose is fluffy banana &air refresher lemon, light ginger (interesting), very fruity DE yeast. Taste of DE yeast, banana, faintly floral, air refresher lemon, ginger, faint lemon hops, faintest of candy sweetness that invites you to drink more. There is something utterly drinkable about this one. Light wheat body. I just could drink this forever. Quite a big bit better than the Original for me. This isnt phenomenal or anything but this is the definition of a delicious & infinitely quaffable beer.

Im Auftritt eher unspektakulär überrascht dieses Weißbier vor allem am Gaumen. Man merkt im Abgang den höheren Alkoholgehalt und die Komplexität einer einfach runden und gelungenen Weißbierspezialität.

Schneiders regular hefeweizen (TAP 7) is one of my all-time favorite examples of the style. From what I can tell, Weisen Edel-Weisse (TAP 4) appears to be more or less the same recipe, but brewed with all-organic ingredients. Maybe because its organic or maybe its because this bottle was about five months old at the time, but this beer isnt as good as the regular edition. Not that its bad, in fact, its got all the things I prefer in the style, just not as strong as Id prefer.

I poured a 500ml bottle into a weizen glass. It was bottled on 8/2/14 and cost $4.29 ($0.25 per ounce).

Appearance: Dark golden hue; only slightly hazy (due to the age of the bottle, a lot of the yeast was caked to the bottom of the bottle). Plenty of visible spastic carbonation. Pours to a large, white, foamy head which retains well but doesnt leave much lacing.

Smell: Milder than most, with the standard banana bread aroma, though it seems to have more of a spice character than usually found in the style.

Taste: The best way to describe the palette here would be to picture a typical authentic German hefeweizen and then weaken it a little. Id probably chalk the mildness up to the fact the bottle was rather old at the time. Id like to think a fresher serving would be much more robust. Also, instead of relying heavily on the banana character from the yeast esters, it ops for Noble hop spice. Theres notes of lemonpeel or saison-like black pepper, which is nice, but its still too mild. Whats interesting about this brew is that its actually made with Cascade hops  an American varietal. They seem to impart a subtle grassy character to the beer, but dont do much in the way of bitterness or piney flavor (nor should they considering the style). Overall, this is a fine brew, but this brewery makes better examples of the style.

Drinkability: Schneider Weisen Edel-Weisse is refreshing while in the mouth, and finishes clean, which is nice. Though it should have much more body and robustness for a beer with a 6.2% ABV. This drinks and feels like something much more overtly sessionable. In fact, the thinness of the body and the mildness of the palette is a bit distracting, honestly. Still, its an easy beer to drink and a single serving is satisfying.

Good lord this stuff is drinkable (as no one before has noted). This isnt a young bottle so there isnt much hop aroma other than the scant remains of some citrus and flowers, but theres lots of wheaty goodness. Taste-wise its like a straight weizen up-front, with this incredibly crisp, refreshing finish with lingering banana bread and spice, with just enough bitterness to balance the alcohol warmth. Why havent I been drinking this stuff for years?

Bottle at Pure Bar and Kitchen, Birmingham. Super sessionable. Weisse, but smooth and non gassy. Snakey flavour of vanilla and perhaps le banane. Reassuring on the old throat as it descends. Of course good.

500ml bottle purchased at the LCBO in Peterborough, Ontario. Golden-yellow in colour with a long lasting white head, good size, excellent lacing. Aroma of spices, bananas, yeast, floral hops, citrus. Flavour of yeast upfront, spices, lemon citrus, very floral, lightly sweet. Sweet mouthfeel, medium body, moderate carbonation. Finishes yeasty, long, lightly bitter. I dont think that I have ever finished a beer so fast. So refreshing, fantastic stuff. I could drink pints of this all day during the summer.

Barwa pomarańczowa, mętna, ze średnią nietrwałą pianą. Aromat o dziwo dość tradycyjny, pszeniczno-goździkowo-owocowy. O ile jednak w zapachu amerykański chmiel ledwo zaznaczony w postaci domyślnych cytrusów i brzoskwini, o tyle w smaku owoce są wyraźniejsze. Czuć grejpfruta, mandarynkę, morele, jeżyny, kwiaty i delikatną chmielową goryczkę. Gdzieś tam majaczy mi belgijskie blanche.
This is a weissbier more into the clove spicy style, it lacks of banana. Smells delicious, floral and spicy.
Bottle 50 cl. Pours hazy yellow with big frothy head. Notes of clover, bananas, grass. Pretty good stuff.- beerbasher

From brewers droop, Bristol 
500 ml bottle [BBE: 2015.08.14] 
Blood alc: 0 

Pours hazy Amber with a very white head of medium Fine bubbles. The Big coriander and spice whiff promises excitement. Flavour is slightly sweet with a tangy background and overall ?raw? flavour which works perfectly with the sweetness. The hop bitterness is unshy, although only as present as would be ideal and balances the sweet malty character perfectly. The end brings a lingering banana and fruit taste with hints of toffee which is most welcome and even maybe more pleasant, as it?s so gentle, than when the beer is actually on the tongue. 
I just can?t really fault this as it?s a fantastic example of it?s style and shouldn?t really be any different. The only reason it doesn?t get 100% is because it?s not as exciting as my perfect, unrivallable beer would be. Perhaps my favourite Schneider so far but I?d just have to compare it side by side with Aventinus to make sure! ;) 

=94% 
Great job!

500 ml bottle from Ammersin 5, Vienna.
Dark orange to brown, cloudy body, with a big, quite stable, creamy, white head.
Aroma of wheat, yeast, spices, orange, banana and citric hops.
Tastes of wheat, spices, banana, orange, some vanilla, slight alcohol and even more fruity, citric and quite bitter hops.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes quite bitter, citric, zesty, spicy and a bit wheaty.

Tasty! A slightly stronger and surprisingly hoppy Hefeweizen. Doesnt drink as easy as other beers of this style, but you get loads of full flavours instead. Another great, characteristic Weizen by Schneider Weisse!
Dorée avec des reflets orangés, trouble, bon col épais. Nez levuré, de banane et gomme balloune. Goût fruité de banane et encore de gomme balloune, de blé, dépices et une touche citronnée.
Bottle 50cl. Small white layer. Hazy peach color. Aroma is rottening fruit, yeast, apples. Taste is sweet, fruit, nettles and wheat.

Bottle. Brown hazy color with thick white head. Aroma yeast, wheat, caramel fruits and banana. Taste is a bit sweet with nice bitter finish. Nice full body. Flavors of caramel, lemon, fruits, yeast and spices. Excellent hefeweizen once again.

I think I may have misinterpreted this one somehow. I could´t find myself enjoying it. Unbalanced, a bit to sweet, and not refreshing enough to make me really want to enjoy it on a hot summer day. Also a bit too heavy body, and 500ml bottle is a bit overload.

0,5l bottle. Hazy golden color with long lasting white head. Aroma is fruits, banana, wheat, spices, yeast and some citrus hops. Taste is sweet and spicy. Medium body and average carbonation. Overall its great beer with very nice aroma.

Mętne równomiernie, lekko złote, babelków gazu brak, piana bardzo słaba, nietrwała, po zaniku nie zostaje po niej najmniejszy ślad. Aromat drożdżowo-pszeniczno-bananowy, lekko czuć świeżość owoców. W smaku pełne, az rozchodzi się równomiernie po całej jamie ustnej. W smaku rześkie, goryczkowe. Lekko ściągające, goryczka zalega.
500ml bottle. Hazy yellow/copper body with a large white head. Malty, with notes of wheat, lime, spices and yeast.

Hefeweizen épique. Draft dagrumes avec quelque herbes,banane sucré,levure autentique.,pain aussi.Très pétillante,petit aspect crémeux,bananes,un peux damande,super rafraichissant final douce,et sèche, un classique

500ml bottle from Gourmondo.de. Cloudy brownish yellow colour, creamy large persistent off-white head, good lacing. Heavily malty aroma of wheat and hay, moderate, herbal, lemony and floral hops with moderate overripe banana notes. Taste is initally moderately sweet and slightly bitter and acidic, moderately bitter and slightly meaty finish with an astringent feel. Medium body, slick texture, lively carbonation. Better than average wheat beer, bit more hops than usual.
Nice cloudy beer filling up the glass as I pour, crisp aroma. Head fizzes out quickly but doesnt matter. Mildly bitter taste -- very good. Great.
Pours cloudy copper. Aroma has yeast, banana, grass. Just a hint of bitterness that quickly fades away. A very nice wheat beer for certain.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 15A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch 1666060514. AROMA: wheat profile with vanilla and clove notes with a slight banana aroma. no hop aromas. APPEARANCE: deep gold color and hazy. large white head with good retention. TASTE: sweet wheat background with a complementary vanilla character. odd undescribable flavor. persistent medium-low bitterness and a medium-dry finish. PALATE: medium-light body and high carbonation. OVERALL: altough it has a nice aroma, there is an odd flavour present. but it is still a good weizen.

14.188 stamped on this.
Glass: Tired Hands wine glass.
Appearance: Murky opaque sunburst body with a tall, strong and dense white head.
Aroma: Aroma is mildly sweet with banana, hints of perfume and prominent clove. Nicely balanced and good strengthed.
Taste: Light lemon, crisp straw, mild banana and a perfume and clove finish that is prominent. I like this until the finish, I think its a bit too much. Nice beer nonetheless.
Palate: Creamy bodied with moderate to high carbonation.
Overall: Very nice hefe at a great price. I really enjoy this and think that its a necessary try for those who like the style.

"not quite up to par with the regular weisse (possibly the best out there) or the brooklyner hopfenweisse, but this was a solid, slightly hoppy, bubble gummy wheat beer nonetheless. id choose the standard over this, but glad i tried it."

Cloudy orange color, medium sized white head which drops to a minimal sized quite fast. Aroma is banana, yeast, hops, wheat, spices and some orange. Bittersweet taste. Medium body, average carbonation. Bitter finish. In short, weaker version of Schneider Tap 5.(Vrutak 0,5l bottle)
Poured from bottle. Aroma of citrus. Slightly cloudy golden with a white head. A light bitter/sweet taste. Medium body and creamy texture. Another great beer from this brewery, even my wife likes it.

A - Pours muddy yellow with 1 finger fluffy white head. S - nose is wet dog, belgian yeast, candied sugar, wet hay, light citrus. M - medium body with a nice mf. Warmth on the end. T - candied sugar, citrus, wet dog and hay. Clover and candied citrus. Some spices and belgian yeasts. O nice drinkin beer

On tap. Pours a near clear light gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has notes of earthy wheat with a hint of smoke and underlying clove and banana notes. Flavor has a combination of earthy and sweet wheat with a hint of banana and clove.
500ml bottle pours a slightly hazy yellow amber color with a bit of head. Mild easy going wheat beer. Crisp flavor.

In bottiglia. Aroma erbaceo, banana e chiodi di garofano. Lerbaceo ruba spazio ai classici aromi da weizen ma dona un aroma + piacevole. al palato leggera nota riscaldante alcoolica, banana e finale di nuovo erbaceo, elegante, senza eccessi. Weizen godiile con un tocco in + dato dellerbaceo.

500ml bottle. Pours a cloudy copper color with a small head and spotty lacing. Aroma of fruit, yeast, banana and grassy. Taste of fruit sweetness with banana and yeast. Mild bitterness and a dry finish. Moderate body, quite smooth and flavorful. Enjoyable beer.

Draft at Groove Beer e Grill, Matera. Pours cloudy golden amber with a thick white head. Aroma of yeast, plastercine and light biscuity malt. Flavor is light moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Lovely example of the style.

500 mml bottle tasted on 09/09/2014. Hazy golden colour with a persistent and foamy white head. Aroma of hops, banana and cereals. Taste is sweet with the cereals and the citrus notes. The water is a problem for the intensity of the aftertaste. Next one please!
Bottle 0.5l from local Alko, Helsinki. BBE 2015.05.03. Colour is deep orange with small thick white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, banana, wheat, yeast and malts. Very good body.

Blanche allemande achetée à la SAQ. Bière dorée, effervescente, coiffée dune belle mousse blanche. Nez de fruits, de levure, de pain ; en bouche, cest rafraichissant à souhait, goûteux. Levures, traces de bananes, finale un peu sèche peut-être, bref une hefeweizen qui trace les lignes directrices du style et à laquelle il serait difficile de donner des défauts, sauf peut-être son manque de singularité. Cheers!

Bottled. An organic beer, hear hear. Overall a fantastic hefe weizen. The aroma features besides bananas a lot of citrusy or exotic ftuit. Golden, orange and copper color with a thick white head. Taste is more fresh bitter fruits and hops and less bananas and wheat. Bitter hops and fruit aftertaste. Although 6.2% abv this beer is very refreshing.
UPDATED: AUG 23, 2014 Aroma of banana, agrumes. Strong and fine head, light taste of malt, banana, wheat. Quick-fading palate, sweet and clean in the end. One of my favourite hefeweizen.
500ml bottle, hazy golden brown pour, nice caramel malt backone, massive banana flavours, with floral hop, balances nicely and the finish is moderate bitter. Full body, lively carbonation.
Great golden color with medium to low white head. Nice weisse and fruity aroma. Refreshing. The tase is sour/bitter. Meium body with thin/liverly palate and long bitter finish
Unbelivable hefeweizen. Great mix of oldschool hefeweizen with several varieties of hops. Scent and taste of fruits, honey, grass and malt.
Pours with little head, smellnis very gentle and a little bit sour. Blurry appearance. Taste is very aggressive and carbonated, with a gentle sour aftertaste.
Une bien bonne blanche. Dune couleur orangée voilée avec une bonne effervescence. Nez de fleurs et de bananes. Goût acidulé aux notes dépices et dagrumes.

Bottle. Pours cloudy, yellow with stable white head. In aroma clove, banana, lemon. In taste clove, banana, lemon, malty and bready plus some acidity (a little), low bodied, low bitterness. Fizzy carbonation. Very refreshing hefe.
Blonde dorée. Légèrement voilé. Céréale. Blé. Levuré. Bien épicé. Légèrement florale/ Houblonné. Un peu d'agrume. Bien.

50 cl bottle. Pours hazy, pale golden. Malts, citrus and a hint of herbs like coriander and basil in aroma and taste. Really nice composition, with freshness, complex taste notes, dryness and peppers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draught at Apex. Hazy golden color, in an official glass. Aroma is spicy clove, banana, wheat, and sweet grass. Taste is similar to aroma, with banana bread, wheat, and bittersweet grass notes. Mouthfeel is fizzy and yet substantial, with lingering banana bread notes in the finish.
Decent head, lots of bubbles in the beer. Otherwise normal hefeweizen look but this is more brownish coloured. Fresh, hard and crisby taste. I would really advise you to try this out!

Hazy amber colour, with big dense head, irregular. Small is banana, spices and citrus.Taste is less fruity than usual weizen, more dry and less sweet, and maybe also with some alcohol "taste". 
Anyway refreshing and a very good weizen.

The body has a yellowish tan body which is cloudy. On top of the beer sits a tall creamy white head. It fades out quickly and leaves just a small ring of foam at the edge. Lacing is minimal and slick. Its aroma is citrusy, bready, wheat like and very fruity like over an ripe banana. It has a good medium body with some mild bready malt sweetness and wheat tang mixed with spicy almost nutty yeast. This is all in good balance with a very light touch of citrus and spicy hops. The palate is smooth with plenty of soft carbonation to keep it easy drinking.
A light brown hazy beer with a white foam. Yeast and banana on the nose. Yeast and herbs in the flavors. Semi dry. Medium body. Ok.

Bottle in Samo Pivo in Belgrade. Pours cloudy light yellow, tick white gassy foam. Nose: banana, lemon (massive), malts and a bit of grass. Mouth: lemon juice, apricot, banana and malty. Dry overall feel, strange and positively surprising wheat beer.

Shared a 50cl bottle from AllDrink (Trier). Pours a cloudy brownish orangish colour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is banana, clove, bubblegum and yeast. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is well balanced medium sweet and medium bitter. Overall, a fantastic wheat beer.

Hazy orange gold pour. Thick soapy white head.
Ar of clove lemon and banana. Malted wheat.
Flavour is banana, wheat, pilsner like biscuit quality.
