Tuoksu samean hiivainen kuten ulkonäkökin. Maku vehnäoluelle tyypillisen pehmeän samettinen ja sakeahko.
0,5l bottle as Schneider Tap 4 from Alko, Turku. Pours hazy deep yellow with a high head. Aroma is malts, wheat and yeast. Flavor is malts, wheat and yeast. Nice body. Pretty decent hefeweizen.
Oklar, halm färgad med ett tätt, vitt skum. Doft: Mycket söt skumbanan, blommor, burk persika, lukt sudd, vete öls dofter. Smak: Som doft fast mer "ölig".

aroma: sweet, slightly ester / banana, green, grassy, pear, complex
appearance: hazy pale to amber colour, nice frothy head
taste: sour, citrus, apple, green, refreshing, very nice one
Fantastic weizen. Dark orange color, very hazy. Head of course is beautiful, big and fluffy. Perfect taste of banana, mango and other yellow tropical fruits.

@ Nedre Mölla 28/6-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Yeast, banana, Jenka(the chewing gum)/tiger balm. Taste: Yeast, banana, some sweetness and wheat notes. Body is medium, the finish is dry with notes of yeast.

500ml bottle (Cudo na Kiju, Warsaw)
Slightly different from the typical full german hefeweissen. This is grassier, has way more bittering hops, which is good. Also has an odd saisony roughness to it, which is less good. Herbal finish. Interesting hoppy weisse.
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 On tap at Zlý Časy. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Taste and aroma are lots of yeast, citrus and sweet bananas.

Bottle at home from backlog notes 07. Pours a hazy golden orange color with a medium sized fluffy white head. The aroma and flavor have wheat, yeast, cloves, banana, some nice citrus character, light bodied, but flavorful for the style.

Cervesa bona, bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Cerveza buena. bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.

500ml bottle as "Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes". Hazy orange color. Sour, diacetyl, wort in aroma. Grassy, grainy, straw, wheat, faint dead yeast in taste. Quite high carbonation. Medium bitterness.

@ Röhällavägen. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget (23:-). Sweet malty and a bit fruity with notes of wheat and yeast, some spiciness, banana, medium body. The finish is dry with notes of wheat and yeast.
Large bottle from Alko. Hazy yellow color, quite large white head. Aromas of wheat, banana, yeast and hint of citrus fruits. Wheaty taste, yeast, lemon. Delicious wheat with summery feat.
malty aroma with faint clove. golden and hazy with a real good head. taste has slight peppery and clove notes.

Bottle, 12/06/13, thanks bluus. Pours a hazy yellowy orange with a decent-sized, white head. Aroma is banana, peach, fruit esthers, bubblegum. Taste is citrus and banana. Some clove and yeast. Strong carbonation, fairly medium. Alright, but not my style. Nice and refreshing summer drink though.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2014 Cloudy orange color with white persistent head. Very spicy aroma, not much banana, but cloves and bubblegum. Medium/full body. Spicy taste as well, hoppy and with banana hints. Slightly bitter finish. Very refreshing and complex.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy golden colour with a large, frothy, long lasting off-white head. Sweet aroma of banana, wheat, fruit, yeast and spice. Sweet flavour has notes of banana, yeast, caramel malt, citrus, spice ending with a light wheaty note. Medium body with a creamy, oily texture and soft carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 Notes of ginger, orange peel, medium sweetness, hints of banana. Another great example of the style, regularly available and at a reasonable price. Will presumably be overlooked by all the newcomer drinkers looking to trade for rarwales immediately.

Bottle. Hazy, yellow-brown, with a small head. Aromas of bananas, citrus and wheat. Taste is a bit sweet, nice bitterness. Palate is great, good carbonation and a fine finish with citrus, ginger and orange. Remembers slightly of an IPA in the finish.

Great refreshining Weißbier, absolutely over the top!
50cl at home. Pale orange with a medium white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Good balance between sweet and bitter. Wheat, grass, citrus, yeast and herbs. A nice refreshing weizen.

Nice beer, nothing too fancy. Easy to drink and goes well with grilled food.

Perinteinen vehnäolut. Sakea. Kuumaan keliin liiankin maukas. Mutta sadonkorjuun aikaan hyvinkin.

Hazy yellow-to-orange looks with thick and everlasting head. Some lacing sticks on the sides. Aroma has wheat, banana and lots of fruits. Taste is fresh with wheat, fruits and ending with nice bitterness. Medium body and high carbonation. Excellent hoppy weissbier.
Really decent hefeweizen, pure and aromatic taste. Just the way it is meant to be, what more can I day?
Tap 4 Neon Grunes. Jag kan inte hjälpa det, men den här smakar tandläkare. Tydlig smak av ingefära. Mycket smak.
Uklar brun farge med høyt hvitt skum. Lukter godt banan og noe krydder. Frisk og god og med en nydelig bittersøt avslutning. Liker:-)

0.5 l bottle from Alko. Yellow/orange colour, big head and lots of bubbles. Lively carbonation with taste of banana, but also hops, which is not typical for this style. This is might get dangerous - it is very easy to drink but afterwards you will feel the alcohol.
Poured into a tall wheat beer glass, very cloudy reddish-yellow. Taste is overtly citrus.

Pours a fairly dark very hazy orange body with a white head that settles down rather quickly. Nose has yeast, herbs and some floral notes. Taste is surprisingly bitter and hoppy with a long dry finish. Carbonation is fairly high and the mouthfeel is fairly rich. The taste also has a distinct alcoholic bite. This is decent but overall feels a little unbalanced (too hoppy) and alcoholic.

500ml bottle. Matte orange with soapy white head. Solid lacing. Full nose of pears, bananas (and their companion, cloves), and mild wheat. Taste follows, with bubblegum sweetness added on. Finish is crisp. Medium body. Well carbonated. This is flawless style execution.

Pours a cloudy burnt orange. Good head at first quickly dissipates to pencil thin white rim. Good carbonation from the center bottom of the glass. Slight orange and spice aroma and taste, with a dry slightly bitter finish. Not much stick on the lacing A 
nice beer that is better consumed with food Their hefe's are considerably closer to style.
Blanc nuageux avec une mousse blanche moyenne. Larôme fruitée du levure. Un peu plus fruitée et pétillante que habitude pour le style.

.5l at Samo Pivo, Belgrade. Bright orange, slight haze. Great white foam. Sweet, soft hop aroma. Very fresh tasting, green, fresh floral hops. Clean, very green. Yeast stained the foam. Soft medicinal sweetness and menthol, tooth paste, but not really bad. Fun
This is a great Old World beer. Malty and earthy aroma. Excellent flavor. I could drink a lot of this and be pretty happy.

500 ml bottle packaged on 7/29/13 (date code 13.210) poured into ceramic weizen glass. Appearance is difficult to judge since the glass is opaque, but appears to be pale golden colored with a pillowy white head. Aroma is grassy and citrusy with a trace of clove-like esters. Taste is bright and herbaceous with citrusy tartness and a slightly bitter hop finish. There are some trace metallic notes present, but not to an unpleasant degree. Palate seems slightly flat, but refreshing.
nice hefeweizen, typical aromas of cloves/nutmeg, straightforward, plain in taste, tart and refreshing.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2015 Cloudy golden-amber, ivory head. Aroma is mostly spicy - cloves and peppery hops. The little malt sweetness that comes through joins the hops to create some nice fruity citrus notes. The taste is quite hoppy, zesty and bitter, almost no traditional wheat malt flavour. Very little esters too. Smooth mouthfeel. Not what one would expect from a weissbier, but a great beer nevertheless. Id call it a weizen-pilsner.

06-MAY-2014.  BOTTLE 50CL.

Look: cloudy orange with a big off-white head with good retention.
Aroma: quite hoppy, grassy and lemony, wheat spicy sourness.
Taste: wheat tartness and nice lemony hops. 7/4/7/4/14=3.6

Barwa: złocista, wyraźnie zmętniona. Piana biała obfita, drobno pęcherzykowa, ładnie oblepiająca szkło. 

Aromat: banany, guma balonowa, goździki. Wyczuwalna słodycz, lekki karmel oraz nuta alkoholowa. Do tego akcenty chmielowe, jednak zamiast cytrusowych raczej ziołowe czy miętowe. 

Smak: pełny, słodowy, słodki, owocowy i dość gładki. Goryczka nie wyczuwalna. 

Dużo lepsze piwo niż wersja klasyczna. Zapowiadanych aromatów cytrusowych co prawda zbytnio nie wyczułem, ale całość jest bardziej pełna, słodowa i bananowa. Pszeniczak zdecydowanie wart uwagi.
Bottle. Hazy yellow color, white head. Aroma is wheaty, yeast, hint of citrus. Wheaty taste, yeast, lemon. Balanced wheat.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, hopfig. Geschmack sehr fruchtig, hefig, leicht würzig, hopfig, grasig.

Pours .5 inch head, no lacing. Amber, a little hazy. Clove, banana, wheat grainy. Bitter, but not unpleasant aftertaste. Hallertauer hops detected, but I couldnt discern cascade hops. Refreshing, but I wont make this an old standby.

Bonne blanche avec des notes de girofle et un peu acidulé. Facile d'accès en plus

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 Pours a cloudy golden colour with foamy head. Not much of the expected banana in the nose, initial feel is watery before the clove and yeast flavours come in. Bitter finish, nicely balanced. Refreshing and pleasant rather than earth shattering. More of interest in taps 5 and 6.
Looks great, small white head and Deepak honey body. The aroma is mostly yeast but very pleasant. Taste is dull and boring though.

Bottled. Pours hazy, pale amber with a large head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, citrus, flowers spice and banana. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and lightly bitter inish. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and average carb. An exellent wheat beer.
Bottle from Alko. Hazy amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, banana, wheat, hops, mango, yeast and toast. Bitter finish with citrus, hops and banana. Excellent hefeweizen.

Kaatuu lasiin samean kullankeltaisena, muhkealla vaahtomatolla, kuten tyyliin kuuluukin. Hajussa on hyvin vahvaa banaania, sekä tuoreempaa että hieman ylikypsää. Myös mausteisuutta (pippuri, neilikka) ja sitruunaa on reilusti mukana. Hennosti hedelmäpurkkaakin löytyy, mutta se jää vähän jalkoihin. Maku on sitruksisempi kuin haju, mutta myös reilusti banaanimaisia aromeja on joukossa. Mausteisuutta löytyy vasta jälkimussa, kuten hedelmätoffeetakin. Viljainen pureskeltavuus jää lopuksi suuhun vellomaan. Suutuntuma on raikas ja hiilihappoinen, vehnäisen pureskeltava. Hieno vehnis, raikas ja tasapainoinen. Erottuu muista tyylin edustajista vahvemmalla sitruksisuudella. Viljainen täyteläisyys on lähes Weihenstephanerin luokkaa.
Tap at bierhaus, mountain view. Hazy orange color. Bread and banana, typical hefe smell. Flavor is similar but drier than usual, more emphasis on a grain characteristic and alcohol. Pretty good.
Bootle at Samo Pivo Belgrade.Golden yellow color, aroma banana, thyme, fruits, yeast great.For me best one from Schneider.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2014 Shows a frothy white head and a deep honey coloured yeast hazed beer. On the nose aromas of fresh grass, floral light flowery hops arise with notes of fresh green leaves and a faint citrusy note (retro-nasal). The aromas are all well balanced and rather elegantly set nothing abrasive or right in your face. The taste is fresh and floral lightly slick with a brief livelyness. Rather slender body with an elegant sweet floral hoppy with notches of fennel flavour notes and a hint of faintly astringent bitterness which develops over a medium lasting finish. Harmonically well balanced beer!

Poured from bottle. Slightly hazy yellow color with small white head. Aroma of cloves, grainy. Medium body, lively carbonation. More bitter than is appropriate for weizen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is wheat, bit sourish. Taste is medium bitter, wheat, bit sourish, banana, clove, yeasty.
120z bottle, cloudy pale golden with extra thick white frothy head. Great taste of spices, wheat, yeast, bit citrus and banana. Smooth, creamy feel, well balanced, Great hefe!!

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 Orange hazy beer, quite dark orange for a hefeweizen. Head is white, big and dense. Aroma is really nice with sweet citrus fruits, banana, vanilla, peppery yeast and grassy hops. Flavor is sweet orangey fruity and peppery yeasty. Finish has a fair amount of bitterness, leaving a fruity and peppery aftertaste with bitterness and sourness. Mouthfeel is nicely fluffy and almost medium full with foamy carbonation. Really refreshing hefeweizen and a bonus point for being organic.

Re-rated a couple of times: this has become my favourite hefeweizen. Nice orangey fruity freshness that works perfectly with the hefeweizen yeast esters.
bottle 50 cl from alko @ home. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Banana, wheat, citrus in the aroma, quite refreshing. Smooth, wheat, banana fruits, some sour notes in the flavor. Well balanced.
120414. Bottle at party, Tampere. Pours hazy yello with a high head. Aroma banana, hops, yeast, wheat. A bit sour fruit. Refreshing and nice. Not Bad.
Bottle, pours a cloudy orange gold with a white head, sweet tasting of bananas, citrus, and wheat, slight bitter finish, first "organic" beer Ive had and it was pretty good.

cloudy pale yellow with great white frothy head, looks just like hefe should look. Spicy and bit sour aroma has coriander, wheat, yeast, bit citrus and banana, bit pepper also. Smooth and round feel, great palate, just sour enough to balance things here, pepper bite is also nice, and those fruits are there, long finish is sour and dries also little. This is the way I want my hefe to be, good stuff!

A slightly brown yellow beer with a medium and blond head. The nose of wheat, bananas, some sourness, also some and nice citrusfruits. Taste of wheat, quite dry, some fruits, medium bitterness in the end. Medium bodied, slippery and smoth to drink. Good and more bitter than usual hefe.

500 ml bottle. Hazy yellow colour, thick white head. Spicy aroma of banana, wheat and yeast. The flavour is wheaty-malty, with fruity notes, yeast, and a spicy, moderately hoppy finish. Tasty and refreshing.

Bottle from Csak a Jó Sör. Aroma orange peel, bubble gum, banana, light clove. Hazy orangeish colour. Taste is quite ordinary, yeasty bready, lightly zesty. Quite high carbonation. Not the best of weizens, not in style nor my personal preference. Nevertheless a good piece.

Another good one form Schneider, but not up to the level of their Taps 5 or 7. High fluffy head, nice cloudy body from the sediment, aroma of banana bread. Substantial weight and slick mouthfeel , very bready taste, short and slightly sweet finish.
Sample at Malmö beer- and whiskey festival. Spicy and fruity with apricots, citrus, grass and wild flowers.

สีน้ำตา& ใส ฟองน้อย ละเอียด ยุบเร็ว
 หอมนิดๆ
 หวานนิด& ขมตาม
ดี via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mooie oranjegele kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop, citrusmout en iets caramel. Smaakt fris, hop, caramel. Iets dun wel lekker fris en goed drinkbaar.
On tap at Weisses Bräuhaus, Munchen. Pours hazy orange with white head. Yeasty spicy aroma. Citrus banana flavor with some spices and yeast. Nice hefe.

Hazy lightorange.
Aroma is spicy, clovy.
Flavor has bubblegum, cloves, little sour, no banana what so ever.

Aroma: grassy, floral hoppy flavours, wheat. Appearance: clear gold, medium frothy head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweets expanding, hoppy bitters in the background. Overall: nice variation of a Hefeweizen. Bottle at the London Drinker Beer & Cider Festival.

Bottle cotteridge wines Birmingham. Hazy orange colour halo white head. Aroma is yeast and banana. Taste is same some spice little cream. Medium body nice mouthfeel soft carbonated. Good beer much the same as other hefeweizens I have tried nothing new to grab my attention.
Strong aroma with some yeast, pepper and a lot of clove. Spicy taste, again lots of clove. Low on sweetness. Theres a touch of bitter hop which helps negate the spicy clove flavour.

Bottle from Berts Bierhuis in Utrecht. The beer has a nice blonde color and a large white head, very rich Co2 level. In the aroma tones of hops, flowers and some fruits, like bananas. The taste is a little bitter which a light sourness. Also tones noticable of cloves, bananas and spices. The finish is long and a medium bitter. I wasnt blown away by this Weizen, but its not a bad one, but cant reach Tap 5.

Aroma is sweet yeast,bread and clove notes paired with some spiciness. Taste is quite bitter up front. Taste has a tartiness to it but has a bitter base to it. Pours with thick bubbly head that vabishes quickly. Body is a cloudy orange.
(bottle) hazy copper colour with a small tan head; aroma of noble hops, spices, banana, lilies; balanced flavour with long light bitter finish

Wheat malts, citrus, hubbabubba (bubblegum), green grass to the nose. Tight off-white head, hazy orange-golden body, some lacings as rings inside the mug marking my sips.
Taste; light roasted wheat malts dominate, then flour, grass, green leaves, ripe banana, hops.
To palate slightly mealy, but okay.
Finishes with wheat bread with ripe banana, spices, some malt aroma at the very last and lingering bitterness behind it. Overall okay premium.

Bottle into a pint glass at the UK National Winter Ales Festival 2014. A decent weiss beer, body body, wheaty with banana notes. I wasnt blown away, however Id happily have one again.

Poured into a dimpled mug. Decent layer of thick white foam. Colour dirty blonde meets with some orange. Smell is bubblegum, sweet, citrusy zest, straw. Taste is strong on that bublegum, & cake icing, mango. Medium mouth feel, some fizzy. Lingering finish with a gentle bitterness.

Pour is lightly hazed golden amber with lots of tight white head. Nose has a light malt base with a strong fruity ester of lemon and faint candied sugar. Hops are grassy and herbal behind. Taste is similar, a hint thin in the back. Less malt body, tangy yeast and fruity esters. Lemony, hint of banana, light farmhouse note with some grassy hops in the finish. Lighter body with softer carbonation and a smooth palate.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2015 (tap 0,5l @ OP(Brno)) (16.2.2014)
Strong weizen, yeasty, orange peel, fruity, fresh aroma. Cloudy, dark orange color. Medium white head. Medium sweet, citrusy peel, fresh flavor. Interesting. Light fizzy. Bitter finish. (8.4.7.3..15=3.7)
(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno)) (28.5.2015)
Aroma: Wheat, sweet, citrus peel, very light sour-ish.
Appearance: Cloudy golden color. Huge, white head.
Taste: Light sweet, light sour, wheat.
Palate: Medium body. Smooth. Dry finish.
Overall: Nice sourish-dry weizen. (6.5.7.4..14=3.6)
Bottle at Wachi. Wheaty and creamy, bit of grassy hops, easy drinking and wheaty. (Leathered at this stage)
Great weizen beer! Pour is a cloudy yellow with a nice thin white head. Flavor is wheat and yeast.

Bottled 500ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Murky orange coloured, big off-white head, banana and cloves in the nose. Sweet malty, wheaty and yeasty with notes of cloves, banana and mild alcohol. Rather sweet and spicy finish. Really pleasant and nice.

500ml bottle at home. Opaque yellow pour, generous white head, high carbonation. Classic banana and clove, touch of peppery yeast. Taste brings a sour, lactic note to things, which cleans the palate beautifully after drinking. Very nice.

Creamy crown. Classic weissbier aroma: foam banana, yeast, light toast, and flowers. A bit crud and straightforward maybe. Taste of cardboard, pencil, wood, light bread, and sour fruit. A bit lame when it comes to the aftertaste.

Beer to Schneider Weisse glass. The pour is a cloudy tarnished gold with a large white top that diminishes over time. Aroma brings sour apple, horse blanket, very slight grassyness, citrus fruit and slight banana. Taste is similar to the aroma but backed by the typical hefe flavours of cloves, bread, wheat, and backed with sour apple and hints of earthyness. Palate is fairly dry, quite fizzy, flavours well in balance, though it seems to have a very slight powdery quality to it. 

Overall, I like this better than the standard Weisse beer offered by Schneider. More complexity and the sour notes are interesting. Feels like a cross between a lambic and hefe...great stuff!

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe (£2.79):
Citrus lemon notes upfront with plenty of wheat, yeast and coriander as always with this style of beer. There is some lively orange zest and some banana too although this quite faint and definitely not as strong as with some other German hefeweizens and there is some spice right at the end. 

Cloudy yellow to amber with a 2-fingers tall, white and foamy head that has great retention, leaving some nice lacing too.

Wheat and light coriander to begin along with some banana that comes across stronger than it did with the aroma. There is some light spice coming through along with some citrus flavours and a slightly floral taste and the tiniest hint of alcohol right at the end as well.

Medium bodied and soft with a very smooth feel with good carbonation and a touch of fizz. Touches of creaminess and very easy to drink.

An excellent beer as I expected, one of the best Ive tried from the brewery although they have all been good for the most part. A little stronger than usual for the style but a nice change up and one Id have again.

Mine poured almost Kristallweisen with a hint of haze. Fizzy head that dissipated quickly. Aroma of yeasty esters, clove, a bit of bubblegum. Flavor is big bubblegum followed by a touch of lemon and spice. Great fizzy mouthfeel. Awesome

500 ml bottle into weizen glass, bottled on 2/21/2013. Pours hazy/cloudy golden orange color with a 2 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big orange zest, pear, apple, banana, clove, pepper, wheat, bread, light bubblegum, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of malt, hop, and yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of big orange zest, banana, pear, apple, clove, pepper, wheat, bread, light bubblegum, floral, grass, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of orange, banana, pear, apple, clove, pepper, wheat, bread, light bubblegum, herbal, floral, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice balance, complexity, and robustness of malt, hop, and yeast ester flavors; with a great balance of malt/spiciness and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a lightly creamy, smooth, and moderately crisp mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent hefeweizen. All around great balance, complexity, and robustness of malt, hop, and yeast flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
Bottle from Kulovy Blesk. Cloudy pale yellow, large, creamy white head, like beaten eggwhite. Yeasty and wheaty, not as Hop-accented as expected. Nevertheless, a smooth and pleasant beer.

On draught at apex - pours like a typical hef , cloudy golden with thick white head. Nose of spices, cloves. And hops. Foamy mouthfe. Taste of sweet banana, cloves, and citrus. Very nice hef.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pszenica troszkę intensywniej chmielona niż zwykła, troszkę mocniejsza i wreszcie troszkę lepsza niż inne. W zapachu nuty bananowe, drożdżowe charakterystyczne dla stylu. W smaku oprócz wyżej wymienionych nut dochodzi niezła goryczka, nieco szorstka, nadająca sznyt łagodnej, owocowej całości. Ekstremalnie pijalne i świetnie ułożone.
500 ml bottle, Dublin. Golden pour, with a white head. Citrus and sweet taste.

Earthy, peppery, spice-laden and thats just the aroma. Darn good throughout, this hefe be. Especially enjoy the lengthy finish in which several sensations battle out for final dominance (the Hallertauer hops edge out the malts, I believe). The best USDA organic beer Ive had. Well worth locating. Enjoyed from a half-liter bottle.

Bière jaune soleil tirant sur lorangée, bien voilée, extrêmement effervescente, et surmontée dun large col blanc immaculé, mousseux, dense et persistant. Arômes de grains frais, de paille fraîche, léger de miel, avec des agrumes, de la poire, de la pêche, des herbes salés et de la coriandre. Nez agréable, remplie de fraîcheur, assez complexe, mais qui aurait pu être un peu plus intense cependant. En bouche, cest bien pétillant sur la langue, et le breuvage impose une belle rondeur, cest bien velouté au palais. Au goût, cest étonnamment épicé et herbacé! Jai un peu de difficulté à bien saisir toutes les nuances, il me semble que tout y est, clou de girofle, muscade, coriandre, gingembre, anis, poivre et plus La finale est définitivement bien poivrée! Le malt est bien présent en bouche prenant des saveurs de pain frais, de paille et de miel, de même que le fruité qui est plutôt banane et pêche (les agrumes étant moins présents en bouche quau nez!). Le houblon se tient en arrière-plan, et il semble plutôt herbacé, amenant une amertume plutôt faible qui finit par se perdre dans les épices. Cette bière est excellente, riche, complexe et intense, une version admirablement bien rehaussée dépices et dherbes de la déjà excellente Schneider Original!
Shared 50 cl bottle. Pours clear golden with a small head. Taste and aroma are lots of yeast, citrus and sweet bananas.

Bottled , Prague , CZ , Wheat,earthy,light malt,spices and fruity aroma , Hazy dark yellow color with bigger lacing head , Sweet taste with longer slight bitter finish , Medium body , Soft carbon , Superb hefe.

Mild citrus, cloves moving to a nice hoppy goodness. Very clean, enjoyable beverage.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Un peu comme la Schneider Weisse Original, mais avec une note citronnée plus intense. Magnifique visuellement, elle a des notes de bananes mais sans exagération. Légèrement poivrée. Une très bonne bière.
Golden clear, one finger foamy head. Big wheat nose with a hint of hops. Banana, cove, wheat and citrus on the taste. Clove finish with a bit of hop bitterness. Refreshing.
Lys brun med hvitt skum som ligger godt. Røkt kjøtt og kornlukt. Smaker også røkt, medium bitter, lite søt, medium kullsyre.
bouteille 500ml de blanche. Arôme semblable aux produits uniboue. Arôme floral et dherbe. Goût bien agréable, floral mais pas trop puissant, très bien équilibré. Se prend très bien.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2013 In Sweden we are not spoiled with good weissbiers and this one was better than most I had in a long time. Eternal head and not too much banana-taste. Pretty crisp. Well balanced aftertaste. Will drink again in the summer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Heavy clove and banana aroma. Spicy. Taste is spicy banana. Clean. Lagerish. Good.
Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with thin lasting white head. Aroma is wheat, bananas, hops. Flavor is slightly sour but also a bit bitter, with wheat, bananas, hops, grass.

Tapped. Kulovy Blesk. Classic weizen. A lot of wheat and malts in aroma with some decent amount of citrus. The body appears a classic heffeweizen with a very good and stable foam. Pretty rich taste with a very good fruitful and a bit sweety taste and a decent palate based on wheat finish with some enriched accord of banana and even hops. One of the best weizenbeers.
bottle from rewe dortmund. short head. aroma taste and palatebis well balanced. indeed it smells green. ;) great paitung with fresh, light good.

Pours yellow with a foamy white head that stays a while. Nose is apples and grain. Taste is predominately sweet. Nearly full bodied, vigorous carbonation. Very good beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great weizen. It has everything there is to like in the style: malts, citrus and yeast. And this has more. A rich complex weizen. More bitter hops than the original but less than the hopfen weizen. Delicious.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2014 Bottle 0.5l at Weißes Brauhaus München. At first sight not the typical Weißbier as the bottle is served along with a tasting glass. Pours and smells like a german Weißbier but taste is somehow hop enhanced and thus has an extra bitter touch. This makes the beer much more drinkable for me and is a good twist on the normal Schneider Weiße. Good.
Delicious. Somehow classic weissbier and innovative American at the same time. Must be the cascade hops.
Bottle at the brewery bar... Hazy amber... Thin white head... Soft light banana yeast nose... Over fizzy... Soft banana fruits... Juicy fruits

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2014 pours cloudy, with deep golden coloring. when handled with care, it has a gorgeous rocky head of foam, aided by kicked up sediment thats built up in the bottom of the bottle. all that sediment is full of classic weizen character; prominent yeast, clove spice, banana and slightly unripe fruit notes in the nose, a pleasant sweet flavor and crisp bread mouth-feel. medium body with good carbonation and little to no bitterness, despite the distinct grassy hops swimming in the background. aforementioned mild German hops and herbal spice notes begin to peak through the back end as the beer aerates and you make your way through the initial sips. like every great German weissebier, this one is sweet without getting sticky, doesnt suffocate its hops (but doesnt beat you over the head with them either), yeasty without being truly funky, and very drinkable without sacrificing its subtle complexity. always a welcome choice.
At a tasting at KyotoLeftys place. It pours a cloudy opaque gold with a funky & spicy aroma. Medium palate with a sweet, spicy clove taste. It is a classic weizen.

50cl bottle. Hazy orange with medium head.
NOSE : yeast, banana, grains, dough, spices, orange, lactic.
SIP : medium body with good carbonation. Creamy texture. Sweet and yeasty. It develops hop and spicy notes in the background. A bit metallic and pepper like transition into herbal and spicy finish. Still the grains and the sweetness is always present. 
OVERALL : easy to drink and very yeasty. Quite complex in mouth and goes through different layers until swallowed. Well brewed.
500ml bottle. Poured a cloudy golden color with a foamy white top. Aroma of banana and German malts. Taste of malts, citrus, grass, with a bitter finish. Watery on the palate. Not bad

Surprisingly hoppy. Herbal, light citrus, crusty white bread, fresh grass. Tasty too, certainly not underhopped, yeast is relatively clean and that really works. Much better than I expected, very drinkable despite the lively carbonation. Good stuff. (50cl bottle from Dranken Geers)
Eye: hazy, amber/gold. Nose: banana, bread, yeast, spice. Taste: hops, bread, yeast, cloves and so on. More bitterness than any Hefe I have tasted. Brilliant!
Pours quite a light gold with a white head that doesnt stay around. Very wheaty smell. Balanced malt taste with a hint of banana.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014 Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours hazy golden/orange with a large frothy white head. Aroma has ripe bananas, wheat, cloves which are quite subtle at first but increases. Taste is sweet, with cloves and banana, it has a fair amount of bitterness to it, finish is mellow with a lingering clove and bitter taste.

From bottle to weizen glass. Hazy pale with orange notes. White head that laces. Aroma of wheat banana and hints of hops. Surprised by the hop aroma, lightly citrus with pine and hints of green bell pepper. Taste is wheat yeast banana and light hops. The hops arent bitter but more grassy. Not a Hoppy bitter beer. More like an american wheat than a traditional German hefe style, just hints of hops that round it out. This beer could work really well with food.
Bottle. Hazy deep golden color with a descending foamy white head. Aroma of ripe banana and yeast with some sourness. Slightly sour taste with mild bitterness.-- via beerbasher/winphone

Bottle from Asahiya. Bananas, light sugar, yeast, and bread. Cloudy orange/yellow/brown with a very creamy head. Tangy fruitiness, banana bread, some spices, and minimal but noticeable bitterness / finish is smooth and sweet. Thin-medium body. Aroma is wonderful; flavor are pleasant. Refreshing and light.

Bottle from National Brewery Centre, Burton. Cloudy almost murky dark orange amber beer with small head. Aroma of spices, cloves, banana and sweet bread. Taste is spices, cloves, banana, sweet citrus orange, yeast and some alcohol warmth. Medium carbonation with a little fizz, medium bodied. An excellent hefeweizen.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Kris Wines. Light golden colour, clear, big white head, big carbonation. Sweet wheaty aroma. This is really good, slight hint of the higher alcoholevel, crisp wheat, sweetish fruity palate, more apple and a hint of butter and vanilla, then a definite floral bitter hop finish, less so than the Hopfen but more than a standard hefe. Tasty.

Bottle. Gold pour, white head, excellent retention/some lace. Aroma of citrus, grass, banana, clove, bubblegum. Taste is lightly bitter, grass, citrus, banana, wheat. Palate is soft, creamy, lightly bitter finish.

Bouteille 500ml. Couleur cuivrée pâle, mousse blanc cassé crémeuse disparaissant en laissant un anneau. Arôme de clou de girofle, banane, malt, herbal, pointe dalcool. Goût de clou de girofle, malt, légère amertume, banane en fin de bouche. Carbonation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.
Pours a hazy golden with a thin head. Some bananas and some clove. Lots is wheaty goodness. Very nice and refreshing beer.

On tap. Pours a cloudy dark orange/amber with a foamy white head and lacing. It has a medium aroma of bread and bananas, and a flavor that is bready yeast up front and a dark fruit, sweet finish over a light/medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
16 oz bottle. Hazy amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is of malt, apple, pear, caramel. Taste is of caramel, apple, malt.

Foaming over bottle. The look is a thin off white head, cloudy, and orange in color. The smell is sweet, really fruity, honey, flowers, banana, yeast, and spice. The taste is weaker than the smell, wheat, clove, fruit, and ok.

28-AUG-2013, bottle @home, from Systembolaget, as "Mein Grünes".
Golden, hazy, with lasting white head.
Aroma is weisse-like with wheat, yeast and spice. Banana. But spice is somewhat different from the usual clove-thing. Perhaps a hoppy spicyness?
Citrus is there as well. Taste the same - even more spicy. Not all that hoppy and certainly not bitter.
A little thin bodied, medium carbonation. OK but like the regular better.

Bottle. Medium size white head vaporates slowly. Almost clear, light brown. Aroma has grass, apple, citrus and yeast. 

Taste has grain, citrus, hay and malt. Finishes slightly bitter. Nicely balanced. Some alcohol on the aftertaste. Quite like a lager, very drinkable and smooth.

Bottled. 
Deep charneol colour with poor head. Im disappointed with both aroma and flavour. Their flagship, Aventinus, is so fantastic with rich complex aromas and phenols, but this doesnt even come close in flavour profile. Dull malt profile, weak esters and papery mouthfeel. I can hardly sense the phenols here. A poor hefeweizen.

Bottle: pours opaque burnt orange with tons of carbonation and a frothy off white pillow of head. Floating yeast and carbonation all over the place leaving the head building endlessly. Banana, mint, clove, yeast, wheat in the nose. Faint lemon fruitiness as well. Rich wheat fullness on the tongue without a ton of drying bitterness on a medium finish. German wheat, yeast and subtle grain bill you get when not over spicing a perfect hefeweizen. For the style, hard to top. Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Served in a Tucher Weizen glass this magnificent wheat ale is somehow the perfect transition between traditional weizen and hopfenweiss. A bit too acidic and bitter to be considered as great as Schneider Weiss original. Yet, a very pleasant weissbier to have on a hot autumn afternoon. I wouldnt have a couple Maß of this Wiesen Weiss in late september in Munich, but I loved all of the 500ml I add today.

Pours a really hazy golden with a thin white head that stay for a while and leaves some lacing. Aroma is wheat-y, spicy with a slight bananas impression. Taste is not too sweet and loaded with bananas and grain. Mouthfeel is nice and "silky", ultra drinkable. A nice one!

Bottle from trade with McTapps. Many thanks Sabine.  Orange color with huge white head. Wheat, yeast, banana in aroma. Taste, Sweet malt at beginning, followed with wheat, banana, yeast, clove. Fruity (banana) finish with spicy hops. Tasty.
This is a full bodied wheat beer. The beer goes down smooth with mellow flavors of bread, orange, and lemon.

(Flasche) Es hat eine getreidig-orangene Farbe, ist hefetrüb mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist hefig und "grün", mit etwas Honig und fruchtigem Hopfen. Der Geschmack ist leicht malzig und eher schlank. Die Bittere ist eher mittelstark. Retronasal ist es sehr fruchtig

500 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Hazy golden with big white head. Aroma mild and pleasant, wheat, grapefruit and chalk. Taste has wheat, malt, and lower grapefruit level. Dry mouthfeel, very pleasant.

hazy yellow colour, massive white head; aroma of banana, bread and some citrus; taste of bread, some banana and citrus with surprisingly intensive hoppy bitterness; ok weizen; not that beer you will fall in love but easily drinkable i n any circumstances
Bouteille 500mL. Ambrée à lapparence trouble. Malt brioché, levure aux saveurs de banane, un peu de miel de trèfle, florale et épicée à la fois. Superbe!

Pours a dense, cloudy, dull honey color with a thick off white head. The smell is banana, clove, yeast, malt. The taste is fruity, clove and spice, yeast, wheat ending dry and a touch of bitterness. Body is light and carbonation is very nice. This bottle was a couple of months old so probably not peak for drinking but was nice none the less.

Bottle traded with McTapps & MichaelBruch, shared with MiP. Pours hazy light amber with stable white head. Clear, intense aroma of hops, yeast and malt withna touch of banana and herbs. Bitter, hoppy flavour with notes of banana and grain. Rather rough and a little spicy aftertaste. Nice, indeed.

Bottle, 6.2%. Mild grapefruity hop aroma, chalky and refreshing. Cloudy golden colour, sparkling. Big stable white head. The flavour also has a little grapefruit, but not as much as the aroma. OK bitterness. Quite dry flavour. Better than most Hefeweizens.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Hazy yellow coloured brew with an un-Bavarian taste. Its got more citrus in it,some banana. more bitter than the usual Bavarian Hefeweizen. So even Schneider gets slightlier moderne.

Bottle with Bierkonings Jan & Alice, thanks! Looks like a Hefeweizen, cloudy, pale yellow. White head. Aromas of wheat, sour fruit, banana. Flavor is lightly sweet, wheaty, hint of bitterness. Its rather thin for its 6.2%. Nice subtle bitter finish. Quite refreshing.

500mL bottle from Northgate. 6.2% Hazy golden pour with a foamy white head that dissipates slowly. Strong herbal aroma and wheaty, yeast whiff. Delicious, noticeable citrus taste and a hint of herbal spiciness.
Earlier Rating: 7/18/2010 Total Score: 3.6500mL bottle from the LCBO. 6.2%  Hazy golden pour with a foamy white head that dissipates slowly. Strong herbal aroma and wheaty, yeast whiff. Delicious, noticeable citrus taste and a hint of herbal spiciness.
Poured a hazy light yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma of spicy citrus and caramel malt. Medium, smooth body, flavour of banana with a sweet spiced finish.

Hur mycket bättre kan en weiss bli? Helt underbar. Läskande och samtidigt fyllig. Liten lagom subtil syrlighet som möter sötman. Schneider levererar världsklass Earlier Rating: 5/31/2013 Total Score: 3.4Schneider levererar fan i mig alltid världsklass. Doftar banan i hela rummet när jag häller upp. Mycket härlig Weiß

Hazed orange pour, medium white head. Earthy spices, coriander, cardamum on the nose, and a bit of crisp German hops. Mouth lots of ground spices, less banana esters than in many hefeweissens. Sharp carbonation with a stronger German hop bite than in some of the others, though of course tempered nicely into the soft, round, fluffy feel of a great hot weather hefeweissen.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with a large off-white head. Citric aroma of wheat, caramel, yeast. Flavour is wheat, yeast, some fruit, citrus.
Pale yellow pour with thick head. Slick mouthfeel with a medium to light body. Aroma is killer, lots of citrus and earthiness. The taste is modest in comparison, mostly wheat and hay.
Biuère orange-cuivrée, trouble et peu mousseuse. Le nez est très levuré (banane, gomme baloune). En bouche, la bière est ample et goûteuse; bon mélange acidité / sucré.
Pours auburn, good head. Aroma is fruity, malt and sweet. Taste is a bit fruity, light bitterness, turns slightly watery. Good, not exceptional.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; bright amber pour with perfect white head, spice and banana aroma, clove and banana taste with some assertive pineapple hops trying to get forward.

Aroma: Complex! Berries and hay, carbonation. Definite note of grapefruit to the hops. 

Appearance:  Pours lager-golden and cloudy, very thin, watery head that dissipates swiftly.

Taste:  Light sweet, medium bitter, medium sour. 

Palate: Medium body, with a thin texture, with fizzy carbonation on the tongue. The finish starts bitter, quickly fading to a long, slow hoppy back-of-the-tongue bitterness.

---

This is a solid Edel-Weisse. The grapefruit notes off the hops are quite nice, and the bitterness is reasonably balanced, ensuring that they dont become the only note in the beer. 

The real stand-out characteristic of this beer is the aroma. One of the best-smelling weisbeirs Ive ever poured.
50cl. Hazy oranger with a large white head, good lacing. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, fruity especially banana. Flavour is sweet, banana, malty. Very refreshing and drinkable. Great Hefe.
Oro buona schiuma piuttosto fine buona persistenza naso leggermente speziato fruttato medio lieve erbaceo in tocco citrico una nota maltata quasi biscotto discreto amaro finale corpo medio

Deep yellow-gold, almost clear, huge, frothy off-white head.
Tangy, orange-wheat-banana aroma.
Nice sweet/tart mix...well balanced.
Crisp, very citric....clean.
Wonderful.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. A cloudy golden color and a medium-sized white head. The aroma features wheaty maltiness and citrus fruitiness with some clove-like spiciness and a hint of banana - prominent fruitiness is at the forefront with pronounced hoppy citrus notes. Taste is dryish, refreshing and very crisp. It offers sour wheaty notes, yeasty spiciness and fruitiness - everything that a proper hefeweizen needs to have and, unusually, also plenty of hoppy bitterness. Medium body, drinkable palate. This is a bit stronger than hefeweizens usually but it did not really feel that way. Classy, distinctive hefeweizen from probably the best wheat beer brewery. Similar traits with Meine Hopfenweisse from this same brewery but a bit lighter in all respects.

Aromas of banana, bubble gum, fresh grass, flowers, and cereal.  Hazy, pale orange-gold with a fairly retaining, white head.  Dry, bready, and hoppy.  Light bodied with fluffy, cleansing carbonation and a snappy, clean finish.
Its like tap 5 but with less alcohol and hops. Excellent smell and taste - I like it much more than Original.
Poured from 500mL bottle. Clear, straw yellow with a fair bit of carbonation and a foamy white head.  Nice yeasty aroma with some bready malts. Yeast and grain to taste, quite fresh. Full body.

Hazy light amber color, white and small head. Banana, bubblegum, vanilla and spices aromas. Mouthfeel is light, very spicy and dry, astringent, notes to banana, clove, bubblegum, but the overall is basically spicy. Irregular beer, too spicy for what I expected. Hoi-poloi beer.

(500ml bottle) hazy rich gold, creamy lasting fine white bubbles. Nose of malted wheat, honey, German hops, banana bread, light bubble gum. Taste is dry, malted wheat, light banana, quite spicy for a hefe. Very dry and carbonated finish.

Unclear orange yellow, foamy off white head settles and mostly lasts (mostly). Citrusy fruity yeasty wheaty aroma. Taste is dominated by citrus, juicy. Floral, spicy, herbal hop notes, fruity yeastiness, clove and wit malt. Average carbonation, light bodied, lightly hopped. No bitterness, clean and refreshing. Sessionable and swillable. Good. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)

0.5 l bottle from Kehlheim...  Nice clody golden color, good head... Perfect wild hop as well es some alcohol - but not too much - and citrus aromas... Mixture of some nice medium sourness and mild Weizen flavor... Short abrupt ending... Very good and interesting Weizen beer...
Bottle 50cl, cloudy yellow, nose is fruity on grapefruit and pineapple. Body is medium malty to low, grassy hops, stringency, bit disappointing, less tasty and malty than expected.

As Schneider Weisse Tap 4 "Mein Grünes". Smell of citrus, yeast, some banana and other fruit. Cloudy orange/golden colour, yellowish head. Aroma has citrus, yeast, some herbs. Tending towards witbier. Sweet with relatively much freshness, also some hoppy bitterness. Basically nice, but a rather weird cocktail of flavours.
Draft at blue monk. Slightly murky yellow. Fluffy white head. Typical cloviness and banana notes. A little spicy. Creamy mouthfeel. Nice hefe

Room temp bottle.  Cloudy orange with a decent head.  Smells quite nice - sweet esters and wheat.  Taste is a letdown - a bit sharp, watery.  None of the sweet esters that were present in the smell.  More hoppy than a normal wheat beer.  Its a confused flavour - a mix of lager, IPA and wheat beer without capturing particularly good qualities of these styles.
Bottle cloudy orange , taste like weisse but also something special, its much better hopped then most of the standard wheat beers, hoppy fruity nose and taste  nice aftertaste .Great.
Bottle.  Pours hazy orange with a large white head.  The aroma is pretty much just banana.  The taste follows suit with banana and a bit of clove.  Good but nothing special.

Znakomite i wysmienite piwo ekologiczne, pierwszy raz ekologiczna pszenica do mnie trafila. Wspaniala piana gesta i bardzo trwala i mocna, mocna maz i zmetnienie ktore diametralnie zmienia barwe piwa, zapach maslano-orzechowy, w smaku aromat masla, pszenicznych drozdzy troche orzecha i smietany. Cudownie wytrawne i kwaskowate, malo chmielne ale to nic. Arcydzielo bawarskiego stylu.

Pours a semi-hazy golden. Aroma has esters of banana, clove, little hops. Taste is banana, grapefruit rines, a bit if orange,cloves, not so malty, wheat, peppery . Carbonation is medium-high and fairly drinkable. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle. It pours a hazy gold color with a large, then diminishing  white head. A wheaty aroma. Taste is very clean, the beer is very easy to drink. Clean wheat flavor with nice yeasty, slightly fruity. Very summery wheat beer, very refreshing.
Orange color with big white head. Aroma of citrus, savoy cabbage, honey notes. Taste is sweet and sour with dry finish. Medium body, slick texture, avarage carbonation. Quite nice

Flasche mit McTapps geteilt. Wundervolle Optik, ähnlich der Hopfenweiße. Auch das erste Aroma scheint von fruchtigem Hopfen dominiert zu sein. Doch bei weitem fehlt hier das fruchtige und driftet ins derb-bittere ab. Dennoch ein sehr gutes Bier, dass jedes Pilsner und Hefe um Meilen schlägt.

Milky amber colour with low head and medium body. Nose of sparkling yeast. Taste of spicy hops (but not that much IPA-like like hoped), mild yeast, fruit salad and salad. It is a very elegant, mild and fresh Hefeweizen, really easy and delicious to drink, but it has to get some temperature before drinking it.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours cloudy golden in color with creamy white head. 
Perfume, sweet wheat and summer meadow in aroma. A bit sour wheaty 
kind of elements in taste at first. Even some bitter hoppy elements 
in taste. Chewy mouthfeel. Interesting combination, a bit hopped up 
german hefeweizen this one.  Bitter grassy and some elements that 
are more traditional for this type, sweet wheat with some spices in 
finish.

Bottle, from Trembling Madness, York. Hazy gold, fluffy and sustained collar of white head and moderate condition. Pleasant estery banana and cloves in the nose, quite full and bitter in the mouth with a slight chalkiness then a building banana and esters yeastiness and an earthy back note, finish is mostly peppery and bitter with some lingering yeastiness.

Una buona weiss dai sentori di banana e mela verde che si ripercuotono anche nel gusto. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pleasant aroma, taste and palate, but Im not thrilled. [short review due to it coming from my backlog]

Bottle shared with northropfrye. Bready yeasty aroma. Sweet bready yeasty taste which I absolutely love. I wish it tasted more like it smelled, the aroma is stronger than the taste, but I absolutely love this. Go Germany!

Superbe blanche à la finale houblonnée et agrumée (pamplemousses et oranges), couleur laitonnée avec col de mousse couleur pêche plutôt persistant. Bien ronde, on dénote aussi de discrètes notes de bananes et de sucre cuit. Un délice absolu.
Bottle from Mane Liquor. Found this to be much fruity and hoppier than what I have come to expect from German Hefes. Really enjoyed the citrus hoppage behind this one. Nice stuff!

Draft? at Quodlibet, Marburg. Murky-misty amber-golden body. Lovely. Sourish pineapple and banana lactic aroma. Interesting light pineapple and clove taste. Sweet and slightly creamy. Definitely appealing but a little too light. Like every bio beer ever - light, that is.
hay, earthy, earthy, woody, earthy, golden, clear, minimal head, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
From a half liter bottle shared at home.  Pours a clear gold with a white head.  Malty aroma.  Peppery notes with a smooth crisp finish.  Nice beer.
Medium gold color. Earthy hops aromas. Boiled peanut flavors, biscuit malts, and some sourness.

Pours foggy light light amber with high foamy white head
Aromas of citrus, wheats, barley, white bread
Nice fresh citrusy tones, bit bready, low bodied, low bitterness. Very fresh nice and overall great taste.
Bouteille de 500ml, robe blonde opaque, arôme de levure et dépices, goût de citron et de banane.

Fresh, fruity, delicious aroma with mango, banana, citrusy hops, and the usual clove and spices. The taste is sweet and culminates mildly bitter and tart from the hops. Nice, smooth body and lively but not overbearing carbonation. Very refreshing and delicious.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a moderate white head on it. Nose is yeasty and citrusy. Taste is slightly sweet with some citrus elements in there. About average body.

500ml bottle. Murky apricot with a big honeycombed white head. Huge spicy clove and allspice on bananas on toast aroma. Great spicy clove and banana flavour with Finnish leanings and considerable bitterness (like slightly burnt dry roasted seeds/spices) for style. Brightened up a dull evening (beer-wise) no end. Beer of 2013 so far.

500ml bottle. Aroma is citrus, coriander, wheat and bubblegum. Poured cloudy banana yellow with a good sized white head. Taste is citrus, banana, wheat, light noble hops. Less coriander than the smell. Palate is light and crisp. Overall, it was a lot like a Belgian whit, except the crisp lager body. Coriander taste, despite the lack of spice in the ingredients, is still not for me.

Bottle from SB, "Mein Grünes". Pours hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma distinctly wheat with herbs, coriander, hay, citrus. Taste is balanced sweet with a light refreshing sourness at first. Finish somewhat abrupt but pleasant. Medium carbonation, light body.

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a hazy gold color with a stark white head.  The nose is light and wheaty with slight yeast notes.  Reminds me more of an American wheat than German hefe.  The flavor profile is very clean the beer is very easy to drink.  Clean wheat flavor with nice yeast notes, a touch of dough, and slight notes of banana.  Light in body with a crisp finish.  Nice beer.

Not for me.  I recieved as a gift.  I found it too bready, yeasty in the aroma.  Sweet bread bananas, yeast, malt in the taste.  Is their really any hops in here.  As you can tell, I am not much on German beers.

from bottle. pours a hazy dark orange colour with a huge frothy head. quite hoppy, spicy and fruity but a bit too weak aroma - banana, citrus and green apple notes with the  typical yeasty weissbier characteristics  that could be a bit more intense in my opinion. light to medium body, average carbonation and creamy mouthfeel. light sweet and sour banana and citrus flavours, spicy and refreshing finish. really enjoyable weizen!

As Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes
Light cloudy golden colour, white head. Aroma of malts, light banana, cloves, light grass, citrus and bread. Sweet malty flavour, light bitter, green banana. Malty finish, bread, green banana.
Nice beer, very enjoyable.
(0,5L bottle @ home)

The head is robust, the body a bit brown and cloudy. It smells intensive, fresh, wheat, yeasty, a bit apple. The taste is fresh a bit yeasty, wheat. More or less like a normal style but tasty Hefeweisse. 12/12/12/11/12/12

Aroma: clove, deep fruity smell

Appearance: very thick golden head, opaque golden appearance, enticing

Taste: not so sweet almost bland initially, moderate hop aftertaste

Palate: head is amazing it fills the nose, very light creamy feel

Overall: needs more flavor, weak initial flavor only leaves hop flavor


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Big, herbaceous nose with sage, thyme - also, big cloves.  Nice creamy, silky mouthfeel, high carbonation - Really great beer.
A German hefeweissen done only the way the Germans can do it... Big wheat flavor, crisp with notes of citrus zest... Delicious

Visão  Cor amarelo/dourado, bastante turva. Encontrei partículas suspensas no exemplar que provei. Espuma branca e abundante, cremosa e muito persistente. Carbonatação alta.

Oufato  Aroma suave de cravo e um frutado que me lembrou pêra.

Paladar  Na boca, o frutado se mantém, porém suave. Ácida, com amargor de entrada aparente e levemente picante. Muito refrescante. Amargor final longo e adstringente. Excelente drinkability.

shiiiiiiiiiz
que buena cerveza.  asi es como se deben hacer siempre, sin tanta paja
A cloudy mess of a beer that comes off with a great taste. Huge on the wheat, a bit sour and completely refreshing. I shall be drinking this for the res of the night.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2015 Initial Rating Date: 10/31/2012 / aka TAP4 - Mein Grünes. 50cl bottles via Bierzwerg. - much more balanced and hence enjoyable, sweetish and toned-down light version of TAP5: enjoyable, rounded and fruity Hefeweizen, with luckily almost none of the bland banana/clove aroma going on and more grassy hops and even some apple. Very refreshing, despite the sweet notes, drinkable and just about the right strength with 6,2%. /.     / rerate 2015/03, bottled 11/2014: pours the standard SchW unfiltered apple juice beige, good white head with yeast eyes. Very spicy nose, the cloves going into full-blowh Sezhuan pepper here, along with fragrant meadow grasses, Alpine flowers, near lavender. That DE Cascade really only surfaces in a dry lemon melissa note amongst the clovey apple juice of its base. Curtailed fruitiness by heavy yeast phenols and floral/pollen hops, going into a "champagne dry" Cascade finish.  Have always wanted to love this beer then I do, but it is a fascinating repeated drinking experience, plenty of character from open vessel fermentation to be had here.

On tap under the alias Tap 4 Mein Grünes at the Post Office Vaults, Birmingham.  As with so many Munich weisses this is a thing of beauty - perfect cloudy golden body and a thick, foamy head.  Aroma is like mulled wine - strong, fruity with orange.  Tangy orange to taste but perhaps lacking duration in the finish.  Not intense enough but pleasant all the same.  So, just very good when it threatened to be excellent.

0,5l bottle from Sörspecialista, Budapest. Cloudy, oranga golden color with big, frothy, white head which is not as durable as a usual weizens, but still pretty good. Floral, fruity, yeasty odor. Yeasty, citrus, fruity, a bit grassy and resiny aroma. Its light and refreshing, but much more hoppy than usual weizens. The character of the Cascade can be felt easily, but its not dominant, it makes a complex flavour with the yeast. Medium bitter taste, a bit dry. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation - typically weizen. Dry, light herbal finish - the complex combination of the yeast and the hop. This beer is very delicious. I like this hoppy hefeweizen. Its very beautiful, how the hop cooperates with the other ingredients, it doesnt overpower anything.

500 ml bottle.
Pours a hazy cloudy orange colour with a foamy thick head. Aroma of wheat, caramel and some yeast. Flavour of wheat, clove, caramel malts, grassy hops, lime and mandarin orange. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel and a smooth, wheaty and caramel finish. Really tasty.

50 cl bottle. BBE 02.04.2013.
Pours hazy golden color with a small head. Aroma of yeast, banana, some ripe fruits, toffee, grass and mild spices. Flavor of yeast, apricot, spices, banana, some malts and lemony fruits. Mild sourish palate.
3334

50 cl bottle @ home as Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes, BBE 02.04.2013
Aroma has banana esthers, bubblegum, yeast and wheat. Flavour has orange, some citrus notes, yeast and wheat. Also some grassy hops, which is not typical to this style. Rich but still refreshing.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget
BBE 2013.04.02 - 
Pours hazy orange with a foamy white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat malts, grassy hops and banana. Taste is quite wheaty with notes of banana, yeast, spices and grassy hops. Finish is smooth and slightly hoppy. Nice, quite balanced hefeweizen.
Bottle. Huge head with excellent duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruits, wheat malt, citrus and hops.

Tried this beer on tap at The Flying Saucer in Addison, TX. Wheat and bitterness hit the taste buds up front with a balanced slightly sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled.
Pours a hazy orange with a rocky whipped creamy white head on its top.
Fresh, floral hoppy nose and refined aroma escorted by honey biscuits, bubblegum and bananas. Creamy mouthfeel.
It finishes light dry and gently warming with mild citrusses and spices.
Fine, enjoyable one.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty - wheaty sweetish flavor, faint caramel, banana and fruitiness, light citrus hoppyness and light yeast. Body is medium, malty - wheaty and sweetish, some banana and some fruitiness, light citrus hoppyness. Finish is average, malty - wheaty, lightly sweetish with some fruitiness, light banana and light citrus hoppyness. OK hefeweizen with light citrus hoppyness - not too sweet.
Con questa devo sinceramente ammettere che questo birrificio fa sempre delle weizen originale e meravigliose, non essendo un amante dello stile, vale di più...

Pours a very cloudy deep golden. Strong two finger head. Strong banana and cloves on the nose. bubble gum palate. Solid wheat beer with a lot of flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Slightly hazy and golden, with a fluffy white head. Nice banana esters in the nose with hints of spice. Taste is surprisingly bitter but balances out nicely leaving a very mild sweet finish. Medium body with soft carbonation.
Color medium orange with medium head. Aroma banana, orange, wheat. Taste wheat, banana.

500 ml bottle. 1666. BB 06/05/2013. (Systembolaget) Östersund, Sweden.
Hazy pale golden colour with average size fluffy white head.
Wheat, yeast, rubber and caramel in aroma.
Flavour is grassy hoppy, yeasty, rubbery, wheaty and with some mild caramel sweetness. Very tasty. Excellent.
Bottle. Pours a light gold colour with a big white head, wheat and spicy aroma, the taste is slighty bitter with plenty of wheat, with a long dry finish.

Pours a clear bronze with 1 finger creamy head that persists. No lacing, but a beautiful pour. Bready and yeasty with some banana and maybe a little clove in it. Mild herbal hoppy flavor to it.  Sweet flavor up from that actually has a biting tartness to it as well. Medium to full-bodied with creamy, not overly effervescent carbonation.  Smooth, medium creamy finish. This is a very good Hefe.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours clear amber with a off white head.
Rather heavy aroma of malt, banaa and apples.
Sweet wheat taste, some apples and alchohol. Smooth.
Found this to be quite refreshing wheat beer which went down well with our german visitors. Good around the BBQ
500 ml bottle. Pours amber with medium head and lots of carbonation. Aromas of banana and cloves. Frothy. Flavors of lemons, light malts, and nutmeg. Nice.

On CASK at TJs Everyday, Paoli, PA - 25/05/12!
Slightly obscured golden amber colour with a big fluffy white head.
Wheat, bread, malt, banana on the nose.
Taste follows aroma wheat up front, banana, yeast, a little clove in the finish.
Medium bodied with low carbonation.
This worked really well on cask and was a find having been to Germany so many times and not sampled anything on cask!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Its unclear, dark golden with a creamy, lasting head. The aroma has notes of yeast, clove, peach, pineapple and other fruit, and wheat. The flavor is sweet and heavily clove-y spicy from the yeast, but the hops also clearly shine through. Other notes are fruit and wheat, and the finish is spicy and slightly dry and bitter.

Fantastic strong hefe. Pours a bright golden orange body with a finger of off white head and no carbonation. The nose is sweet and has an awesome yeast ester based aroma with big lemony and banana notes. The flavor has an crisp and full bodies refreshing wheat malt, light citrus fruit and a medium sweetnezs. Overall not much banana or bubblegum, but tasty for sure!

This poured a cloudy darker yellow with a white head.  Aroma was very spicey, lots of clove and banana as well, some yeast notes too.  Flavor was much the same, lots of spice, banana galore, and yeasty grainy in the finish a true german hefe at its best.

#61
 Ein vollmundiges Weißbier mit grandioser Süffigkeit! Die Aromen nach Hefe, Citrusfrüchten, Nelke und Hopfen sind auch im Geschmack vorhanden. Der trockene Abgang könnte noch etwas prägnanter sein. Insgesamt ein delikates Weizen!
	
Test vom 20.10.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,13,14,12,11,13 - 12,90
Hazy pale orange to yellow colour. Yeasty aroma, nutmeg, vanilla and clove. More of the same on the palate with a highly carbonated mouthfeel and sour lemon cake like finish. Good stuff.

500ml bottle. The bottle splooged over the top with foam all over my shorts when I opened it. Thanks, Schneider. When I got from dabbing my shorts with a wet cloth, the head all already disappeared. The body is a surprisingly clear red/orange color (was possibly hazier on the 2nd pour), with active-looking carbonation. Carbonation is pronounced, but soft. Finishes dry. Medium body. Good spicy clove flavor, more prominent here than the banana notes are. Nice spicy, light sweet, light tart taste. Lightly salty. Fine hefeweizen, but not outstanding. Much more on the spicier side, I think.
Clear golden colour with a large lively frothy head. Lace clinging to the glass. Aroma of clove, banana and wheat. Crisp beer. Very bitter with a lively carbonation. Spicy flavour of clove and wheat.

Bottle pours a hazy orange with a beige head.  Candi sugar bubble gum aromas with that wheat, lemon, banana and yeast backing it up.  Interesting and inviting.  Smooth creamy body.  Sweet malts with a good amount of wheat. It dries quickly with the alcohol and bitter hops and yeast in the finish.  The alcohol is pretty prominent but at the abv for a hefe, youre going to notice it. This is pretty good stuff.  I might try it without the yeast next time.

From a 500 ml bottle: APPEARANCE: Pours a rich hazy yellow with a short lived fluffy white head and little lacing. AROMA: I get primarily cloves/spices and yeast. TASTE: The taste is clove/spice accompanied with a bit of grain. There is a hint of sweetness in the finish. MOUTHFEEL: Medium-light and smooth although there is a spicy element present. OVERALL: Enjoyable and I would drink it again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Tria - this beer is fantastic.  Similar quality to the other Schneider Weisse Hefeweizens, but this one has a little more bite - I actually detected hints of ginger in the palate and finish - very unique and very enjoyable.  Had to order 2 of these!

.5 bottle. Yellow hazy, as should be. Weiss aromas; banana and cloves. Compared to your average schneider, there seems to be a lot more fruityness. Even ginger aromas. Really nice though. Actually, after warming up a bit it feels almost like a thickish wit. Im confused.-- bb/h
UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 Hazy orange color with big head. Aroma is hops, citrus, yeast, wheat. Flavor is hops, wheat and yeast. Pretty tasty!
A bottle from Systembolaget. Yellow-to-orange color, medium carbonation. Smells a little banana. Surprisingly hoppy and very good after-taste.
This weisse has a super clean finish and rich but classy esthers.  Very smooth and satisfying.   I enjoyed this more than perhaps any weisse I have had.  Cant wait to try more.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear dark golden colour. Surprisingly uncloudy. Frothy almost white head that doesnt leave much lace. Huge clove note hits the nostrils first. Theres some fresh fruit underneath but nothing that jumps out as bananas. If anything it reminds me most of those marshmallow peanuts. More spice besides the clove as well. The clove really gets pushed back on the palate and its a bubblegum and bananas show with a lot of spice in the finish.
50cl. Bottle. Poors hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is banana, some malts, orange, citrus. Taste is sweet, no bitter. Mouth-feel creamy Good!

Botte at home. Pours a hazy dark yellow colour with medium frothy off-white head. Fruity aromas of yeast, banana, and a good portion of spices including coriander. The flavour is light and fruity with much of the same, but also some citrus. Soft and slick mouthfeel, and light bitterness. A fresh and light summer hefeweizen.

0,5 l bottle.  Best before 07. DEC 2012
bread, cereal, bread, herbs, banana, amber-orange, cloudy, tan foam, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, sticky, average carbonation, quite bitter,
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Nose of banana. Sweet, mellow with aroma of banana, citrus, some spice. Very sweet, enjoyable.

Pours cloudy honey with a short lived white head. Aroma is intense wheat and yeast with hints of caramel and spice.  Taste is mostly sweet caramel with some spice and banana. Slightly bitter finish. Sweeter than most hefeweizens that I have had.

Bottle. Big estery nose of banana, citrus and yeast. Looks wonderful in my tall weizen glass. Hazy gold pour, fluffy white head. High carbonation. Decent enough retention. The taste is everything Weizen lovers look for. Taste is bready, clove, some honey, and a slightly dry finish.
 A bit of grassy hops in the finish with a refreshing, super light bitterness. The body is a light. Overall this is a fine weizen.  I wish I had a bottle of their standard Hefe to compare this to.  No matter, I would drink this again. Oh, I have two more bottles in my fridge so I am going to drink this again. And if you like a quality German wheat, here is yet another example.

Bière blonde voilée ayant un col mousseux respectable et durable le temps nécessaire. Le nez est typique aux weizen, une odeur de purée de banane est au rendez-vous, accompagnée de pointes épicées. Pourquoi la Bubble Yum me revient constamment à lesprit? En bouche, cest plus dans une palette acidulée que le goût se situe, je pense au levain, accompagné dun picotement prononcé et ce, dès les premiers instant. Une amertume est présente. Cest bon. (267-150612)

Bottle. The pour was a murky brownish yellow with a large (2-3 finger) white frothy head that lasted a little while, reducing to a medium cap which created some excellent sheets of lacing.

The aroma was of a light grain malt and a bold sweaty yeast with notes of citrus (lemon), banana, wheat and a bit of spice (clove and coriander).

The taste was a tad sweet with a moderately strong citrus note early on, becoming rather wheat engulfed with a hint of banana, spice and was mildly acetic towards the end. The flavor lingered for a decent duration proceeding the swallow with a nice mild tart citrus wheat taste left to settle on the taste buds.

Mouthfeel was a few steps above light in body and a bit watery in texture with a mildly strong carbonation.

Overall a very impressive Organic Hefeweizen, one with a nice citrus banana taste and a slight appealing tartness at the finish. This is one of the best Organic brews I have had to date...

Bottle, labeled as Tap 4 Mein Grünes, from Systembolaget if i remember correctly.
Hazy sparkling orange body, big fluffy white head. If this dont get you thirsty no beer will. The head stays till the glass is empty. 
Aroma of banana, bubblegum and lemon, very fresh yeasty taste with wheat, hops, spices. Lasting bitterness. A grest thirst quencher and a great example of a good hefeweizen.

On bottle from bolaget Strømstad.
Golden ( almost orange) unclear, good foam.
Fruity, banana &some tropical fruit
Medium body & complexity 
Very enjoyable

500ml brown bottle. The beer is honeyish gold colour and is hazy. The head of this beer is full and thick. Some creamy clinging foam. Nose has a big spicy clove attack and lemon. Taste has wheat, lemon notes, spice. lemon is light in the aftertaste. Medium body, big carbonation. Overall and enjoyable weissebier, the small bump in abv is not noticed.

500ml bottle. Hazy apple juice-colored with small off-white head. Aroma has citrus, banana, caramel and sweets. Taste apple, sweet mature bananas. Long concentrated aftertaste with citrus and notes of grass. Strong carbonation. Impressive beer!

Pours a cloudy orangish yellow with thick white head, decent lacing.  Aroma is solid of wheat, yeast, citrus hops, and bit of banana and clove way in the back.  Flavor matches well and is a bit more hoppy than what I would expect in a hef, but pretty solid nonetheless.

More hops than a traditional hefeweizen, but the brewer pulls the hoppiness off with the utmost skill. The nose is like sniffing a lemon sitting on a piece of fresh sourdough whe standing in a field of freshly cut hay.  The beer is a very hazy golden with a foamy fluffy white head. The taste is the same citrus notes of the nose, but with the strong statement of floral hops and clove spice. The beer is crisp and medium bodied, but decidedly light on the tongue with a bitterness unusual for the style, but pleasant. Delightful beer.
Bottle poured a nice cloudy gold color, aromas of clove, bananas, light spicy yeast.  Flavors are the same, light clove, banana flavors are nice with a kiss of light citrus.
hazy golden with one finger of head. typical hefe clove and banana, but missing the zing ive experienced with other hefes. good, not great.
Aromas are sweet grains and a bit of banana. Tasted more like a belgian strong ale. Some sweetness up front with a bitter, medicinal finish. Not bad. But not the best hefeweizen Ive ever had.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2013 June 9, 2012: Nice sweet banana aroma. Very attractive beer - one of the best looking hefeweizens Ive seen. Im concerned my bottle was not fresh because the taste is oddly bitter, and not the IPA way, but in the tonic water sort of way. Still, there was a wheaty undertone, but the it was really really dry. Id like to rate this again with another bottle.
Re-rate, Feb 9: 2012. A different bottle, a different experience. Not bitter at all. Bready, slight banana aroma. Dark cloudy brown yellow colour. Taste is sweet, bready, very nice, not bitter. Better than the previous, probably spoiled bottle.

500ml bottle, as Tap 4 Mein Grünes, brought back home from Systembolaget Kiruna. Dense and rocky, chalk white head slowly fading over a golden body with a wheat haze. Fragile lacing. Ripe fruity nose spiced with clove. Well blended taste of weissen ingredients like wheat, sweet ripe fruits, bread and fair amount of clove. A backdrop of fruity tartness shows up towards the finish preventing the beer from been too sweet. Foamy in the mouth. Taste of summer. A fine weizen in my book (Tromsø, 08.06.2012).
500ml bottle.  Pours a hazy brown gold with a large head.  Aroma is banana, yeast, wheat and clove.  Taste is mostly wheat, some clove on the finish and a little banana on the aftertaste.
Smak och doft av vete, jäst, örter, toner av tropisk frukt och banan. Ett bra veteöl.

half-liter bottle - pours like true honey with decent white head.  Nose is banana and yeasty bread.  Flavor adds a little hoppiness.  Burp.  Taste is sweet with a lingering bitterness.  This is just what I needed after spending four hours clearing brush: cool, refreshing, malty goodness and character.  Its summertime!
Dark, cloudy, golden/amber color.  Generous head when poured in Weiss-Bier glass.  Aromas of wheat, bread, banana.  Wheat & fruit flavors.  Some bitterness, but very tasty.
Very good, almost top marks! Wonderfully sour with a nice body. The color is hazy yellow with big foam.
Cloudy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, clove, & spice; Flavor of wheat, some yeast, clove, bananas, fruit, and spice; Nicely balanced; Different overall - enjoyable.

30th April 2012Brewdog Camden. Hazy gold beer, tidy white head. Softish dry palate with prickly carbonation. Creamy dry malt. Nice dried fruits and mild herbs and spices. Finishes dry with some fruity orange. Nice enough!

Bottle 0.5. Labeled as Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes. Pours a cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma is wheaty, banana, spices, cloves and yeast. Taste is also wheaty with banana and yeast leading to a yeasty and wheaty finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaske 0,5l fra Systembolaget, Kiruna. Drukket hjemme 20 Mai 12. Lys gylden. Veldig høyt skinnende hvitt bobleskum med kremkarakter på toppen. Fester seg litt til glasset. Varer ei god stund. Aromaen er sitrus. Smaken er likedan. Litt søt, men blir raskt avløst av en syrlig ettersmak. Etterlater en tørr bitterhet. Mye sedimenter i flaska.

Hazy golden orange thick frothy full lasting soft-white head. Smells of sweet malt, orange peel, banana with yeast, and light spices. Medium creamy with light carbonation body. Sweet butter, banana, light citrus and dry hops and wheat. Has a nice spice of cinnamon that I really enjoyed. A great beer.

Smells like wheaty beauty and some barnyard smells. Pours a golden tan, Tastes really amazing, one of the better hefes Ive tried. A little bubble on the aroma and a good soft carb follow through on the wheat. This is going to be a good night. Half L bottles from the S-A-Q.

Cask...pours an orange amber with a creamy white head.  Aroma has a spicy/wheaty quality with a shellfish note.  Flavor follows suit...more spicy...definite shellfish note to it...some bitterness and some boozy, hot notes.  Mouthfeel is medium and the finish is boozy with spice and shellfish...not a fan!

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2012 Labeled as Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes. Pours a cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma is wheaty, banana, spices, cloves and yeast. Taste is also wheaty with banana and yeast leading to a yeasty and wheaty finish. Not bad.

Very nice looking, a hazy murky orange with a head.  Nose is bright, full of fruit, surprisingly some darker fruit like plums, and dominated by cloves.  Palate is soft and fruity, but very heavy with ripe bananas.  As it warms, there is a nice mouthfeel, syrupy.  This has to be about as good as it gets for this style.

Bottle. Cannot make out a best by date. Pours with a hazed golden yellow body and a large white head that lasts and leaves good lace, in fact outstanding lace. Aromas are lightly grassy/light struck at first. Beyond that there are hoppy, citrusy, herbal, noble with some sharp phenol, 4VG, citrusy, bready, malty. Not a lot of typical esters. Flavors are dry, bready, very low isoamyl acetate, nearly an unripe banana, wheat, medium citrus and herbal hops, citrusy, medium phenol. 

Extremely lively carbonation on a medium body. Creamy, not warming at all. Quite hoppy, pleasantly so. Cant believe I havent had this till now.

Bottle 0,5 l - jollybeers.net
Appearance: Cloudy amber color with a medium, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. 
Aroma: - light to moderate - malt, orange peel, yeasty(dough), spices, cloves, sambucus. 
Taste: moderate sweet and light bitter with a long to average duration.
Palate: Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is average.

Pours hazy dark gold.  White frothy head   great aroma , hoppy and grassy and sweet candy aromas .  Flavor is crisp grassy and lemony and clean but finishes a bit malty ..wanted it to be more of a clean finish i guess   but still, this is a good one. A really great beer !

Pretty good but a little disappointing. Dry and grassy. 

Bottle shared with Alan Xmas 2011. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy amber colour with a big white head. Sweet aroma with light banana and some vanilla. As usual a very sweet wheat flavour with some banana. But also very hoppy and light spicy. Seriously good :-)[Bottle from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden]

Big estery nose of white pepper, banana and citrus. Lots of lacy head tops a murky yellow with carbon dioxide bursting forth. Spicy, tart bitter taste that make it hard to believe theres no spicing added. On the lighter side I guess, hard to say with all the effervescence. Behold the power of wheat. One of the best hefes around.
Bottle. Medium orange with a short lived head. Aroma is butter and some fruit. Flavour is light spicy fruit with a fizzy tongue feel. Palate is fizzy caramel

Bottle. Poured an orange cooper color with a smaller white head that went rather quick. Aroma was weaker. Faint malts, banana and citrus. Flavor was sweeter malts, biscuits, citrus and bubblegum. Thinner body. Easy to drink. Average beer.
On tap at Weisses Brauhaus in Munich. Herby hefeweizen? Yes, its true. Not ámítás.

Orange hazy with a nice full head. Intensive smell of fruits, perfume, flowers, citrus. Taste is quite the same. Only a little yeast and banana to be noticed. A little sweet, light bitterness, full body.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma of toffee, strong cloves, spicy and wheat. Flavor is sweet and spicy with some toffee and citrus. 
Medium body, average body.Nice strong cloves.

Bottle 500ml @ gunnfryd
