Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, banana and citrus hops. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium  bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Keg at brewdog. Hazy murky yellow amber, creamy white head. Rich fruity nose, big banana, bubblegum, apricot, white pepper. Dry palate, juicy citrus, hint of fruity esters, banana, peppery hops and a dry earthy linger. Not bad!

Keg at BrewDog, Edinburgh. Pours a hazy yellow, finger of head. Aroma is great wheat beer, wheat notes, banana, spices. Taste is similar, with a really nice spicy side, lots of ester. More than just another wheat beer. Medium body, long chewy finish. Refreshing, too. Very nice.

Shared 0,5 l bottle at Cardinal. Clear sparkling pale golden body with a fingerthick white head. Light spicy nose with light notes of ripe banana and light malts. Spicy, sweet and light bitter flavors. Light to medium body. Light doughy texture and a dry tongue at the end.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2015 50 cl, bottled. Pours cloudy amber with a nice white head. Aroma: Fresh malt, wheat, yeast, spices, cinnamon. Fruity. Taste: Over medium sweet, dough. Pleasant bitterness. Yeasty notes. Banana and clove. Even hints of chocolate tones. Palate: Medium body and average carbonation, just a little bit thin. Very refreshing. Liked it very much (26.3.2012, 8-4-8-3-16).

50 cl, bottled (26.10.2015). Pours clear amber, pleasant bubbles. Decent white head. Aroma: Wood smoke, vinegar. Malt, bread. Toasted white bread. Taste: Medium sweet, malty, wheaty flavours. Notes of acidity. Yeasty tones. Very pleasant. Some bitterness and grass. No score changes. Still like it very much. Very balanced.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with a persistent white head. Smells like hay. Tastes like pear, wheat and bananas, with a nice spicy, peppery finish. Body is average, as is carbonation level. Quite good!

Keg at Euston Tap, London. It was labelled as Mein Grunes. A hazy golden coloured pour with a healthy white head on top. Yeasty, banana aroma. Tastes of banana, malty, yeasty, sweet, some vanilla. A little predictable from Schneider Weisse but still decent.

On tap at the Euston Tap as Schneider Mein Grunes, hazy gold with fine white head and aroma of lemon and peach. Wheat biscuits, a hint of banana, and green hops in a drying body. Touch of yeast coming through in the dry bitter and faintly peppery finish.

Hazy pale straw colored pour. Big white head and plenty of lacing. Huge banana aroma with malty sweetness and a slight hoppy aroma. Big malty banana bread taste. Sweet with a slight bitterness. Very nice.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Vika. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Tried it first without the sediments. Then it was clear golden and less sweet, quite fresh and reminded me of green apples. With the sediments it felt somewhat less fresh, more sweet. Aroma of wheat, yeast, not-quite-fully-riped bananas, fruits and hints of citrus and spices. Sweet and fruity with a slightly bitter and citrusy finish. Very nice weissbier and it goes down dangerously easy.

Bière blonde de 6.2 % dalcool. Fortement mousseuse au versement. Elle possède un odorat de bière blanche, citronné, avec un petit goût dépice, genre du thym. Elle possède un petit arrière-goût salée. Elle est très rafraîchissante, malgré la simplicité de la bière.

Toffee, banana (though the missus said she could smell melon "do they all smell of melon?")

I like more alcohol though - 6 is a big hit - looking forward to 5 now.

A light yellow slightly hazy body with Doh! I forgot to pour in the yeasty sediments! Ok, lets *sluuuurp* use a straw to get some of the beer back into the bottle shaken swirl and pour back into the glass. Thats more like it! A medium to dark yellow cloudy body with a large, creamy, white head. The head reduces to a .5 cm layer quite rapidly, but this layer stays until my brand new Scheneider Weisse glass (I love you, ebay!) is empty. Inviting and intense yeasty aroma with perfume and soapy notes, citrus, spices, sweet fruits (banana is an obvious example) and hints of yeasty chalkiness. The taste is moderate sweet with a nice acidic touch and also a very light bitterness in the finish. The lovely flavours are according to the aroma. Enjoyable dry mouthfeel, medium body and medium to lively carbonation. One of the better hefeweizens Ive had!
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 1 month after BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

Tap. Slightly hazy golden color with a tiny white head. Weak nose, some sugar, banana, yeasty bread. The taste is light sweetness, some alcohol, flowery banana. Thin, a little flat, unsubstantial and watery on the finish. Overall, really not one that I Iike. This brewery does much better than this...

A little bigger and bolder than the average hefe and I thought it was pretty good.  Retains drinkability of German festival (session) beers.  Some light citrus and and good bit of yeastiness and grass.  Overall above average hefe thats worth a try.
50cl. Golden colour and medium white head. Taste is sweet with some banana notes, I agree. Its a nice Hefeweizen, smells, looks and tastes exactly as expected.

A nice hefeweizen. Crisp and refreshing. Aroma was a little weak. Sweet grain and hints of yeast. Pour was a beautiful cloudy light gold with a one finger white head. Taste was nice and light. Just a small hint of banana with the same sweet graininess as in the aroma. Sweet cream and even a small hint of vanilla is detectable. Nice carbonation. Not as good as some of the others, but  a nice lawnmower beer.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
Location/Date:Bottle on March 3rd, 2012 split with Dave.
Appearance: Pours a clear gold. 
Aroma: Solid wheat malt, faint banana, clove. 
Taste: Wheat taste, tastes fresh, some banana.   
Palate:Light body, light fizz.
Summary: My bottle is listed as "organic", and is a different label than pictured. This is a nice german hefe, refreshing, a tick higher in alcohol percentage than usual hefeweizens.

500 ml to weizen golden wheat fill engaging large retained head, pushing defining citris spice, banana bread to nose. Soft accomodating fizz lends creaminess while melding additional flavor dimensions. Delish....
An organic beer that has a story of history and privilege.  Makes you feel privileged to even drink it on this side of the pond.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2012 Bottle pour a murky dark gold with a thin off white head. Scent is wheaty with spics. Taste is wheat, citrus and spice.The aroma is sweet with notes of dusty hops and wheat. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of wheat, citrus, and dusty hops.

Hazy medium amber with a long-lasting 1/4" head and lace that rolls back into the glass.  The taste is similar to Schneider Weisse: a solid gingery caramel malt that is balanced with light bittering at the finish.  It is a definitive example of the style, well worth seeking out, as are all of the Schneider offerings.
Doftar banan och gröna äpplen. Kroppen är där och beskan är lätt. Slutsats: Mycket god och smakrik.

Pours hazy, golden with a generous head. The nose has strangely stewed apples. The taste has green apples, grapes and is creamy. The palate medium in structure and texture with a fresh finish. Overall, not what I was expecting - strange but quite good.
Bottle. A good Hefeweizen. Thinner body and not quite as flavorfull as their Schneider Weisse Original. That being said, this is still a solid and very drinkable hefe.
Very good mix of bananas and yeast in aroma and flavor, along with a pretty good body.  A great hefe all around.
Sweet aroma with banana, clove, and bubblegum.  Flavor is wheat and banana and maybe some vanilla.  A lot of carbonation gives this a creamy mouthfeel.  Very nice.

Poured from a bottle into a Weizen Glass. Appearance is a hazy copper with a thick head of creamy white foam specked with brown sediment. The head retention on this beer is great. It lasted the entire beer, which was more than half an hour. Aroma is loaded with banana and clove and vanilla. Taste is doughy and banana-y in the best of ways. This is one bad ass beer.

Belle apparence et arôme complexe très fruitée (banane).  Arôme houblonnée très présente, florale, végétale.  Belle équilibre, mais le tout tombe à plat rapidement.  On aurait aimé un peu plus de durée.

Pours a hazy orange color with a nice white head and lots of carbonation. Aroma is bananas, cloves, lemon, and yeast. The taste is delicious. Bananas, cloves, orange peel, and lemon. One of the best hefes Ive ever had.

Hazy gold pour, fluffy white head. High carbonation. Aroma is black pepper, yeasty, with cloves, vanilla, banana and coconut. Less flavour than aroma. Up front is sweet with orange, honey, cloves, slightly nutty and yeasty. Finishes very bitter and mineral. Ok. A little watery and not very pleasant aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Det här upplever jag som en klassisk weissbier med tillhörande atiraljer som citrus smak med lite kryddor. Fast denna hade kanske lite mindre kryddor än brukligt. Men i slutändan är det här en angenäm weissbier.

Bottle from [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ömstad. Mate, hazy gold colour. Medium-high carbonation with white rich head. Smells of (over)seasoned fruit, pine needles and wet forest. Subtle hints of hops. Slightly bitter aftertaste that rounds off the taste nicely.  Earlier Rating: 12/22/2011 Total Score: 3Bottle from Systembolaget Strömstad. Mate, hazy colour. Medium-high carbonation and white, rich head. Smells of fruit, pine needles and wet forest. Subtle hints of hops, slightly bitter aftertaste that rounds off taste nicely.
buena como todas las schneider muy buen aroma frutado agradable al paladar,fresca,aromatica un olor a banana citricos ,floral. Una buenisima cerveza,recomendada
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: hazy dark blonde with fluffy white head that soon disappears. aroma is black pepper and bubblegum with a hint of cloves. Fairly highly carbonated first flavour is cloves followed by hay meadows and wheat spiciness with a fairly short finish.

as schneider weisse mein grune.
hazy yellow, white smooth head. ysaty aroma. faint flowery, fruity, yeasty, dry peaach flavor.

Mousse abondante et éphémère, robe jaune virant sur le brun.  
Mielleux et léger ave un peu dacidité.  Pas beaucoup de complexité mais cest dans je laime bien quand même.  Une très bonne bière dété.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on November 11. Pours hazy golden yellow with a big creamy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some lacing. Smell is sweet and spicy with white bread, banana and cilantro. Taste is spicy with cilantro, white pepper and cloves and leaves a warm feeling in your tummy after youve swallowed the first sip. Theres also a malty sweetness that reminds me of banana bread with other sweet, very ripe, fruits added. Theres also a distinct yeasty taste. Mouthfeel is rather light which adds to the drinkability of this beer and helps make it a great match with food where it usually blends with the taste of the food rather than playing a too big or too small role. Finish is slightly sweet and slightly dry with white pepper. A great beer!

Yellowish-orange-cream, dense head, slighly irregular over fully hazy orange beer with a mossy sheen. Banana, smoked baconrind, salty, spices and citrus - an  "ur"-Weizen smell. Drier, meatier and saltier than most Weizens, way less fruity than most. Some banana, lots of nutmeg, spiced bread - very balanced. Well-carbonated, spritzy, very wheatslick, medium bodied. IMO, maybe one of the best Weizens around.
Nose is decent hay, banana, little barn yard, feel is mediumbroad, carb is mediumheavy, taste is sweets, mediumweak apricot, pear, later bittersweet hops

500ml bottle poured a hazy golden color with a modest white head that left some light lacing behind.  Aroma of orange and yeast.  Taste is light sweet maltiness with some orange and yeast and a light hoppy bitter finish.  Overall, this is a tasty hefeweisen.
Poured hazy and straw colored with a large white head. Aroma of yeast and bananas. Really smooth mouthfeel. Classic.

500ml bottle, says organic so not sure it should go here or not. Hazy golden orange with an-off white head. A nice orange aroma, along with wheat, coriander, banana and a bit of straw. Nice mouthfeel - decent body and carbonation, some initial sweetness, well balanced with some bitterness and fruit, a slight bit of fruit funk, nice dry finish with some orange zest and hops. Have to admit this is probably the best organic beer Ive had - props!

Location: 500 ml bottle from Colonial Wine and Spirits, 10/26/11


Aroma: The nose is rather yeasty, with some wheat, cloves, and spice.

Appearance: Pours a slightly cloudy orange color with a foamy white head and waves of lace.  The lace is kind of odd.  It looks sort of like waves on the side of the glass, and seems dissimilar to any other lace I can recall.  

Flavor: It tastes similar to the nose, it is medium sweet, lightly bitter, and it has a spice component.

Palate: The body is light-medium, the carbonation is somewhat fizzy, and the finish is refreshing and clean.

Overall Impression: 
This is a rather solid hefe.  A quality offering, and I enjoyed drinking it.  Ive been going back and rating/re-trying all of the Shneider beer that I hadnt tried in along time recently, and I have to say, these guys really know their weissbiers, no wonder its in their name.
Citrusy taste and aroma, also banana. The finish is mildly bitter, theres also a sour note there. Spices in the aroma. A hazy orange colour, white head. (Bottle)

Bottle enjoyed at home from a weissbier glass 
Orange brown, yeast hazy, very very big fantastic looking head. Best looking hefe ive seen. Smells of banana, yeast esters, wheat and tiny hints of citrus. Taste of wheat malts, sweetness, citric acids and some banana. Interesting switch in dominance between banana and citrus from aroma to taste. Finishes off witrhe a nice bitterness wi
(draught - Loreley Manhattan) cloudy orange with white head. Aroma of clove, banana, yeast. Flavor also banana, yeast, some clove, wheat malt.
Aroma is banana, fruit, some yeast, coriander and spices. Taste is full bodied, yeasty banana, fresh, silk and long aftertaste of coriander and spiced.
Bottle at Køge Øldage. Cloudy orange colour with a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit and hops.
Corpulente malgré sa grosseur. Couleur doré très trouble. Le caractère du blé ressort agréablement. Légère amertume épicée, éphémère. Buvabilité monstrueuse.

Shared this at a Fantasy Football draft - thanks, Bill! This one has the bright green label, very handsome. Bright straw gold with tons of carbonation, earthy and vibrant all the way. Nose is very appealing, with tons of wheat and yeast and dry hops in the finish. Body is brimming, smooth, very lush. Flavors are very pleasant, with nothing artificial at all as happens so often with American attempts (indeed, this ones fully organic as I understand it). Dry citrus rind, white pepper, grass, just a model rendition of the style.

Hefig-nelkiger und orangiger Geruch. Im Antrunk denn auch harmonisch hefig und zitrusartig. Aromatische und harzige Mitte, die an Nadelbäume erinnert. Blumig und herb-trocken abschließend. Astrein!Test vom 10.2.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Alla typiska karaktärsdrag för en Hefe Weisse. Lite starkare än orginal, 6,2 istället för 5,4. Också något torrare vilket jag uppskattar. Välkryddad, estrig, friskt jästig och en alldeles utmärkt törstsläckare i sommar eller till en god fiskrätt. En veteöl blir inte bättre än så här. Fantastiskt gott.
Bottle 500ml. A cloudy orange colour with a white head. An aroma of spice, banana, yeast and hops The taste is medium sweet with a light bitter finish.

500ml bottle.
Pours a cloudy, medium orange, with a firm white head.
Very spicy aromas, cloves, ginger, bananas, wheat, yeast, cinnamon, citrus, hops.
Dry, light bodied (medium for a weissen, though), low bitterness, lively CO2.
The taste is also quite spicy - cloves, yeast, hops, with citrus, green banana (estery), wheat. Very clean and precise.
Finishes slightly bitter, with the alcohol burning through a little too markedly. Damned tasty, nevertheless. (2011-08-27)
3/5 in darkness. Smells frutiy, abit hoppy. Hoppy sweet taste, abit bitter and a touch of alcohol.

Pours a hazy copper-gold with a big, foamy off-white head. Nose is mostly wheat bread and semi-bitter hops, with a tough of fruit and nuttiness. Flavor moves from a very generic front to a mix of bananas and heavy wheat bread on the back. Hops are present but not assertive. Finish is mostly dry. Decent beer and a good example of the style.

Appearance: murky orange, one-finger near-white head, minimal lacing.   Aroma: cracked wheat, cloves, white pepper, hint of salami.   Taste: zesty citrus, wheat bread, yeast, grass/hay, peppercorns.   Finish: crisp, a little dry, with yeasty, wheaty remnants.   Notes: Great HW.  Very similar to the Schneider Weisse Original, but a little lighter, a little less sweet and more peppery.  Delicious.

bottle - cloudy orange beer with a dirty white head. Nice weizen aroma with a touch of citrus and grassy hops notes. Flavour is quite sweet with a very refreshing finish. Pre-stage of "Hopfenweisse". Medium carbonation.

Verre de dégustation provenant dune bouteille de 500 ml dégusté au Mondial de la Bière 2010 (Montréal, QC). Arôme: Odeur dagrumes avec une pointe dépices. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de bananes et dagrumes avec une pointe de clous de Girofles. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Présence de banane en arrière goût. (Rating #3744)

0.5l bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. This one pours a cloudy golden-orange body with a big fluffy and everlasting white head. Aroma is light and wheaty. Notes of green banana and some cloves indeed. Lively carbonated, light oily mouthfeeling, and its medium-bodied. Tastes wheaty and refreshing. Notes of grass and a quite strong clove-flavor. Ends light watery with hints of sugar in the aftertaste. Good weiz!

A real good german hefe. Medium orange coloured and unclear, murky. Has a white head, mostly lasting. Lots of aromas, coriander, cinnamon, megnut, real spicy and harmonic. Long duration, moderate sweet, some acidity, moderate bitter finish. Lively carbonation

Bottle. Fascinating murky medium-orange with a touch of beige around the edges. Healthy lemon and wheat cereal aromas complimented by a pinch of nutmeg. Refreshing palate carries a zippy pepper edge, and even the finish carries a touch of heat. Other flavour nodes include nutmeg, leather and citrus peel. Quite enjoyable.
This may be my favorite Hefeweizen. Good corn, barley tone to it. Smooth and full of flavor

Bottle at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Just another German Hefeweizen. Standard yellow color, standard typical weizen smell and taste. Maybe this is one a little above average, but nothing special in my opinion.

Was a clear golden almost light amber highlights until i swirrled and poured the rest now a cloudy dark golden very light brown.Nose is hard to describe same with taste just a style on its own hint of lemon in there somewhere,unique yeast type that i tend not to care for same with the english yeast styles
Aroma reminds me of mild fruit maybe clove and a strangers house smell.Kinda perfumy like mildly not bad.
.This had that mild english like taste.It has a good malt taste though smooth enough not to taste the 6.2% This one i picked up is organic. A good wheat beer not thrilled about the yeast character.

Pours a hazy yellow staw color body with a sparkling white head which turns into a thin white lid on top. Aroma of banana, newly baked bread, wheat and citrus. Refreshing mouthfeel, and has a nice fruty edge to it. Sweet finish with hints of orange peel. Perhaps my favourite hefeweizen, thus far.

Appearance: Transluscent golden yellow, huge white head, tons of carbonation. Aroma: Sweet, strong notes of banana, dough, yeast, bread, butterscotch and caramel. Palate: Smooth, nice finish. Taste: Very sweet, hints of slight bitterness, and very slight hint of tanginess. Very savoury. Nice, complex flavour. I love this beer.

Bottle. Hazy light golden body, big foamy white retention. Nose is banana, grains, hints of corn and clove. Taste is kinda astringent wheaty citrusy notes with some worty hints. Some hints of banana and clove. Parching mouthfeel and a bit too bitter for me; not a favorite.

Pours a hazy golden color with a frothy white head that lasts throughout and leaves some lacing. Aromas of banana and bready malt. Flavors of banana, bread and wheat. Creamy mouthfeel with just a tinge of bitterness on the finish. Overall this is an excellent Hefeweizen and one of the best organic beers Ive had.

29.07.2011. 0,5l Bottle. Systembolaget Charlottenberg. Labeled Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes. Golden yellow colour. Hazy and very unclear beer. Aroma is wheaty with aromatic hoppy flavours. Notes of banana.

500 ml bottle as Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes. Hazy golden orange with a fine white head. Nice aroma of yeast, bread, fruit and herbs. Flavor is fruity yeast, bread, banana and herbs. A really well made weissbier.

0.5 L bottle from Systembolaget, Charlottenberg, as Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes. Brief blond cream head leaving fine laces. Body is dim, deep golden. Yeast up front,  followed by a scent of doughy, faintly sourish wheat malts. Herbal and flowery notes, mild banana esters. Taste has a sharper edge than their regular. Herbal and spiced, with notes of citrus fruits. Medium sweet, crisp and rounded wheats malts is holding it all together. Smooth in the mouth. Filling. Herbs and mild spices in crisp wheaty finish. Nice all over.
Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass (label has changed).  Very highly carbonated, medium lacing, medium body, and good lacing.  Taste is clove and banana.  Good beer.

The scent is incredibly fruity with hints of apple, banana, yeast, citrus and hops. The taste is the same, amazingly fruity with an intriguing smoky tone that reminds me of smoked sausage. I have never tasted more fruity wheat beers than those from Schneider. Highly recommended!

50cl bottle from Systembolaget. Poured hazy copper color with a thin white head. Aroma is wheat mostly, some alcohol at first and some smokiness. Flavor is wheat, caramel malt and yeast. High carbonation, medium body. Refreshing and enjoyable, specially on a hot day like this!
spicy , apple and rabarber aroma,yellow,hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, creamy, soft carbonation, nice weath finish.

13/07/2011 50cl bottle @ home - bottled: 23/12/10, BB: 23/7/11 (2011-322) Cloudy amber to murky beige beer, creamy solid off-white head, pretty stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of banana on opening, then citrus and coriander notes, grassy and a bit herbal. MF: good carbon, medium body. Taste: citrus, grassy, little sour, then bready malts. Aftertaste: citrus, little bitter, sour touch, green banana.

Cloudy brown pour, a bit of sediment or something floated to the bottom, while another bit stayed on the head.  Head lingered a while.  Light malt-forward aroma with the typical hint of banana mash behind it, though a good blend of both.  Weirdly enough, I am also getting a scent of bologna as I drink more of it, which takes something away from the flavor.  More bready-malt than other flavors in the taste, but also has the banana and a hint of tartness, which adds a citrus feel, if not flavor.  I was missing Europe, and this definitely reminded me of Germany.  Pretty good except for the extraneous (though still German) scent.

Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and moderate hoppy and heavy yeasty aroma. Moderate bitter fantastic fruity flavor. Long moderate bitter wonderfull finish. Creamy palate. Excellent hefe.
Det är en vacker sommardag, du går omkring och luktar på blommorna och du översköljs av dofter som du inte kan placera, men det luktar gott. Här har du ölen som får dig att minnas den dagen. Köp!

Bottle.  Strangely sweet aroma that is dominated by honey, bread-like, with a slight carrot note.  Odd.  Deep copper color that is slightly hazy with a small white head.  Taste is bready, clove, some honey, and a slightly dry finish.  Medium body.  Different from many other hefeweizens, but maybe not the greatest interpretation of it.

Pour hazy golden pillowy white head great lace. Aroma clove, spice, wheat, bubble gum, coriander. Taste bubble gum,,banana, clove, spice, wheat malt, mild bitter, coriander. MF medium full body nice carb very refreshing. Excellent brew very flavorful and refreshing a great summer day brew.
Bottle. CLoudy golden with big white head. Flavour is wheat, malt, little sweet, banana, hops, little bitter and clove.

Sampled at SIB. Pours a cloudy yellow with a white lacing. Aroma of wheat, yeast, hay and bread. Flavour very similar but also a bit of corn in there too. Medium bodied. Alright, but nothing exciting.

Har man någon gång suttit i en syrenberså, i den surrande tystnaden, och undrat om det går att tappa upplevelsen på flaska - här kommer i så fall svaret: ja, det går, G. Schneider & Sohn har lyckats med det. Ett öl för lata dagar, när livet känns lättare än en maskrosboll.

Fairly yeasty aroma with wheat and a hint of coriander. There are some noticeable berry flavors in the taste, similar to those of black crowberries. There are also some hops present in the aftertaste, which is somewhat untypical. Although certainly not the best in its style, Mein Grünes is far more interesting than your average Hefeweizen.
Sampled from bottle at SIB, pours hazy yellow. Aroma of citrus, wheat, banana and clove. Flavour of wheat, banana, citrus and light fruits. Wonderfully well-rounded hef.
500ml bottle. Deep yellow colour, white fluffy head. Aroma of yeast, spice, banana. Taste is very spicy, bready malt, even a little smokiness. A little sweet alcohol. Nice beer.

Lemon-colored and cloudy with long-lasting one finger head. Peppery, banana nose. Malty intro leading to a smooth, mildly-carbonated mouthfeel followed by a sweet, overripe banana finish with notes of alcohol and grapefruit.

Driked like Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes. Hazy yellow colour with average white head. Spiced fresh aroma, herbal and grassy hopy notes. Medium bitterness and lightly sour in the taste with a round flavour. Medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation and a lightly bitter afte taste. Good.
Spicy and citrus aroma. Very refreshing fruity taste even if the ABV is over 6%.

High fluffy and lasting white foam.
Tiny clowdy golden color.
Bread aroma with some bananas.
Soft malty taste with tiny banana taste. Small sweetness and very drinkable.

Tasted this one when it was ABT beer of the month under the name Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes.  Its my favorite hefeweizen. Most of them taste the same, too sweet, candy like. This one tastes a bit more like beer and thats why its my favorite hefe.

500ml bottle purchased at the LCBO. Pours a cloudy golden colour, with a massive pillowy white head and some minor spotty lacing. Aroma is sweet and a little grainy. Taste is so sweet and delicious, quite bready and a little yeast.
wheaty/yeasty aroma. hazy dark yellow pour with big head. nice wheat flavour with banana and some yeast. little bit of alcohol warming as the beer warmed up. very nice hefe
Really nice beer with a pretty dry finish. Initial aromas of banana and some sweet stuff I cant quite place. Bitter dry finish. Lots of carbonation, a bit oily in the mouth. Great stuff.

Maybe I just dont get this one.  Looks like a hefeweiss should, and its got the basic flavour profile (banana, etc), but...ramped up alcohol cuts into the drinkability and the noticeable alcohol clashes with the bright wheaty goodness.  And at the same time the intensity of the wheaty goodness is really mellowed down and thinned out.  Plus it seemed to have an unusual hoppiness for the style.  Seemed indecisive.

Cloudy amber with a short lived, small off-white head. Aroma of wheat and spices, banana, bubblegum and caramel. The taste is a little sweet, and very mild both in fruitiness and yeast for a German Hefe. That being said, its a really crisp brew that finishes with a slight dryness. Light-medium bodied and very refreshing. Not as bold in flavor as the others Ive had from Schneider & Sohns, but quite enjoyable in its own right.

Bottle. Cloudy golden colour with a white head. Spicy, phenolic aroma. Spicy, phenolic, yeasty flavor. Lighter notes of saltiness and smoke. Noticeble alcohol. A bit astringent. Not my favorite weissbier.

Bottle from Systembolaget. It poured a hazy golden liquid with a reddish tint. Big fluffy white head. Strong smell of foam banana, cloves and wheat. Similar taste. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel, medium carbonation and medium thick body. A great wheat beer that rivals both Franzizkaner and Weihenstephaner at Systembolaget.

Bottle. Appearance: Hazy dark yellow, small snow white head, lots of visible carbonation and slightly hazy. Aroma: Wonderful yeasty orange zest, wheat, bananas, cloves and pepper. Flavour: Banana, lots of carbonation, pear, cloves, cinnamon with a quick tangy finish. Very pleasant.

Popurs cloudy amber with a small off white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is very fresh, bananas, yeasty, citric and cereal. Medium crispy mouthfeel. Flavor is bananas, yeast, cloves, a bit smokey, fruity and bread. Finishes fruity bananas and a bit citric with nice touch of bitterness.

Bottle as Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes. Hazy orange/yellow with a large, porous and creamy white head. Aroma is fresh: chewing gums, wheat, yeast, citrus. Taste: pretty sweet, oranges, chewing gum, citrus, a light spiciness, refreshing. Medium-bodied with lively carbonation. One of my favourite wheat bears.
Golden with nice head. Aroma yeast, fruit. Taste sweet fruit (apricot), yeast. Light body, smooth text, carb aver. Finish long sweetness.

Bottle.  This beer pours a cloudy yellow/dull amber color with a medium white head that dissipates quickly.  The aromas are bananas, clove, bubblegum.  The mouthfeel is watery and slightly set with a medium body.  This was great beer!  Cheers!

Der Antrunk ist stumpf hefig, die Aromen entäuschen dadurch, dass die sehr flach gehalten sind. Leider wird dies im Verlauf kaum besser: Die Hefigkeit wächst, der Hopfen verkümmert, das Bier wird süßer. Es mangelt eindeutig am Hopfen, insgesamt wirkt das Weizen zwar solide, von Schneider ist man aber mehr gewöhnt.  /8/10/8/11/9

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2012 Bottle @ home. Hazy orange appearance with an off white head. Bready, light banana, yeasty, wheat malty nose. Quite yeasty, bready, wheat malty flavor with a light banana fruity flavor (3.1). Update: bottle @ Schneider Kelheim. Soapy/floral, a touch spicy, fairly floral, light fruity aroma. A bready, floral, potpourri, lemon flavor. Not sure I see the hype behind this one (3.4).

500 ml bottle from Roths Sunnyside Market, Salem. $2.49..on clearance.
Says Organic" on the label, which is different from the one shown here.
Aroma  very nice , bananas, cherries ,yeast, wheat, bubblegum it is all here.
Its slightly hazy orange in appearance with a huge rocky white head
Taste mimics the aroma ,but is well under control and balanced.
Good palate to the beer..not to thin but well drinkable.
Overall a good beer that has stood up well to being out of date ( for a weiss) and stored horribly in a clearance cart.
Tasted 2011-04-21. Pours hazy straw yellow with white head. Cloves, banana, vanilla. Sweet without being nausiating. Rich, full bodied. Great.
Yeast, wheat, banana, coriander, lemon and other spices. Hazy orange colour, medium white head. flavour is the same as the nose with light bitterness. Mouthfeel is average. All in all a good beer.

[bottle]
Nice fresh citrusy aroma with slightly spicy caramel malt. Hazy light orange-brown with a white patch. Sweet and sour wheat malt flavour with citrusy hops. Clean and very refreshing with a slight corianer accent. Medium carbonation, medium body, clean finish.

Bottle picked up at Chevy Chase in DC. Served in a weizen glass.

Pours a medium gold color that is totally transparent...very weird. THe head is bone white with decent retention, though no real lacing. The nose is slightly bready with some mild yeast character. Disappointing. No real clove or banana. The flavor is just s plain. Beer has a medium body and is too chewy. Not a huge fan of this one.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-08-2011
Bottled:Pours a pale, muddy brown colour with a foamy head. Aroma is yeast, clove and citrus. Dry, yeasty flavour with notes of clove and citrus.
Pours with a big muffin top head from the bottle. Has a nice sweet aroma with some cooking spice notes that are also expresed on the tongue. The finish is slightly astringent but it mostly works.
wow. this might possibly tie as my favorite hefe with Paulaner. spicy, lots of banana and apple with bubblegum, yeasty almost thick on the tongue. fantastic.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2011 Bottle (50 cl) from Systembolaget. Cloudy golden, meduim white head. Spicy and phenolic aroma, with leather and rubber notes, some bananas, and some hops. Medium bodied carbonation. Fairly dry, low bitterness. Very nice.

Bottle. Very nice, well balanced Hefe. Very smooth texture. Relaxed and easy to drink. If this beer was a person, you would have wanted it to sit next to you and all of your friends without really saying much... because he would not have had much to say... but he would neither be a boring dude either... if you know what I mean :-)

Bottle.

Hazy golden/orange with a medium white head. A good and refreshing Hefeweizen with the classic elements of citrus, wheat, spices and banana.
Pours a nice golden straw with a thick head that dissipates quickly.  Good carbonation.  Nice wheat flavor throughout.  Slight oily mouthfeel.  A little malty in the beginning.

Bottle from SB cons 2011-04-11 Göteborg
AR: fizzy, porrige, yeast. 
AP: light coppar colored body, high intesive fizzy head, golden white in colour
F: yeast, slighty banana, some trpoical fruits, citrus, loaded with carbonation, honey swetness, medium bitterness and there is some dryness - like in a red grape juice. Refreshing - good on its own or with some BBQ (spicy pork etc).
UPDATED: APR 10, 2011 Exploded out of the bottle. Nice and bready taste, with clove. Slightest tartness and dull hops. Very nice beer, hard to go wrong with a traditional hefe.
Hazy golden with a medium white head. Yeast, lemon, soap in the aroma (btw, less banana than expected). More of the same in the mouth. Light mouthfeel with some alcohol to it, in total a bit thin.

Murky orange with yellow hues and a medium-sized white head. Aroma of bubblegum, banana candy, citrus and wheat. Taste leans more towards light malts and citrus, with the bubblegum kicking in in the aftertaste. A hint of cloves somewhere in there. Light, spritzy and refreshing.

50 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Golden, hazy appearance with medium to big, white, thick head. Aroma of banana, cloves yeast and noble hops. Smells really nice! Taste is very appropriate style wise but with somewhat heavier bitterness than usual. Very refreshing and balanced! Medium bodies with high carbonation. Really good hefe, very drinkable.

Bottle: Hazy yellow/Brown/Red colour, with a creamy head. Aroma is sweet malty,citric,some bananna, and flowery finish. Flavor had a nice smouth mouth feeling of fruits, sweet maltynes, some caramel and bananna, and citrus smouth finish. Medium body and a nice medium fruity/citrus finish. Werry nice!!

Bottle, TAP 4. Pours medium orange with a fairly big head. Unfortunately there was a large amount of unsightly gunk in there as well. After settling down, the beer comes off as a good, if unspectacular Weizen.

500ml bottle. Pours cloudy pale amber. Aroma brings cloves, banana, fruits, some hops and yeast. Flavor got bananas as well, some hops that makes this one little dry in the finish. But it is not to bitter at all. Also little citric, grassy, yeasty and cloves. Overall crispy, light and refreshing. Nice!

Cloudy orange with a big and creamy off-white head. Clean aroma of banana and cookie spices, with a hint of grassy hops. Sweet and fruity flavour with white bread notes. Slightly hoppy finish. Very clean and refreshing for a German wheat beer.
Cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana, yeasty and spicy - cloves. Flavor is rather sweet. Sweet and light acidic finish. Great hefeweizen. 110311

Aroma has hints of ginger and hops.  Appears golden but cleaner than many Weiss beers.  Big head so be careful.  Feels light and clean.  Pretty highly carbonated.  Tastes of ginger, hops, and just a hint of lemon zest but not overly like most wheat beers.  Overall, this is the finest and drinkable weisses Ive ever had.

Bottle 500ml. Great beer. Aroma is malty, with caramel, grain, and a touch of alcohol. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness, and long length. Palate is velvety, and medium bodied. Amber, with a frothy head.

Bottle served in a flare pilsner. Light orange with a slight haze. Large white head and minimal lacing. Complex aroma of banana, grass, clove, and spice. Light sweet flavor, lightly hopped. Medium body, soft carbonation, and a short, dry finish.
Stolen from Bierkrugs Keller he will kill me. On nice brew and one of the best WBs around. I liked it as much as the Aventinus.

Tasted on 2/23/11 from a 500mL bottle at Rootstock.  Pours cloudy orange with a very thick and rocky white head that slowly settles into rocky lace.  The nose is classic Hefeweizen with spicy clove, light banana, and somewhat nutty wheat.  The flavor is quite similar with spices up front, moving to banana, and finishing with hazelnut.  The body is medium and somewhat sticky with lively carbonation and a long banana and nut finish.
Quite a delicious, full-bodied hefeweissbier. It has notes of clove, lemon, and banana.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with a big creamy white head. Aroma of cloves and that lovely banana. Soft mouthfeel.Taste is rich and mellow, a lot of malts here, with some easy detectable cloves. Moderate hopped, very good hefeweissen.

500ml bottle fromthe lcbo
Pours a hazy golden yellow
Aroma is sweet bubble gum 
Nice
Citrus aroma, white foamy head, hazy yellow appearance, citrusy slightly sour taste, medium carbonation. medium finish. Nice refreshing beer.

Appearance: cloudy light orange with brushes of blanched straw. White head is soft, velveteen, and puffy to the touch. White clouds scatter across sides of my glass while a broken cloud blankets the brew below.

Nose: doughy and yeasty. Its alive!! Raw dough in the midst of kneading. White breads, Italian breads, Hawaiian breads. Nutmeg sprinkles and dust. Raw grains golden in the field. Flower petals rest gently in the back; sunflower. Grains of paradise, white pepper. Touch of greenness and the essence of life.

Palate: living beer is a thing of beauty. Light and bready, she practically dances across my tastebuds. Soft with an airy presence which magically exudes a flavorful personality. Yeasty and fresh doughy breads of artisan quality. Wheat. Spice tickles in the back along with yeast; nutmeg, white pepper, grains of paradise. Flower petals linger in the breath along with a green herbal essence, nondescript. Dough of breads minus the crust. Uber softness abounds. Spice slowly permeates rest of palate. Kiss of kiwi amidst a tropical sunrise.

Final Thoughts: I tasted this beauty from a cask at Broken Barrel Taverns 2nd Annual Oktoberfest Celebration and she was a living brew of beauty. Phenomenal. Amazing. If I could drink this every day, I would.

Presentation: (Part of a 5 pack gift set with glass.) It was poured from a brown 500ml bottle into the Aventinus glass that came with the beer. The label on the bottle has the abv (6.2%) and a list of ingredients on the front and a description/history of the beer on the back. It also has a USDA organic seal on the front.

Appearance: The body has a yellowish tan body which is cloudy. On top of the beer sits a tall creamy white head. It fades out quickly and leaves just a small ring of foam at the edge. Lacing is minimal and slick.

Smell: Its aroma is citrusy, bready, wheat like and very fruity like over an ripe banana.

Taste/Palate: It has a good medium body with some mild bready malt sweetness and wheat tang mixed with spicy almost nutty yeast. This is all in good balance with a very light touch of citrus and spicy hops. The palate is smooth with plenty of soft carbonation to keep it easy drinking.

Notes: It has nice delicate complexity and very good drinkability. I could drink quite a few of this and not get bored.

Gusher. Medium offwhite head. Hazy orange-brown body. Yoghurty milky wheaty aroma with fruity cloves notes. Dryish yoghurty dusty oily taste with wheaty grassy notes. Fizzy mouthfeel. Mid-to-full body. Dry fruity chalky earthy aftertaste with floral wheaty hoppy notes. Nice, highly drinkable, even a bit hopped, but could use more flavour. Still a great beer. Settles in the mouth as you drink. (0.5l bottle, Håndverkerstuene, Oslo.)

A wonderful bottle experience!  Lively, excitable weissbier head, with a translucent golden color until you do the swirl with an inch left in the bottle.  I added the suspension to the glass and watched the opacity grow, and the aromas open up.  Gentle nutmeg or allspice overtones, with a crisp attack and full wheaty sweetness that is immediately but gently followed by a gradual, clean finish.  There is just a hint of sweetness that remains.  A nice weiss!!

Zavaros, sárgás, narancssárgás megjelenésű, kissé piszkosfehér kemény és kitartó habbal. Illatában éretlen banán, citrusfélék és egy jó adag élesztő érződik. Íze is hasonló, megspékelve egy kis zöldséges, konyhai zöldfűszeres mellékízzel (ez valahogy a biosörök sajátossága). Eléggé testes, és fűszeres, száraz a lecsengése. Kissé talán túl száraz is, és az élesztő is nagyon domináns. Finom, de szerintem a sima Schneider egy jobban eltalált főzet.

Bottle: Cloudy golden color, medium, frothy head. Aroma is wheaty, light sweet, light fruity (oranges) and also hoppy. Flavor is also light malty and sweet, fruity (banana, oranges), spicy (cloves) and quite hoppy. Very tasty wheat.
Cloudy golden, lasting white head. Fruity, clove and sweet aroma. Taste is similar. Not a bad fruity, slightly spicey and yeasty Weizen.

50 cL bottle from the LCBO, served in a weizen glass. Pours hazy straw-golden with a tall white head. The head slowly fades and leaves behind minimal lace. The nose has aromas of yeast, banana, clove and pale malts. The flavour is quite complex; it is moderately honey sweet up front, but it soon dries out with wheat overtones. There is a touch of clove and spice, along with a nice leafy hop bitterness towards the end. It is very well balanced overall. The finish is long and lingering with hops and an almost lager-like quality. On the palate, it is medium in body with a smooth, creamy texture and champagne-like carbonation. Overall, I was very pleasantly surprised by this one. It is harmoniously assembled, quite full and smooth in body yet still refreshing. A very nice beer for late summer. 2010-12-10

Sörspecialista, Budapest
Olyan színe van, mint egy 100%-os rostos narancslének, a tetején dolgozó hab pedig -micsoda meglepetés- fehér, kemény, krémes, igen terjedelmes és roppant kitartó. Illata déligyümölcsös, mézes, édeskés és virágos, napokig tudnám szagolgatni. Az ízében a fűszerek dominálnak, fehér bors, koriander,  a gyümölcsök mellett és én tisztán érzek benne bodzavirágot és zöld teát is. Jönnek a mézes aromák is és nagyon finom komlósságot is érezni benne az élesztő mellett. Egészen sűrű és kellemesen szénsavas. Utóíze komló gyantás, kissé fanyar és hosszan tart a kissé magasabb alkoholtartalom végig rejtve marad benne. Nagyon finom és különleges. Igazi téli búza.

Bottle (as Tap 4). Only slightly hazy gold with a fluffy white head. High bead. Aroma of cloves, hay, honeydew melon. Quite clean-tasting with only a little yeasty wheatiness. More cloves and white pepper than fruit. Fairly tasty and refreshing but quite plain and lacks all that much of the refreshing sour tang you can find in hefes. Nice spicy finish with some citrus zest.

Half liter bottle from Teeter Barracks Cville. Pours a faintly hazy pale orange color with a large fizzy head. Fair head retention and lacing. Aroma of bread, smoky notes, tea, caramel, beef jerky and a spicy finish. Weird. Ok. the taste is bread, yeast, spice, caramel, spicy finish. Medium bodied. This one is fairly strange, but pretty decent.
Bottle from Peckhams. Caramel & banana aroma. Hazy golden brown with a big foamy head. Flavour of banana, corn & marzipan. Well balanced. Good wheat beer.

50 cl bottle at Wachi. Nicely hoppy nose, wheat, spice, light banana. Flavor also quite hoppy, with a nice bitter finish. Rich, smooth, thick body. Not overwhelmingly estery, but nice spice and fruit. Really nice stuff.

0,5 l bottle, bought at the brewery.
Cloudy golden-straw beer with a fantastic fomay and stable white foam. Tons of overriped tropical fruits in the aroma, sweetish caramel, nice herbal hop.. Medium body with a lively carbonation that brings a fine fruity yeast and malt, honey and banana, mangosteen, moderated herbal hop in the finish. Wow, that was delicious!

Pours hazy light amber with medium quick dissipating head.  Aroma i wheat, banana, clove and spices.  Taste is sweet with the spiceyness coming through.  Somewhat bitter on the finish.  Smooth and dry.
bottle.  Poured slightly hazy gold with a thin fizzy head. Yeasty-clove aroma. Light dry body. Wheat, banana flavours, peppery. Lingering stale yeasty finish. MEH!

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2010 Bière blonde Hefe-Weizen de 6.2% dalcool, saveur typique des bières blanches allemande de Munich, ressemble un peu à la Hacker-Pschorr, mais légèrement moin lourde, bien houblonnée, belle couleur tyrant vers lorangé, bien mousseuse et pétillante, brassé en mémoire de Georg Schneider.
One of the best wheat beers I have had.  Strong yeast flavors, great amber color
Best wheat beer ive tasted, very nice taste. Give this a try, very tasty beer, typical cloudy beer and nice yeast flavour.
Same bottle as pictured. Poured big head as most wheat beers do. Very sweet. One of the best wheat beers Ive tried although Im not the biggest fan of the style.

Pours a hazy amber with a tall, creamy, eggshell head that has excellent retention. Aroma is banana, toasted marshmallows, wheat, a touch of cereal and lemon poppy seed bread with vanilla glaze. Flavor is toasty grain, wheat, not so sweet bananas, lemon poppy seed bread and light vegetal notes. Palate is medium bodied, creamy on entry, lightly chalky to the finish and has a light, fine carbonation. Good stuff, not great.
Bottle. Cloudy golden colour. Flavour of banana, apple and wheat. Flavour of banana, wheat, lemon and fresh herb. Medium-full body, lively carbonisation. Medium finish, pretty good beer.
Bananas. Bananas, not banana bread. Delicate aroma. Malty and citrusy. HIghly carbonated, but goes down smooth. Fine hefeweizen.

500mL bottle from Liquor Loft.  Gold pour with a medium sized off-white head.  Aroma of apple, banana, spice, wheat and yeast.  Taste is light and crisp with more of the citrus and spice.  Finishes up a grassy bitter.  Good.

Mah secondo me lalias è sbagliato, comunque; schneider weisse tap 4, in bottiglia al Pub del Duca. Ciò che la diversifica è lutilizzo di ingredienti biologici; per quanto riguarda schiuma e colore è una tipica weizen (quindi un pò più chiara rispetto alla classica Schneider), laroma e il gusto sono leggermente diversi, non cè banana ma fortissimi sentori di prugna.
A me è piaciuta molto, ottima come tutte le Schneider
Tap @ Café Morshuis Albergen. Blonde, cloudy. Aroma and flavor of  herbal fresh cheese and lemon. Fresh, greene and a bit sharp.

Pours lovely hazy amber colour with a minimal head. Strong notes of cereal and biscuit. Sweet taste with a medium body. Undeniably german hops coming through all over the place. Medium body and slightly creamy texture with lively carbonation. Slightly bitter finish that lasted awhile. A really lovely beer. :)

Hazy amber, good head.  Bubblegum aroma!  Taste is more than very spicy.  Spices and yeast flavor flow into the finish.  This is a great wheat beer.  Give this one a try despite despite the RateBeer average.

Bottle. Color is cloudy orange with a hughe creamy and frothy head, that leaves some very nice lacing. Aroma is of wheat, banana, clove, citrus,  yeast and a faint hop presence. Flavor is of banana and clove along with other spices like pepper and cinnamon. I get some citrus and some wheat and some fruity esters from the yeast. It is also slightly bready and doughy. Body is medium to full with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a very good hefe!!
Bottle. Yellow and sweet. Wheat is present but does not overpower all the other flavours. Full mouth feel with a gentle lingering sweetness. One of the best wheat beers I have tried.

Bottle: Cloudy golden pour, with a marginal head , fermented in bottle, and it shows. USDA Organic sticker, very interesting to see that. I have to say I thought this brew was/is incredible - It has the typical hefeweizen charadcteristics, (Clove/Spice/Citrus/Banana) , but the full bodied flavor really shines through, and I couldnt help but think of apple cider here. Wow. Ill be back for more of this.

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Paas, The Hague as Schneider Mein Grunes. Hazy orange pour, thin creamy white head. Delicate aroma of spices, some clove, wheat and pepper. Flavor is spicy, slightly sweet, tiny bit sour and very refreshing. Creamy texture and average carbonation. Nice.
Draft at Pizzeria Paradiso.  Cloudy variegated yellow and brown.  Aroma of clove.  Clove dominates the taste as well, with lots of hops. Great body and complexity.  Very interesting.
Good stuff and nice to see organic.  Much tarter than I was expecting. Serving: Bottle

average frothy white head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. cloudy thick amber body. aroma: banana, heavy yeasty, clove, honey. if: light sweet acidic and bitter. ff: light sweet and moderate bitter; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation and metallic finish. esperava grandes mudanças em uma cerveja sem glúten, mas não as percebi, talvez um ligeiro gosto herbal que não havia nas outras; 

Nota: 35 skol
Bottle at Olympen. Hazy golden with a small head. fruity hop nose, banana in the background. Lots of banana and clove flavours. Well-carbonated. Interesting variantion of a classic.
On tap at Red-light Red-light.  Golden color with a big white head.  The aroma was clove and spices.  The taste was refreshing with big clove, banana, nutmeg, spice and yeast flavors..
On tap at Wildeman as Mein Grunes. Nice yellow body with tall head. Nose of bananas and citrus. Nice floral taste with fruits and spices.  Well done.

Second Schneider beer tasted tonight, and purchased at the LCBO. Pours a light hazy golden colour with a big white creamy head that stays a long time and gives some soapy lacing. Mild banana nose with some good yeast and notes of bubblegum. Watery crisp mouthfeel and medium-light bodied. The taste is pretty mild, with some wheat grain and light citrus. Organic is written on front label, but seems quite tame for such a brew. Overall, pretty refreshing and a nice mild brew for summer.
Draught at Bishops Arms, Avenyn, Göteborg. Hazy golden color, offwhite head. Banana aroma, ester, yeasty notes and bubblegum. Bubblegum flavor, banana, spicy and fruity.

Bottle at The Shack (Sacramento). Pours dark golden with a rich white head and a floral aroma. There is a yeasty wheat flavor, more sweet than sour, with some carbonation. Very refreshing with more flavor than many wheat beers.
Pours hazy amber with white head and some lacing.  Notes of wheat and citrus dominates.  Taste is a bit on the sour side, though nicely balanced with some hoppy bitterness.  Fizzy on the palate.

bought from LCBO in 500ml bottle, intrigued by the organic labeling whether that does anything beyond me.  Anyway as hefeweisen go pours dark cloudy straw color, nice foamy head .It had a rich, banana-clove nose but with hints of licorice and a deep, rich mouthfeel, smooth and satisfying, with hints of toffee and a light grassy note. Very carbonated, overall excellent.

Bottled version Labelled "Organic". Pours out a hazy light orange color with foamy off-white head. Sediment was resuspended and topped off into glass. Aroma is classic banana bread. Flavor is quite smooth banana and clove. This is a top-notch hefe!
UPDATED: SEP 1, 2010 Strong banana aroma. Cloudy golden with black specks and small white head that thins quickly. Sweet (but not too sweet) carbonated lemony peppery banana taste.

Le liquide a une robe foncée, de couleur dorée et complètement troublée par les sédiments.   Un petit col de mousse sinstalle et de fines dentelles sont observées.  Le nez est plaisant et invitant.  En plus du profil citronné assez important, on y retrouve des effluves de banane et de blé avec un bel étalement dépices comme le clou de girofle,  la muscade et la vanille.  Au goût, pas aussi défini que les arômes mais quand même assez intéressant pour vouloir y replonger ses lèvres : un bon goût de blé avec une présence épicée et fruitée.  En bouche, le liquide est léger, peut-être légèrement trop aqueux, mais très rafraichissant.  En finale, des notes amères du houblon Cascade sont laissées avec grande délicatesse derrière la langue.

Aroma:Very sweet, floral aromas, cinnamon, cardamon. This beer smells similar to a spice cabinet.

Appearance:Hazy orange, low head, low lacing.

Taste:The first sip is floral with a nice sweetness, and a little tangyness too. The aftertaste really lets the wheat in this beer shine through with its nuttiness. The clove and cardamon notes are in the midtaste in this beer. After a few ships, the foretaste of this beer shows added complexity with a little tartness that makes it more refreshing.

Palate:Nicely carbonated, with a light to medium thickness mouthfeel.

Overall:A very refreshing beer on a hot day, nice a sweet, that pairs fantastically with German food. This beer is a great example of its style.

Another surprise pickup from the LCBO. Nose is citrus and slightly yeasty. Very refreshing and clean tasting. High carbonation gives this very nice mouthfeel. Not too sweet or sour like many slightly stronger examples of Weizen.
Fine example of the style.  Simple clean aroma, citrus and some clove.  Well balanced on the tongue with a rich yeasty mouthfeel.

500 ml bottle, as Schneider Weisse Tap 4 Mein Grünes, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Brewed with organic ingredients. ABV is 6.2%. Hazy brownish golden colour, big head, slightly off-white. Strong and lovely aroma of ripe bananas and cloves. Soft mouthfeel. The flavour is reasonably malty for a hefeweizen, with distinct notes of cloves. Very moderate hops. The alcohol is well hidden. Good beer.
500mL bottle at Public House in SF.  One of my favorite Hefes.  Attractive golden color with a light head.  Sweet aroma with a full -bodied, sweet taste.
Another great beer from Schneider. Big bodied wheat beer, so very smooth with lots of wheat, spice and peel. There was even wheat strips in this beer! A nice pick up..
Similar to their other Weisse beers but a little mellower. So flavorful. I will buy anything these guys make.
50 cl bottle, Mulmur, ON, Canada via Lakeville. (thanks again Jim). Apricot colour, warming burnt citrus aroma. Smooth, velety texture. Neat finish.

500 ml bottle, 6.2% a/v. Purchased at Queens Quay LCBO in Toronto. 

Pours a murky amber with a bit of a coppery red tone, the head is white and rocky, good looking beer (if you know what wheat beers are supposed to look like anyways). The aroma is very spicy, clove and orange are very prevelant here with a bit of cinammon and even a slight dark rum aroma. The taste is.. MMMM. Its great, perfectly balanced with a slight tang, grapefruit, bananas, cloves, and almost a marshmellowy sweetness. The mouthfeel is also very good, goes down very smooth, though a bit too carbonated for my taste, not a major drawback though.

Great  beer, Im gonna have to go back and get more!!

500ml bottle poured into my Schneider Weisse glass...

Medium-amber cloudy body to it. The head didnt come out very rich, but its retention was good. Some lacing and small bubbles rising.

Smells very nice and quite intense! The aromas got everything that ones looking for in a hefeweizen: bananas, a clovey spiciness, some cinnamon, some oranges, and, of course, wheat!

Mm, this is a very tasty hefeweizen! Its got a very pronouced flavour, with plenty of wheaty breadiness, banana-like sweetness, and a touch of spice. The finish is bready, with some lingering clove notes and honey-like sweetness. A good, proper hefeweizen that tastes very natural!

Definitely a good body to it, probably closer to medium. A little crisp and very smooth. Mildly carbonated. A slight hint of alcohol appears after ahile, but it shouldnt bother you much.

Very refreshing and drinkable. Not your perfect session hefe-weissbier, provided its 6.2% abv, but you could down two of these in a row without much hassle.

Had this as Tap 4 Mein Grünes - terrible name and a terrible idea from the brewery to number there beers. But the beer itself is very good. Dark orange in the glass, nice head. Starts fruity-yeasty, modest sourish and a bit salty. Finish intense fruity, lemon-notes, also fine hoppy notes. Wonderful. Thats how a good hefeweizen has to taste!

Bottle from Norms.  Pours an orange-brown with a slight haze.  Thin white head.  Very fragrant aroma with flowers, clove, and banana.  Flavor has typical clove and herbal hefeweizen flavor but with lots of cereal.  Slight sweetness, but mostly dry.  Grassy hop finish.  Very crisp and easy to drink.  Excellent hefeweizen.

500mL bottle.  Pours a cloudy orange amber with a big white head.  Aroma has lots of cereal, as well as some wheat, yeast and a touch of citrus.  Taste has wheat, some orange flavor, yeast, cereal, and a touch of lemon and orange peel.  Carbonation is just right, gives a good mouthfeel.  Slightly bitter finish with lots of wheat and cereal.
Pours cloudy orange with  a small white heat. Aroma is clove and grain/wheat. Taste is big wheat with banana and  clove, extremely balanced and smooth.

Lovely beer. I thought it was supposed to be basically a filtered version of their Schneider-Weisse. I assume it is not, considering the organic tags. Flavour is very similar, lots of wheat and fresh grass with some citrus carrying over from the aroma. Not as banana-y as expected. The most interesting part is how the cascade hops affect the beer. And, Its a great combination. Very crisp, tasty, and the alcohol is barely noticeable. A great addition for the summer lineup.

In bottle from LCBO; nice aroma of spice and banana, minimal head when poured. The taste was great through the first half, though seemed to change. Started spicy and banana-ish, and turned almost woodsy later on. Overall, compared to other organics I have tried, very good beer.

Organic!  500ml bottle from the LCBO (Dundas/Mavis) 

Wonderful cloudy orangish color.  Minimal head that entirely disappears quickly.

Smells of banana, zest, and some sharp spice.

Tastes of citrus, wheat, spice and maybe some banana.  Another reviewers assessment of bubblegum may be right as well.

A very refreshing beer and it proves organic doesnt need to be tasteless.  Will definitely buy again!

In a word - organic!!!!  For this style, I didnt hate it, but I did not like it either.  It did take me the longest to finish.  It is not Thunder;s style, so he doesnt have much to say. I guess Vlad says it best - "were not a group who likes our wheaties".

~3 of 13
Nice golden pour in the glass. Nose and taste of tingy fruits and wheats. Rated 12/30/99

Hazy orangish pour with a ton of head.  The head faded quick rininging the glass.  Citrus is the strongest aspect of the scent.  Smells like a Wit, which is good since its basically a wit.  Unique in the mouth.  Something in there odd.  Something earthy.  Very different and hard to place.  Cant actually decide if its a good or bad thing due to it being so new.  Right now I like it, after 2 or 3 I could see changing my mind.  Actually at this point going to stop rating and finish the bottle and come back to this....okay for one I didnt realize the beer was that strong.  No taste of alcohol in it.  The more I drink it the more I like it, which could be attributed to that %age.  I definitely did not get sick of the taste.  Im now wishing I had more then one bottle.

500ml Bottle: Pours amber orange and hazy, nice marshmallow white head on top. Aroma offers lots of the regular suspects: Banana, clove, orange, lemon, and rye bread. Extremely refreshing but carbonated, sharp and peppery mouthfeel. Flavour is yeasty, citrus, black pepper, clove, grass, bubblegum(?!). As it warms it seems the carbonation increases, making it a bit harsh to drink, but altogether a nice beer, especially on this our first officially hot weekend of the year!

500ml bottle 
6.2% ABV 
I tried this beer on April 27, 2010 after purchasing from one of my local LCBO outlets.  The beer poured a very hazy golden colour with orangy highlights and a generous white head.  The aroma is wheat malt, citrus, and banana.  The mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour is wheat and citrus.
Pours a lacing, white head with a murky, golden-amber body.  Aromas and flavors of malt, yeast, clove, and zest.  Finish is full-bodied, zest, and yeast.

16.9 oz. bottle. Sweet, zesty, sharp aroma features bubblegum, lemon, and crabapple scents. Pours a cloudy, medium gold. Effervescent. Large amount of off-white, fluffy head. Dry taste. Red apple, red grape, lemon, and cream flavors. Definitely tastes like a wheat beer. Light, dry aftertaste. Light to medium body. Watery. Unremarkable.
500ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours hazy amber in colour, with a massive white frothy head.  Huge aroma and taste of wheat, yeast, and a great balance of german malt and hops.  Awesome Hefe!

Well played Mr. Schneider!
Hands down, best organic beer I have had to date!
Pours a hazy golden colour with a big frothy head that dissolves to leave behind a soapy off white cap. 
Aroma is typical hefe, floral, banana, yeast, cloves, but with a little extra kick, a touch of mustiness, berries, and maybe something hoppyish??
Pretty cool stuff! The flavor is again typical hefe, bread, banana, clove, but then again with a little kick, some fruitiness, like berries or something, and then a citrusy note that lingers and becomes a lightly bitter finish. A very well crafted beer.  Glad I have more than one!

Has a nice, typical Wiesen nose. Banana and some cloves. A nice golden haze with no real head to speak of.

I found the flavour to be nicely balanced with a very light sweetness that dissipates rapidly leaving a refreshing aftertaste.  Surely one of the best Wiesen beers Ive had, and since its "organic", I can feel good about drinking another.

500 ml bottle from the LCBO. gusher. pours hazed gloden with an average white head. typical hefe aroma. in the flavour i could pick up the cascade and they are well integrated. really nice hefe. worth grabbing a few of if you see it.

The pour reveals a hazy yellow color with a medium white head. Solid aroma of lemon, bananas, cloves, wheat and bubble-gum. Very good flavor of lemon, bananas, wheat, bubble-gum and cloves. The body is light to medium with an oily texture and moderate carbonation. This is a solid hefe-weizen, very refreshing and quite the tasting experience.

500 ml. bottle.  Pours a murky amber orange with white head, fizzy and bubbly.  Aroma of banana, apricot, guava, cereal, wheat, bubblegum, passion fruit / berry, bread.  This might be the most amazing hefeweizen ive ever smelled.  Taste is rich and complex, yet refreshing and has smooth mouth feel.  Onset is rich white bread wheat like flavors which is quite fruity, and has a nice bite to it, with actually some more citrus like notes on the finish, lemon / tangerine and spices, with a note of yeast.  Excellent and probably my favorite hefeweizen to date.

I am a big fan of this style, and this one is truly a classic. Everything is a bit more noticable in this beer, from the banana notes to the light malts that carry this through to the end. This is very balanced, somewhat muted in a good way, that allows the flavors to come through. Overall, one of my favorites.

Bottle: very fresh sample, 15 days old.

Pours a clouded tawney-orange ale in the Weiss glass. Puffy 3 finger white cap lasts well. Aromas are pungent: clove, banana, exotic fruit, fresh bread, some citrus...glorious hefe aromas. Sharp peppery mouth feel. Flavor profile is a decadent balance between big bready-biscuit malts and succulent fruity esters and spicy yeast phenols, Finish goes dry. a tad tart with a lemon kiss at the end from the hops.

Fresh, flavorful, bracing, quenching, satisfying....this one has pretty much all I look for in a patio beer.

World class Hefeweizen, this could put me off my Weihenstephaner.

500ml bottle from LCBO. Golden pear color, murky. Head was pretty but shortlived. Cinnamon applesauce aroma, pear. spicy and easy palette, not especially sweet. Good finish. Quenching, well crafted product. Wouldve liked to compare this side by side with Dennisons.

500ml bottle with hard sediment (thanks for sitting on this half a year LCBO)  - pours surprisingly dark gold and cloudy with puffy white cap. Smells of fruit and cloves. Taste is sweet cloves with good fruit sweetness (banana, pear) and nice countering balance of dry grassy & minty hops. Has some real peppery spice to it, this and the rakish hop aftertaste sets this one apart from boring Weissbier.

500mL bottle from the LCBO. I was surprised to see it in the Kitcherloo since I thought itd be the one from the spring release that wouldnt ever show up (as theres always one). Pours a slightly deep gold, nice hazy and medium white head. Aroma has some nice perfumy quality to it, mostly yeasty and estery but perhaps a hint of hops. Flavour starts out with some sweet malt and banana esters, followed by dry yeast and a peppery biting aspect in the finish which is a little strong. Mild citrusy character to the aftertaste. Pretty enjoyable, though not particularly distinct from other good Hefeweizens. Cool label from a really solid brewery, and Im glad I could finally try it, though it would serve us better as a part of the summer release (although, maybe that explains the pathetically late arrival? Gee, thanks LCBO *rolls eyes*).

Just an epic Hefe.  Pours straw yellow with a big frothy white head.  Aroma is floral and citrus.  Taste is a great combination of flowery citrus, yeast with a mild hop bitterness.  Great beer for a good hot day.
Pours golden orange with a lacy, small head. Aroma-banana, yeast, hint of caramel. Taste-clove, lemony, bready, wheat. Nice smooth, finish. Slight caramel sweetness in the end too.

On tap at the Wharf, Aalborg. Poured cloudy golden with tight white head. Bubblegum & banana nose with faint cloves. Thick oily mouthfeel with initial clove & bubblegum hit fading to long-lasting banana bubblegum with delicious tartness. Spot on!

Bottle. Poured a clear golden yellow with a good amount of head. Fairly standard as German Hefs go, but this one has more banana-like esters, and theres definitely some chamomile notes in there as well. A really great wheat beer. Nice, clean, refreshing, crisp, an easy drinker. Recommended.

500mL Bottle. [09.072 - March 13, 2009]Spicy, extra-estery aroma of banana bread and hot rum. Pours a murky golden-orange with a soapy off-white head. Flavors are strong and zesty, with some very forward dryness and a growing alcohol. The yeast profile seems pushed back in the flavor of this beer, but the mouthfeel and texture are wonderful. Very well balanced. Its got kind of a hot, angry edge to it that the original doesnt. Decent, and maybe at this age, not fresh enough. But, Ill take the original.
Bottle at NB-Symposium. Cloudy yellow - white head. Banana, fruity, wheaty, flowery, light hoppy, grassy, orange, citrus, yeasty, light sourish, light lactic, low carbonation.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Twist, Stockholm. Hazy deep orangeish brown colour, mediumsized creamy beige head. Aroma is wheat, some caramel as well as mil yeasty and herbal notes. Flavour is wheat, fruits, yeast and some mild notes of caramel.

Pours hazy light orange with a dissapearing white head.  Aroma is fresh, floral and with notes of citrus and banana but not overly pungent.   Very lush mouthfeel.  Flavor is light but extremely pleasant consisting of yeast, clove banana and orange peel.  delightfully tart finish.  A very refreshing "down the line" German Hefeweisen.

Bottle.  Hazy orange brown with an off-white foam.  Aromas are weetabix and toffee with bready yeast and some fudge.  Flavours are sweet malts with light spices and some herbal aspects.  Yeasty and dry on the finish.  Good.
0.5l - Orange liquid with fleeting white head.  yeasty apple nose.  Spice on tongue, with a Belgian Ale style grab of the yeast next.  Pronounced lemon finish.
500ml Bottle - Amber/gold in colour. Banana and spices in the fairly floral aroma. Bananas, peach, spice and hops feature in the taste. Fairly enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2016 Bottle, rerate. Pours hazy dark gold with a mixed-grained, high, off-white head. Nose is lovely; banana, papaya, clove, geranium, nutmeg. It has a darker or heavier flavor than some hefes; I tasted blueberry, banana, clove, nutmeg, cinnamon, papaya, and Kings Hawaiian bread. (No, Im not joking.) Long, sweet, fruity finish. A very good hefe, and one of the more heavyweight of the breed.

Certified organic so I thought Id give it a go even though I love there other beers like Aventinus and Hopfen so much better. This one is a solid hefe but it seems a bit more devoted towards the cloves and has a peppery background. I do like this quality in the Schneider beers but the others seem more complex as far as flavors go.

Bottle.  Pours a deep amber with a slight haze and a medium/small head.  Aromas are sweet, with fruit and a little grain dust.  Flavor is alright, but there are a couple of things I dont care for... palate is sweet with fruity notes up front and in the finish, but gets washed out in the middle.  Alcohol is way too detectable for a beer that is supposedly 6.2%.  I was a little surprised that this wasnt much more interesting or complex.  There is a pretty good clove and fruit presence, but thats about it as far as interest is concerned.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Pours a hazy yellow with a large white head. Aroma is what you would expect from a hefeweizen, with lots of banana, cloves and a bready malts. The taste follows the flavor, heavy on the wheat malt with cloves and banana in there as well. This is heavier on the wheat than a lot of hefeweizens, but it is still very good. A nice take on the style. Very drinkable.
Great beer.  The taste was fruity and it  color was a cloudy orange.  The beer was brewed organic and unfiltered.
Pours slightly hazy golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma is tart yeast, wheat, apricot, peach. Taste is toffee sweet and very thick for a wheat beer, like eating big loaf of bread.

courtesy of Tony @ OTH.
pours hazy golden, white head.
aroma has hints of vanilla, grainy, wheat, tropical fruit; mango.
flavor,wheat, mild bitterness, grassy hops, tropical fruits; mango/orange., smooth palate with a low carbonation and a lingering yeasty palate.

(bottle) pours a murky golden-amber colour with a pillowy white head. aroma of tropical fruit, most noteably pineapple, mango and passion fruit, some citrus and a little hint of wheat. flavour is mostly wheat, with flowery hops, notes of citrus and yeast. medium body with lively carbonation and a comparatively dry finish. lovely!

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2011 Hazy gold, ^eff, thick-wh-head, chunky-lace.

aroma:  grainy-wheat hops fruity-esters crisp.

flavor:  tart banana clove grainy wheat T1, gentle-floral-hops T2, §filmy §sour wheat T3, Wheat-sour Tf.
Unlike many other examples, the grain and hops are not overpowered by yeast esters.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden straw colour. Huge white head the hangs around for a while leaving plenty of lacing. Plenty of the usual Hefeweizen aromas including yeast. bread, bananas and cloves though perhaps a little more assertive than usual. Flavours are once again more assertive with plenty of wheat malt and yeast. Slightly tart finish. Easy drinking and certainly a really good Hefeweizen.

500-ml bottle Marcellos, Lafayette, La - Aroma: spicy, clove, bubblegum, banana (yeast), caramel (malt); Appearance: hazy reddish-orange color,  frothy off-white head, no laces; Flavor: caramel (malt), spicy, light raisin, nutty, banana (yeast); Mouthfeel: light bodied, thin texture, fizzy moderate carbonation, long dry; Overall: nice spicy, clove fruity aromatics well balance with a refreshing and long quenching finish.

Draught @ Charlies Bar, Pilestræde 33, Copenhagen, Denmark.Hazy medium orange color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, orange, moderate to light light heavy yeasty, spicy, cloves, fennel. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long to average duration, spicy - cloves, fennel. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft. [20091130]
500 ML Bottle in the USA. Another excellent beer from Schneider. Although not as great as the others I have had. Cloudy with a nice head. Nice banana aroma and taste. A great Hefe but not the best.
Hazy gold pour.  Big white head.  Aroma has lots of banana, yeast, some very light hops and spices.  Flavor is yeasty and has some good banana, malt and gum notes.

50cl bottle from the SAQ. Pours a nice hazy gold with frothy head which subsided quickly. The aroma was very nice with a resin hop scent. The taste was a medium bitter, just the way I like it. Over all this is the third beer from this brewer and they have never failed to disappoint. We need more wiesen beer in Quebec.

Just like all the other Schneider brews, this one doesnt dissapoint, although i have to say that there is something off a little with this, its too bitter or something, still wonderful, still delicious, but compared to the other brews by schneider, this is my least favorite.

Draft at redlight redlight.  Pours a cloudy yellow orange with a generous creamy head.  The aroma is bright and floral with an up beat yeasty background.  The flavor has strong notes of citrus.  The mouthfeel is crisp, bubbly and very refreshing.  One of the best wheat beers on the market.

Draft at Flying Saucer .Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Lots of wheat malt and banana in the noise. Nice unfiltered mouthfeel. The flavor has a strong pale wheat malt presence, but also has the typical banana phenols and a nice amount of residual sweetness. What makes this one a little unique is a hibiscus, culinary herb accent. Yeasty finish. Good stuff

Bottle. Pours hazy golden orange with a thin white head. Aroma is slightly sweet with notes of bubblegum, banana, grain and a bit of spice. Flavour is pretty similar, has additional hints of caramel and elderflower. Somewhat slick mouthfeel, although a little on the thin side, and a lingering finish. Overall a very good hefeweizen, quite refreshing and enjoyable, although I couldnt consume large quantities of it.

Tap @ Charlies Bar, Cph.
Pours hazy dark yellow-glden with a small, staying, creamy, white head. Aroma is sweet, lovely banana, zesty apples and sweet wheat malts. High carbonation, great dry mouthfeel. Lovely flavour, lots of coriander, some banana, apples, wheat. Grassy and flowery hops finish. Lightly warming. A truly brilliant weisse!

A hazy golden weizen with a thick creamy white head. In aroma, plasant bananas and cloves, light vanilla notes. In mouth, a nice weizen with good spices, bananas, cloves, tingling mouthfeel. A bit light but very pleasant, spot on. 500 mL bottle from SAQ, tasted Oct. 31 2009.

Bottle, 500ml. Pours very appealing tangerine with minimal slightly off-white head. Quite punchy banana/spices/wheat aroma on the nose, and similar on the palate, though with more of a sweet cereal presence. Very pleasant weissbier.

Draught. Comes as "George Schneider Organic Weisen Edel Weisse". Hazy deep golden orange  colour with a huge well lasting white head. Pleasant aroma of wheat and fruit (banana). Good mouthfeel indeed. The flavour is fresh with wheat, banana, yeast and a pleasant soft spiciness. Tasty Hefeweiss indeed.

Bottle [500ml]. Pours a nice looking, slightly bubbly, hazy yellow-gold with an average size somewhat-lasting foamy white head. Aroma of spices and banana upfront along with wheat, yeast and citrus fruit. Flavour of wheat and spices (mostly pepper and cloves) along with some fruit, light sugary sweetness and floral notes. 
Medium bodied. Pretty good stuff.

Pours hazy golden colour with above average rocky white head that retains well.  Nose has a very assertive banana/clove with fresh yeasty/bready aromas.  On the palate the wheaty malt flavors are more pronounced than most weissbiers, with more alcohol warmth on the finish.  More assertive but not as drinkable as the regular Schneider Weisse.
