On tap at The Rake.  Estery aroma, smells like a banana wheat beer.  Cloudy orange colour.  Thin white head.  I thought this was pretty good.  Would I drink this over the regular beer?  Maybe not.  But I did find it very drinkable until I found out how expensive it was at The Rake.

A Mes rate. Keg at The Rake.Its just a ramped up Schneider Weiss. Ok, the sourness is a little more pronounced, and the bubblegum is not quite so much to the fore but overall, I dont really see the point of this one. If I wanted more alcohol in my Schneider Weiss, Id probably drink something else. Whatever, its a nice beer, I just dont really see the point.

Bottle - Pours hazy amber that looks like apple cider. Has a cream-colored head and tons of yeasty floaties. Smells of spicy clove and light citrus. Theres a little skunk and lots of yeasty/wheaty notes.Taste is nice and wheaty with a bit of apples and spice--cinammon, nutmeg, and cloves. Smooth and effervescent in the mouth--a pleasant beer, but could do without the floaties.

Tap in the rake. Alround rating: Thin wheat character, the usual clove and banana esters, hop is hidden, manages to be massivly thin for the %. However it does seem to be lacking condition somewhat which si a good thing as far as im concerned.
Hazy amber with a nice white head... Clove, banana, bready aroma, spicy...  Spicy palate, tingly, huge clove flavor with notes of banana, a touch hoppy... Odd palate, very flavorful..

500ml bottle. Rich deep golden amber with a tghick full white head. Aromas of banana, vanilla and cloves with bubblegum mixed in. Light and refreshing with a hit of alcohol in the mouth. Full bodied and full flavoured.
malty fruity and spicy on the nose. cloudy dark yellow pour with a white head that is weak. Wheat flavor along with a little citrus. Great mouth feel and very nice on the palate.

From a bottle at an Oktoberfest celebration. Good looking with a weak color, thin head. Witbeer aroma of fruits, spices, and molasses. Some sort of light flavor I cant identify (perhaps its edelweisse, whatever that is) but Id go out of my way for it.

Golden orange with a white head that dissipates quickly. Heavily floral aroma, with some cinnamon and clove. Flavor is predominately cinnamon and clove, with a bit of orange and fresh hops. Quite good.

Served from a wooden cask at the Bavarian Lodge, 10/01/2009.  
Pours a deep murky golden with a creamy white head.  Leaves some swathes of lacing.  Aroma is full cloven, a bit apicy, nice.  Full creamy mouthfeel with a slightly tart citrusy flavor that is somewhat sweet, hints of sugar but also a touch spicy.  Compex and good, this may be the best Hefe Ive ever had.  The wood really addes something with that subtle cinamonny spice.
Mostly clear amber with a frothy off white head. Soapy tart wheat, mild smoke aromas. Rich, smooth mouthfeel. Nice estery banana and clove flavors with mild tart wheat nd bready malts.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: On tap at Bishops Arms, Karlstad. Pours a pale hazy golden orange color with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and spicy with citrus,  banana and light touches of grass. Flavour is very fruity, lightly acidic with lots of spices, banana, citrus and light grassy hops. Body is medium with quite much carbonation. Very refreshing and dangerously drinkable - a quite powerful hefeweizen from one of Germanys finest brewers!

(Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, 27 Sep 2009) Cloudy, pale amber colour with frothy, off-white head. Fruity, citric nose with notes of citrus, apricots, banana and spices. Fruity, spicy taste with orange, dried apricots, banana and a touch of clove. More than medium body, balanced sweetness. Refreshing and tasty beer with a hint of alcohol in the finish. Nice.

Draft.  good god.  Pours a hazy golden body with a white head.  Wow bubble gum bazooka bubble gum at that and even that marshmallow-esk filminess that encompasses the wrappers. Loads of fruity pear esters marshmallow and wheat like notes.  Nice.
Bottle from Gingerman Fort Worth.  Thick, with a smell of light bananas, tastes a little spicy with some sour notes.

Bottle - Poured hazy golden with a spritzy head which didnt last long.  Lots of tracer bubble in the glass.  Main aroma is cloves with bananas.  Mild flavours spciy upfront then fruit (apples and bananas).  Smooth dry finish with a hint of cloves.

(Draught at Charlies Bar, Copenhagen, on 2009-09-16) Orange and cloudy. Medium sized, dense and white head that lasts for a moment. Fruitiness and citricness in aroma. Medium bodied and lightly dry palate with medium carbonation. Fruitiness, lightly banana, citricness, grass and light bitterness in taste. Lightly bitter and sweet aftertaste.

500ml bottle, hazy yellow honey hue, with a white head, yeasty bananaish, earthy wheaty, pale malt, with a hint of smokiness in the nose, with some honeyed stewed apple, spicy nutmeg, clove, vanilla accents, and a light lemon peel citrusy note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty,fruity banana character, with a mellow, wheaty, pale malt accent, and some honeyed ripe apple, spicy, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla, clove notes, leading towards a milky, acidic, wheaten, spicy finish.

Bottle from SAQ- A deeply hazed yet bright yellow pour with a frothy and generous cap. Inviting nose of spicy banana, clove, a bit of alcohol, yeasty phenols, some perfume. Sweet banana flavour is upfront, with spicy floral and yeasty components. Lots of clove and some alcohol. Creamy and long lasting banana finish, with an assertive hop bite. Good stuff.

(bottle - 500 ml) Hazy golden color with a puffy white head. Aroma is sweet and spicy with lots of banana and clove hints. Tastes much the same. Lots of banana and wheat notes mixing with a nice and smooth spice and clove note. Finishes clean and fruity. Very high quality.

Pours clear golden color with white head. Aromas of clove, banana and wheat. Flavor is moderately sweet with banana, wheat, clove some lemon and floral hops. Medium body with carbonation.  Refreshing and a nice buzz from the ABV was enjoyable.

one of the best hefeweizens out there in my opinion. very fruity, citrusy pleasant aroma on the nose. pours a swirling, orange haze with a nice little puffed white head. as opposed to many hefs ive had as of late this one is a little higher in alcohol content Ɩ.2) as the other are more in the Ɣ.5-5) range. cant taste much of the alocohol in this but what you can taste is that wonderful lemon and orange zest with a bit of spice. goes down amazing and begs for more on your tongue. great stuff.

500 ml bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with good-sized frothy white head.  Banana, citrus and clove in the nose.  Very full body for the style, but the alcohol is nicely hidden by the malty sweetness.  Banana and lemon prominent in flavour.  Slight spiciness too.  Nice.

Great cloudy orange pour withan ample frothy head. Wicked intense aroma of ripe banana, cloves and some wonderful yeasty esters. Flavor is very fullbodied and loaded with banana, cloves and some bubblegum. Outstanding example of the style the higher alcohol really gives it and extra kick and I think hightens the aroma and flavors

Bottle courtesy of curly.  Pours a lightly hazy gold with fair off white head.  Nose of wheat, vanilla, anfd lemon.  Tastes the same with a fake lemonsol quality.  Peppery spicy clove finish.  Nothing to write home about

50cl bottle into Wiezen glass. Pours slightly hazy and golden with a good sized frothy white head. The nose is rather musky fruits (pineapple, banana), cloves, yeast, bubblegum and wheat (ie. it ticks all the right boxes). Quite full bodied with sweet malt taste and tingly mouthfeel. The alcohol content is well hidden. Extremely refreshing. A great Bavarian wheat beer but still not as good as the original.

First time trying out the traditional German Weisse pour, bottoms up., nice thick head with a pleasant aroma, a bit of a tangy taste that finished bready, had some similar flavors to their hefe as well. I enjoyed it.

Hazy yellow pour from the 500 ml bottle. The aroma is quite peppery, kind of smoked/roasted, lots of cloves and bubblegum sweetness. Taste is classic schneiders brewery, intensely flavored yet mellow drinking beers with lots of banana/yeasty flavors, more cloves. Mouthfeel is prickly not very smooth, probably because of the high spice/pepper-clove taste.

500 ml bottle, gushes a bit upon opening even though it just came out of the cooler. Dark gold/goldenrod with tons of yeast floating around, I guess the gushing really stirred things up in there. Nice fluffy white head, little lacing. Aroma is banana oil with some bubblegum character. Light on the usual citrus and clove notes. Flavor is similar to the aroma. Sweet, almost artificial banana taste up front that transforms into a bubblegum note in the finish. Rather watery overall, in body and flavor. Not up to Schneiders weissbier standards.

On tap at Hudsons.  Hazy orange gold, lots of bubbles, thick white head.  Aromas of clove, banana, and mint.  Was a bit of a thin weisse. Refreshing summer beer with an almost minty crisp aftertaste, along with a bit of spice.  Once it warmed up, the banana flavors were more apparent.
500mL bottle poured into proper weiss glass. Pours deep golden amber with thick creamy white head. Aroma of banana and spice. Tongue is spicy and fruit and wheat. Solid beer.

Orange pour, clouded with lots of sediment. Small bitter notes, with yeasty scents and light fruit. Light amount of clove and parsley. Dry taste. Finish is light but isnt overpowering. Some clove and yeast on the taste and finish. Could have a sweeter element to it though...

Interesting... not as spicy and phenolicy as other hefes, but still tasty. Aroma is slight banana and bubblegum with hints of creamed sugar. The flavor is almost like a really good and strongly flavored American hefe.
Rockin weiss! Cloudy orange, huge aroma of banana and spices.  Spicy wheat flavor. Very good.

Colore dorato opaco,scarsa schiuma bianca.Aroma netto di lievito e banana.Sapore dolce di banana e molto di lievito,corpo pieno.Lievemente speziata e poco amara.In una serata di assaggi estemporanei trovo sia tutto sommato una weizen deliziosa,non una Franziskaner o una Weihenstephaner ma deliziosa.

500 at Uber. Pours a crystal clear dark brown and looks like a freshly upturned snow globe with all the floaties knocking around in it. Creamy tan head. Gimungously clovey nose. Not the most pronounced nose of a hefeweizen ever, but certainly the most amplified clove note Ive come across. The body is a little on the syrupy side, but only just (its still pretty watery at the same time--these are relative statements given the lightness of the beer). Tons of dark spicy cloviness stampeding across the mid-palate. Strange little bugger, really.

Poured a turbid golden brown with a sizable white head and good lacing.  The aroma is wheat mainly with light clove and citrus.  The flavor is a blend of wheat, banana, malt and citrus.  The mouthfeel was thin to medium, the finish clean and it never tasted gritty.  Not bad.

500ml bottle from SAQ. POurs semi clear yellow with a medium creamy and foamy head. Aroma is spicy, malty. Hints of hops and wheat, citrusy. Really fresh. Taste is a bit spicy, malty and citrusy. Some wheat. Hints of lime.
Nice refreshing beer. Its smooth to drink with good thick flavors and very citrusy.

Murky apricot pour with a small white head. Aroma holds toasty malt, biscuit, yeast, banana, orange, and a bit of clove in the spice character. Flavor is wicked bready, lots of dough, orange, and tons of spice. Some light bitterness from the hops is certainly there, but the yeast and malt sweetness is dominant. Palate is quite nice for the style, with a really nice dry finish that takes over for the fruity esters. Really solid hefe- impressive beer overall.

16.9 oz bottle. Cloudy gold/yellow with a small white head and lots of suspended yeast. Typical banana clove yeast aroma but a bit more clove and spice than banana, also some spicy hop scents. Sweet bready malt flavor with some sourness from the yeast and a light hop bitterness. Medium body with active carbonation and a soft frothy mouth feel. This is a good German Hef, I dont really care that its organic though.
From a bottle poured a hazy golden color with a lot of head.  Nice malty flavor with a lingering spicy finish.
Cloudy golden body with a thin white head, springtime herbal aroma and clean effervescent finish.  A very pleasing, summery brew.

Bottle as shown. Pours a pale golden with a medium frothy white head that lasts awhile with a lot of yeast flakes floating. The aroma is banana, clove, and yeast. Thin mouthfeel and a bit of watery on the palate. The taste is a sweet fruit malt and wheat with a nice crisp finish. Easy to drink, a good German hefe from Schneider.

Pours a hazy orange with thin off-white head with decent retention.  Mild aroma of clove, banana and apricot.  Flavor is stronger, with notes of citrus, banana, wheat and a hint of bubblegum sweetness.  Slightly watery mouthfeel and a clean finish.  A decent enough beer, but there are much better hefs to be had.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur dorée-orangée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (bananes, agrumes, léger de poires) et épicées (clou de girofle, léger de poivre), moyen de blé, léger de sucre bonbon et de houblon herbeux. Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (bananes mûres, moyen de citron, petites traces de poire) et épicées (moyen de clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de blé aux notes asséchantes avec un léger goût de pain et des traces de sucre bonbon puis en finale lon retrouve une moyenne amertume asséchante de houblon herbeux (herbes mouillées) aux notes florales ainsi quun goût de levures épicées (poivre). Post-goût moyen et un peu sec, moyennement amer de houblon herbeux (notes florales) avec un goût de levures fruitées (pelures de bananes, zest dagrumes) et de blé.

Bottle pours a dirty yellow/brown body with a tall white head. Aroma features ripe banana and clove. Medium body with spritzy carbonation. Taste has wheat, banana, clove, and black pepper. A decent Hef but nowhere close to my favorite of the style.

11 ounce goblet - $5.75 at Taco Mac in Buford, Georgia.

Appearance: Arrived a lightly hazed, golden body with a half inch of dense, lasting, white foam.

Smell: Floral, earthy, pithy notes well ahead of the more subtle sniffs of malted wheat, clove, and banana.

Taste: Initial taste of light pale malts and wheat malt with its characteristic tanginess. Lightly sweet. Limited hints of banana and clove spice. Earthy, floral, citrusy hops with a particularly bold bitterness. The citrus comes across as a flavor of powderized lemon pith and yields a bit of a citric jolt. Finishes dry with a lingering bitterness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-high carbonation. Regrettably, for me it doesnt exhibit the fullness, the pleasant creaminess you get with many hefes.

Drinkability: With its diminished banana and clove qualities, the elevated bitterness, and understated body, well, it fell flat with me. However, oddly enough, their Hopfen-Weisse really resonated with me. Ah well!
Biere de blé peu gouteuse, bonne carbonisation. Little citrus need more hops.  Good german beer.

Source:On tap at the Flying Saucer in Nashville. 
Glass:Hefe glass. 
Appearance:Cloudy gold pour with a one finger white head.  
Aroma:Wheat, cloves, banana and citrus. 
Flavor:Wheat and cloves dominate, with a faint citrus finish. 
Palate:Light body with solid carbonation.
Overall:Very good wheat ale.
Poured from bottle. Aroma of wheat and rye.  Dark copper cloudy with thin head that persists.  Does not look like typical wheat beer.  Flavors of caramel, rye and wheat.  OK finish.  Not a bad beer.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Aroma has some lemon zest, banana, bread and cloves. Appearance is obviously affected by being unfiltered, brownish gold body with yeast flecks and a head that maintained about an 1\8 inch layer at the top of my glass. Flavor is directly connected to the aroma, with perhaps some cherries added in. Palate is bubbly and smooth. A great German wheat ale!

Thanks Chibbyman. Pale clouded golden pour with a thin wispy white head. Fruit and clove aroma with some sweetness in the air. It tastes as it smells. It finishes with a pleasant sweetness. It is a very refreshing beer.

My favorite German beer to date!  Aroma is sweet, with smells of butterscotch and lightly roasted grain to match the light yellow-amber color.  Head dissapates quickly, but is thin and off-white.  A nice sweet citrusy flavor on the finish.  Well balanced hops throughout.  A great beer with fish and chips or a burger, or wings...or great by itself.  Not overly bitter or skunked flavors at all.  Love it!

500 ml. bottle. Pours a thin head with poor retention over a cloudy golden orange body,minimal lacing....nose of clove, lemon, bit of toffee.....taste is lemon, clove, apple, allspice, pineapple, mild hop bitter finish....mouth feel is medium, carbonation medium and gives a slightly creamy feeling. At the end of the glass there was heavy yeasty sediment. A very nice Wheat Ale.

Bottle: Poured a hazy light orangey color wheat ale with a large pure white foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma of great wheat malt a mix between some dry hops and some light citrus hops. Aroma of lightly sweet malt is quite dominant with some notes of dry and floral hops which provides an interesting and unique finale to this beer. Body is quite full with limited filtration and great carbonation. Very well done and while not adhering to any purity law it retains some good drinkability and uniqueness.

Bottle.  Pours a large, creamy-foamy, lasting, white head.  Hazy, bordering on murky, golden-orange body with abundant yeast clouds and pearly carbonation.  Smells of bready yeast, clove and other spicy phenols and wheat malt.  Same flavors, as well as some banana, vanilla and light citrus.  Lively carbonation and medium-light body make this a refreshing summer Hefeweizen.  Interesting, non-offensive, somewhat tart-acidic finish.  Worth having again.

Bouteille de 500 ml. Arômes de levure de Hefeweizen (banane, clou de girofle) et de blé. Robe orangée et trouble, peu de mousse et effervescence moyenne. En bouche, la bière montre les caractéristiques communes dune bonne Hefeweizen (levure, banane, blé), mais le corps est plus consistant et lalcool semble un peu plus apparent. On remarque également une touche de houblon et une amertume assez forte pour le style. Intéressant.

500 ml bottle at the Bayou. Pours a cloudy orange color with a large white foamy head. The aroma was nice; spicy notes, lemon and citrus, lots of malt. The flavor was refreshing and nice; sweet bready malts, spices, a lemony zest. Stands out as fairly unique and nice.

Bottle. Foam went out of the bottle. Hazy yellow with a huge foamy head and very fizzy carbonation. Good retention and mimimal lacing. Aroma is very bready with banana esters, yeast, spices and cloves. Flavor is slightly acid with bread, alcohol, hops and slightly metallic.

Bottle - 500ml. Superb hazy golden/orange body with a fading off-white bubbly head. Malty/hoppy aroma with yeasty, spicy and caramel hints. Alcohol is well hidden. Well balanced wheaty taste that carries piney and biscuity notes. Ends with a good bittersweet finish. Enjoyable.
Bottle. Was intrigued by the fact this was totally organic but this beer came through as a better than decent brew, great flavor and good aroma.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2009 bouteille de 500ml acheté à la SAQ, bière blonde-dorée trouble, nez citronné, bouche épicée, puissante et longue, dans la tradition de schneider, ce qui veux dire : produit de qualité...
Has all the standard Hefeweizen traits. I dont know why its not classified as one. Cloves, citrus, banana, spices, some bubblegum. Good beer.

Draft @ Bishops Arms, Malmö. Pours a hazy orange color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity malty wheaty banana aroma. Sweetish wheat malty spicy banana flavor with some hints of citrus. Has a fruity wheat malty finish.

Call me crazy, but i love this stuff...another mindblowing brew from Schneider. My beer poured awsome thick whiteish head and had the most amazing cloudy orange-straw, and tastes darker, mainly cause i dumped most of the sediment in...just stared. may be the best beer ive ever looked at. Very wheaty and a bit malty too - i always compare these brews to Hoegaarden - this stuff is alot darker and waaaay more flavour. bananas, lemon and an awsome after taste that keeps you opening more cause this stuff is massivly addictive. Good balance of yeast. Jesus...give me more so I can stay tanked!..how can i get more? Closest thing around here is Hacken Pshorr Hefe....7 thumbs up from Chernobyl.

Bottle.  Gushes.  Pours a hazy light brown with a medium thick beige head.  Caramel, wheat, yeast on the nose.  Thin, and lackluster.  Not a lot of flavor going on.  Finishes rather non-descript as well.  Drinkable, but not worth drinking.
UPDATED: DEC 7, 2012 Draft. Fresh floral hops, wheaty base, with light banana yeasty notes. Very well balanced.
On tap at the Map Room in Chicago.  Pretty tasty Wheat ale.  Light orange color with large frothy head that stays for a while.  very drinkable.

Bottle, pours a cloudy golden orange color with a huge, billowing, foamy white head.  Typical weiss aromas of clove, banana, and yeast.  Mild, fairly sweet flavor but a nice balance from the hops.  Very refreshing and easy to drink.

16.9 oz bottle 4/17/09-Pours a cloudy orange with a huge white head. Aroma of clove, banana, wheat, and flowery. Taste is the same with more substance compared to the Original. This medium bodied brew is very good and quite drinkable.

This beer shows usual intensity relative to the style, at least to my palate. Colour is a murky orange / lemon and Im guessing the beer wasnt heavily filtered. Bitter citrus fruits drive the nose with good lift.  Flavours are unusually bitter and forthright, and theres more than a hint of pepper and slate in the mix. Hard finish. This is serious wheat beer that makes a mockery of the bubblegum style.
A little more dry and bit more bitter than a weihenstephaner but very drinkable.
Pours clear golden color with white head. Aromas of clove, banana and wheat. Flavor is moderately sweet with banana, wheat, clove and floral hops. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

nose is floral, but not the overwhelming bananas i expected.  clean, lagerish aromas, almost similar to a krystalweizen. appearance however is far from krystal: cloudy and well carbonated with an orange hue. flavor is foremost well hopped! quite a surprise. yeast takes a backseat to a hops yet an overall balance is struck, very drinkable. palate is not as coating as a typical hefe, just a touch.  after a few sips bananas and the fruits begin to say hello. overall a world class weizen with some very unique twists.

Cloudy golden-yellow, head dissipated quickly.  Typical flowery aroma, flavors of wheat and herbs with the slightest hint of cloves and banana.  Very nice balance in my opinion with the perfect amount of bite at the end.  Clean finish, excellent.

Botte.  Pour gold-orange with a good sized head.  Aroma has flowers, wheat, and some soil.  Flavor is an interesting balance of floral hops, herbs, crisp wheat, and some clove/banana (perhaps from the Belgian yeast?).  Interesting beer, though clearly inferior to other Schneider offerings.
Cloudy pour with medium white head.  Bigger hop presence than most wizens im used to.  Fruits, grass, yeast, and bubblegum dominate the aroma and flavor.  Great balance in this beer.
Bottled. An unclear golden beer with an off-white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of dusty hops and wheat. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of wheat, citrus, and dusty hops.
This was an interesting one.  Every schneider beer i have had was delicious.  Cloudy orange in color and grilled citrus taste.

500ml. bottle from Trinity Liquors in Spring Hill, FL. Pours a cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma is nice citrus, florals, and yeast...and maybe some grapes. Flavor is mostly of oranges and some other citrus and some yeast. Light mouthfeel, sticky feeling...Pretty good drinkable beer. Would be a good session beer.

A really nice weissbier.  Cloudy golden color with a significant white head.  Somewhat subtle aroma of wheat, banana, cloves, and mild grassy hops.  Taste is wheat, banana, cloves, some spices, and a little honey sweetness.  Light, smooth palate.  Really refreshing and drinkable.

50cl bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a fair cap of white head. Nose of bananas and cloves, some wheat tartness, some bready yeast, late spiciness. Flavor tart wheat, fairly dry, clove and restrained hop bitterness at the finish. Feels light, nice carb.

Pours a cloudy apple juice color and texture. The smell has banana, nutmeg, and caramel malt. The taste has the caramel malt flavor with the spicy tangerine hops. The texture is sorta watery. Drinkability is good.

A- Pours a cloudy light yellow hue, lively white head full of popping bubbles dissipates down to nothing, minimal lacing
S- Bananas, bubblegum, and cloves, grass and yeast
T- Initial taste is carbonated citrus, banana, bubblegum, and wheat, hints of floral hops, honey, spices, finishes dry and sweet
M- Light/medium-bodied, thin and light texture, super carbonation
D- I was very impressed with this Hefe, great overall flavor and balance, the sweetness provides a nice backbone without being too cloying, the alcohol is well-masked and this is very drinkable!

This is an organic hefeweizen from Schnieder, and possibly my favorite of their offerings.  A rather dry wizen with a hoppier presence than most, and much more restrained phenolic character (clove-bannana).  Smells of wheat, toast and slight peppers and bubblegum.  The mouthfeel is slightly acidic, dry and tastes of grains, biscuit and grass, with slight clove. Finish is slightly citrus-lemony.  Delicious.

500 mL into Weihenstephaner weissbier glass. Pours a deep cloudy orange with a good white head that settles down to nothing. Lots of yeast floaties in there. Aroma cider vinegar, bitter orange, cloves. Taste is a little watery with some spice, orange peel, wheat, and yeast. Aftertaste is a little sour and tart with some bananas and clove. Not bad.

Crushed with Jakebra.  Excellent wheat ale, even though it looks like pee.  Nose is spicy, fruity, and dry almost like a white wine.  Refreshing flavor.  Smooth mouthfeel, and a bit of a lemony finish.  Very good.

Aroma is weak, but what is there is complex.... Interesting! Nose has some musty, spicy, fruity, and citrus notes all very well balanced. 
This beer had a whole bunch of floaties all suspended in the beer, it was a hazy straw color with a fluffy white head. For all the yeast that seems to be in this thing it tastes fairly clean. The taste is initially very earthy and a little soap like. This reminds me a little of a Kristal but the sweetness is very well under control. The spiciness seems to come from the hops and of course we have some banana clove things happening. The palate is sharp.
Draught at The Rover. Hazy orange with a large off-white, creamy head. Aroma moderate malty, wheat, light fruits, spicy. Flavor moderate sweet, light acidic. Light to medium body.

(Draught at The Rover, Göteborg) On November 28, 2008. Cloudy orange color, frizzy and dense cream colored head. Sweet, banana, spicy, acidic scent. Bitter, sweet, light metallic and phenolic, herbal taste. Moussy to medium mouthfeel. Herbal and banana aftertaste. Medium to low bitterness. Wrong time of year to drink it I guess, in a dark, chilly and rainy Göteborg in late November, but it’s good and I’d like to try it again on a nice summer day.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2008 (10/11/08) Bottle drank in my hostel room in Chicago. A big gusher stains my notebook when I open the bottle. Cloudy golden-colored with a big, quickly-diminishing white head. Fruity wheaty aroma with some spiciness and light bready notes. Sweet wheaty flavor with some yeast, fruits and some light clove notes. Light tartness in the finish. Medium-bodied. Decent.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2012 Sampled from a 16 oz brown bottle this beer poured a very hazy golden-amber color with a large orange-white head. The aroma was a lovely and strong mix of citrus, banana and clove. The flavor was yeasty with strong notes of clove and hints of bubblegum, banana and citrus. There was a spritzy tartness underneath and a long tart clove and bubblegum finish.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of spices, cloves, coriander, wheat, yeast, nutmeg, and slight lemon.  Poured dark yellow/flaxen in color with a medium-sized, fizzy, off-white head that diminished over time but left a thin film.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of medium-sized particles.  Flavor is light to medium sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of wheat, yeast, spices, cloves, artificial sweetener, water.  Light to medium body.  Chalky texture.  Average carbonation.  Lightly sweet,  clove, artificial sweetener,  and wheat finish is dry.

Bottle.  Pours hazy dark yellow with an average, frothy, white head, mostly diminishing with spare lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (hay, straw, meal), light hops (herbs), heavy yeast (horse blanket, earth) with notes of banana.  Light bodied, slick texture, lively carbonation, and a chalky finish.  Average duration, light sweetness, acidity, and bitterness.
Vibrant nice bouqet on the nose.  Lots of fruit light yeast.  Flavors of various fruit like banana with some citrus.  Good wheat.

Gushes into the neck lots of dark brown floaties fall into a pour of yellow-brown body with a thin white head that dissipates to a spotty cover and a ring.  Very yeasty spicy nose, some orange rind, coriander, witbier type aromas.  Nice smooth body, very cream wheat body with lots of nice citrus zest, bananas and cloves, very refreshing with a mild spicy profile.

50cl bottle from Total Wine (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy golden yellow color with a one finger bright white head that settles quickly but still provides some lacing on the glass. Aroma is sweet and wheaty, with notes of banana, juniper, bubble gum, and hints of citrus (primarily lemon). Flavor is sweet and citrusy with notes of cooked fresh veggies, herbs, honey, citrus, and just a touch of tanginess. Generally light to medium body with a crisp, sweet finish.

bottle - started off ok, nice clovey and phenolic aroma, slight fruity and banana as well, bit cloudy with chunks of dark brown yeast floating. first mouthful and started to think there was something wrong with this bottle. stale cardboard and stressed yeast flavours.
Bottle. Golden - orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is citrus, fruit, malt, banana. Flavour is sweet, banana, citrus, orange, malt, hop, spices. Nice beer.

Pours a quickly dissipating head and a sediment filled, cloudy, light brown body with an orange tint to it. Really fruity aroma- mostly banana and wheaty malts. Spicy flavor that is really spicy with a bunch of banana. Very slightly bitter and sweet. Like others have said it has a very soft mouthfeel.

Draught at Bishops Arms, Järntorget.
Hazy golden with a small, firm, white head.
Flowery aroma with a lot of spiciness; clove an nutmeg.
Soft and smooth mouthfeel. Fresh with a medium body.
Spicy with banana, clove and wormwood.

500 ml bottle - Pours a cloudy golden in color (w/ yeast (crystal clear without)) with a huge pure white head.  The aroma is floral with a touch of citrus, wheat grain, and banana.  The flavor profile is spicy, banana and clove.  It has a full body and lingering, warming finish.  One of my favorite weiss beers to date.

Draught at Bishop’s Arms Vasagatan, Stockholm.  Cloudy pale amber, small head. Fresh citric banana aroma. Dryish with spritzy mouthfeel, fairly light bodied. Esters are marked - there’s banana, cloves and tiger balm. A refreshing and pleasant weizen.

(Bottle) Pours a cloudy brownish yellow color with about an inch of dense white head. Aroma of bubblegum and sweet wheat malts. Fruity notes as well, with only slight spice notes in the aroma. Taste is of yeast (although not as strong as the aroma), light clove, and a good amount of wheat malt. Decent mouthfeel, but a little lighter than I desired. Fine carbonation. A very good beer.
Full flavor, balanced yeast aroma and taste. mild blend of citrus and bananas with clove and honey. Solid definition of a true bottle-fermented Wiesen

Bottle.  Gusher!!  Pours a cloudy light orange with a thick, foamy white head.  Aroma of clove, banana, apple skins, light fruits, citrus, and Belgian yeast.  Why is this not a German hefeweizen??  Flavor is nice and sweet with lots of light fruits and a nice wheat and yeasty backbone.  Quite tasty.  Definitely a hefe though...
Bottle. Aroma of bubblegum, clove, citrus, candi sugar. Flavor sweet, clove is highlighted over the other flavors, but nothing particularly remarkable. Decent mouthfeel, drinkable. Pleasant.
bottle, cloudy golden pour, nice lasting head that settles into about 1/4 ", sweet banana nose with a fruity banana flavor, finish is a bit watery

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in McKinney, TX. Pours a hazy gold with white head. Aroma of citris & bannana, Flavor has notes of bubblegum, bannana, and clove, also lightly sweet. Mouthfeel is light and soft with high carbonation. Pretty good stuff.

Bottle. Pours a nice hazy orange-golden body under a medium sized off-white head. Lively carbonation. Citrusy fruity and malty aroma with notes of banana. Fine cloves-like spicyness too. Nice citrusy and bananaish flavor with a good spicyness and bitterness. Pleasant sweetness. Full-bodied, effervescent mouthfeel. The finish is of the lasting kind, with fruityness, sugary sweetness and a pleasant bitterness. A real good one, refreshing and quite quenching even if it’s sweet. (080903)

Poured from a 500ml bottle and served in a weizen glass.  This beer poured a mostly clear dark golden with a short-lived head of off-white foam.  No lace.  The aroma of the beer was made up of lightly toasted wheat, graham cracker, and some over-ripened banana.  The flavor was much the same including some cereal grains.  Didn’t really suit my tastes.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied with moderate carbonation.  Not all that enjoyable.  I won’t likely be revisiting this one.

At this point I can safely approach any bottle of beer from Schneider & Sohn brewery and know it’ll be good.  In a statistical stick to quality and enjoyable beers, the Weisen Edel-Weiss is a refreshingly new and delicious beer.  A thick, light tan head wells up during the pour, acting as a flimsy bastion for the roiling rapids of carbonation underneath in the light bronze liquid.  The aroma is light and slightly cheesy, paired with a delicate honey sweetness.  I also catch whiffs of leather and heavy cream, and an aroma of dry, overripe banana; the kind destined for a blender and a smoothie.  Prepare for a disparity in the flavor, where a strange blend of sweet and dry makes for the refreshing experience.  A smooth and creamly palate, a honey taste, a sprinkling of nuttiness, and a gleefully unique aftertaste of fresh tortilla chips.  It’s really the aftertaste that makes this one.  I’m hopelessly addicted to fresh tortilla chips, and here’s a beer that duplicates their flavor faithfully in a beer aftertaste.  Brilliant.  This is incredible spring drinking, and would seem suitable with a light meal or appetizer.

Bought and drank over at the Barrel Maker Cooper Residence ... pours with quite a low head for a wheat beer ... is a bit soapy ... organic?? ... some banana and other off sweet flavours ... weird, odd, and not enjoyable ... I avoided this beer for almost 4 years, I was right in avoiding this pricey mundane beer..

Cloudy golden colour. Smallish head that didn’t last - but I think it was my glass. Pretty effervescent. Aroma of bubblegum and cloves. Tastes of bubblegum, banana and big clovey tart finish. A refreshing and tasty beer. I like weizens and this is a good one.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2008 Good stuff !

One of the best Wheat beers I have had.

Ripe Bananas, Coriander, and Cheap Pink Bubble gum on the aftertaste.

Had out of 22oz and of tap, Bottle was pritty damn close to the tap.

This overall is a must buy and try.

Funny thing about this brew is im finding a lot of "Non-Beer Drinkers" Actualy Enjoy this Wheat.

Open on a hot day and sit back and chill.
500ml bottle.  pours clear yellow, white head.  Clean herbal flavor.  slow at first, then the character comes out.  smooth, refreshing.

.5l bottle, rapidly collapsing head, a bit of DMS smell, only very light banana and spice, same for flavor. Moderate body fades quickly to a watery mouthfeel, a trace of hop bitterness persists. Pedestrian weisse.

Very good beer.  This beer pours a hazy orange-yellow with an aroma that hints strongly of creamed corn.  It also smells of citrus, banana, and spices.  An excellent wheat beer, this one is very drinkable with lots of spice, banana, and light citrus flavor.  The finish is slightly dry with a hint of spice.  Good hot day beer, good wheat beer, good beer, period.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2013 Re-rate (7/11/2013): 50cl bottle from Liebick Getränke in Germering. Pours a cloudy orange colored body with an inch thick, dense and foamy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is semi-sweet wheats with a nice banana and citrus element. Some clove spice, yeast, and a touch of caramel. Flavor is similar. Slightly sweet wheats with a touch of caramel, a decent citrus note, lots of banana, a light clove spice throughout, and a bit of a yeastiness. Finishes clean and very lightly bitter before leaving a lengthy aftertaste. Medium, smooth body and a soft, moderately lively carbonation. Overall, a pretty solid hefe. A touch sweet, but lots of citrus and bananas with enough of a spiciness to balance. Good beer (7,4,7,4,14=3.6). Original Rating (7/12/2008). 500ml bottle from Binnys. Aroma: Very citrusy and strong fruit. Can smell yeast and cascade hops. Very strong sweet smell with no hint of alcohol. Very defined hefeweizen aroma. Appearance: Very very pure orange. Couldnt see through glass, hazy. Lots of yeast in the pour and glass. Nice pale head with good looking carbonation and didnt dissipate too quickly. Flavor: Very light, lots of wheat taste. Wheaty. Not very sweet and no alcohol. Palate: Light, smooth, not a very lasting flavor. Overall: Very drinkable. I appreciate the high amount of yeast/wheat taste, but it feels like it needs more. Lacking the sweetness I crave in a hefe (8,5,6,2,11=3.2).

Pours a orange bronze into HB weiss glass.
Flavor leans toward the sweeter banana side.  Has a spiced finish.  A refreshing smooth Weiss offering.  What more can you ask for on a hot Summer day?

This was excellent for a weisse beer, but a little too subtle in flavor for more. The fact that it is organic is why I definitely bought it at the store, and obviously the fact that it is from Munich - love those purity laws!

Bottle (500ml). Poured a pale muddy brown with a hint of yellow and a small, rocky, white head which was mostly diminishing. Aroma had strong notes of sour yeasty malts and cloves with some straw, lemon zest, orange citrus, dried banana, coriander and hints of nutmeg. Flavor had strong notes of sour bready malts and cloves with tart lemons, orange citrus (mild), dried banana, coriander, some nutmeg and hints of pear. Well hidden alcohol content. Medium bodied with medium carbonation, a creamy mouthfeel and a good finish. Needed a bit more carbonation.

500ml bottle.  Interesting hazy golden/orange color on this beer with a nice  pillowy big white head.  Sour yeast, wheat, bananas, coriander and a little clove on the nose. Bigger taste than I expected--seems like a decent amount of malt to back the beer up. Sweet taste in addition to the sour/citric/spice notes.  Very solid.
yeasty and alcohol aromas. quite sweet with a bit of banana with the maltiness preventing the taste from getting too out of hand.

500 ml bottle purchased at Lukas, KCMO.  Pour is a hazy golden copper with a firm 3 inch white head. Pretty in the glass.  There is quite a few small carbonation bubbles slowly floating their way to the top of the glass.  Aroma is a citric sour wheat and freshly cut hay. Some yeastiness in the back of the nose. Taste is mostly the wheat, sour, lemons, some nice yeastiness to the finish. Palate is medium and quite mouth coating. Refreshing beer.

Gusher! The half-liter bottle oveflows immediately upon opening; in my glass, the explosive froth settles into a pale amber liquid, murky with floaties and overzealous carbonation. Head retention: zero. Pleasing musky aromas of chamomille and bubblegum wrapper, lemon, bread dough, and flowers. The taste starts as a cointoss between spice and candyish honeyed plum  and savory flavors win as the beer finishes with spiced pumpkin pie phenols. Nearly banana-less, and featuring a refreshing, though brief, tartness. Oddly, as carbonation wanes, so do the interesting flavors, leaving only a thin, reedy citric sensation. The lifeless, watery palate is oily with an almost chalky friction.  If any other aspect of this beer were as good as the aroma, it would kick ass. As with most things, "organic" is again a sales gimmick and not an indication of quality.

Soft frothy white head with good carbonation,colour is yellow,head back to mild cover.Aroma sweet sugary wheat,hops are superb,note of clove,coriander.Flavour clove coriander orange very hoppy sweet taste of sugary wheat and barley,lacks a bit of zip no matter it,s good.Finish sweet,dry,good flavour,good brewery.

The beer pours to a murky straw colored body with a fizzy white head.  The aroma is sweet pineapple wheat cobbler.  Very estery with coconut.  The flavor is an intense concentrated wheat, pineapple, clove, and sweet rolls.  The palate is fulfilling.  Medium bodied, crisp, clean, wheat, and citrus.

Pours fluffy white head.  Aroma is yeast, banana, and german hops.  Taste is higher alcohol than is really there.  But I like the balance that the dry hop flavor and perceived alcohol gives to the sweet wheat and banana flavor.  Theres something that I really like about that balance.  It doesnt linger, but it feels like a shot of scotch chased by a cupcake in your belly - in  a good way.

Very, very interesting, especially as an organic. Compared to Schneiders original weisse, this one really packs in the carbonation, which slows down the drinking. Its appearance and drinking experience is much less elegant than the original Schneider Weisse. A little too bready/yeasty taste, but hardly a bad flavor. Would probably try again.

...bottle.  Good representation of the style, of course, from a great German brewer. Alcohol is masked well with the wheat malt, and hints of citrus and yeast.  Organic, which I suppose is another plus, in ingredient quality.  Slight spicy notes, and I think this beer is definitely worth a try if you can find the stuff.

(Bottle 50 cl) Courtesy of Hildigöltur/MoritzF. Hazy golden with an off-white head. Distinct aroma of yeast and banana. Good full body with notes of sweet banana and plenty of yeast. Some spiciness and no real bitterness. A lovely Hefe. 270408

500ml Bottle - Never been disappointed by the few Schneiders Ive had - (Especially the Hopfen-Weiss, which is excellent) so I thought Id give this a try.  Pours a cloudy yellow almost gold with pretty much no head.  Aroma is tht of a barleywine with more wheat than barley - so a wheatwine.  Taste is very similar -  totally reminds me of a watered down very wheaty barleywine.  Miko commented that it tastes like it hase more alcohol than 6.2% and I somewhat agree.  I wouldnt say it was thick, but definitely medium bodied.  Definite wheat, cloves, bananas, citrus, etc; in the flavor.  Overall, its decent, but the Ayinger Bräu Weisse I had next blew it the hell out of the water.
Cloudy, dark yellow beer with no head.  Clove, banana, and wheat aroma.  Hop and slight banana flavor.  Beer is a bit watery.  Finish is clean and spicy with a bit of hop, but fades quickly.

I thought I had rated this but I guess not. Pours a cloudy yellow color that is hazy and some what orange. Nose is spicey and clove like with some banana ester and wheat. Taste is very clove like. This beer is really good and extremely refreshing. One of the few organic beers that I like.

Thanks to Blake for bringing this!  Poured hazy medium golden with a short cap of white head.  The aroma picked up fresh toasted bananas, bubblegum, and lighter candied fruits with a hit of pineapple.. everything worked very well here.  The flavor had sweeter banana, bubblegum, and pineapple at the core with a very nice complement of spicy pine and light fruity bitterness.. finished with more citrus on top of that banana.. sweeter and very well balanced.  Medium-bodied with higher carbonation on the palate.. spicy and sour on the back, with very good balance all around.  Very good brew!
Pours a cloudy orange with a decent sized head. Aroma of banana, citrus, and clove. A little bit of something in the flavor I just dont care for.

Pours a golden color, hazy with a thick fluffy head that actually does settle down a little. Nice aroma consisting of bananas, tangerines, yeast, some lemons and vanilla. The flavor, as expected, is citrusy with banana and orange coriander taking a lead role. Some yeast and bready wheat malts mixed in. Somewhat of a mild seltzer mouthfeel. Perhaps thats the carbonation or maybe I made it up :-) Crisp and refreshing. Probably not my favorite hefe but it is probably in my top 5.

A truly underappreciated beer, with a great taste and a lot of cool history behind it, and it show that not all organic beers are terrible.  Starts off with a nice butterscotch maltiness, some honey and some refreshing carbonation.  Some spicy zesty flavors, with some tasty cereal grainy notes.  Tasty.

Rich golden hue with a lasting, foamy-white head. Big and estery banana nose. Soft texture; light body; tame carbonation. Bitterness seemed to be a bit stark for the subtle sweetness. Malts were kind of flat and unexciting. Seemed earthy and damp, overall.
Hazy orange winy white short lasting head. Sweet fruity aroma with wheaty and coriander notes. Sweet fruity flavor with wheaty and coriander notes.

Bottle.
Cloudy golden coloured with a medium sized white ehad.
Sweet aroma of malts, fruits and bananas with notes of yeast.
Sweet flavour  of yeast, bananas, caramel and spices.
Yeasty finish.

50 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow to light orange with a fully diminished white head. Grainy and dry wheaty aroma. Flavour is light caramel malty and wheaty. Light cinnamon spiced. Ends with a light wheaty note. To cinnamon spiced for my liking.

Draft. Cloudy light brown in the glass with a frothy off-white head that leaves good lacing behind. Aroma of wheat, citrus and spices. The flavor follows much the same of the aroma. Light to medium body with a nice hefe wheat aftertaste. (Rating from Sep 07 in Germany)

Pours golden yellow, with a e inch empty bubble foam head that dissipates rapidly. Its slightly cloudy with some seediment mixed in.  Medium wheat citus aroma. Full, darker flavor.Good citrus character of lemon. Pulp citrus mouthfeel. Clean finish. Overall a medium bodied and flavor, good weisse.

Bottle on 4/19/2008. I was expecting the massive head of a German hefe, but this was a medium head, quite sturdy and durable, over a hazy gold, so it still looked pretty darned good. Very floral aroma, with notes of cloves, and the fruit esters characteristic of the style. Light body and medium effervescence that supplemented the clean palate and slowly building dryness. Flavor showed a restrained honey sweetness, followed by some light acidity and even a hint of sourness, with a soft, dry, but not particularly bitter finish. this is a great brewer, and this beer lives up to their standards, even if its not on the same level as Aventinus.

The color was cloudy yellow/brown.  The head was thin, creamy, and white.  The arome was wheat, alcohol, spice, and lemon-grass.  The flavor was lemon-grass and wheat.  The palate was smooth.  The finish was wheat.

Pours a very hazy soft orange amber. The head is about two fingers thick, creamy, white. Fades quickly. The aroma is banana, spicy, clove, sour hefe yeast. The flavor is wheaty, Hefe yeast, clove, spice, crisp, banana. Crisp well carbonated mouthfeel. Finishes fairly clean, leaving some residual banana flavors. Alcohol plays more of a role in the mouthfeel and flavor than I expect from a Hefe.

Very impressive for an organic beer. light basement aromas, the color is golden and hazy. bitterness is medium as is the body with a lively taste. Overall Impression; Wow! extremely well balanced HefeWeizen, with traditional taste.

Bright, clear-gold pour with a 1 finger white head.  Sweet banana-clove aroma with a hearty bread malt backbone.  Flavor is lots of banana, chewy malt, caramel, spice, wheat and a hint of fig.  Sticky medium body with a healthy amount of carbonation.

bottle pours out a clear straw color topped with a white head. A very nice aroma of classic German hef. Spice and bannana. Tast of spice manybe clove. One bad thing this brew is pretty thin. O well. It still tast good.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2008 Bottle from Brickskellers in D.C.  Poured in the traditional style into a nice big weizen glass, allowing the yeast in the bottle to mix with the rest of the beer, leaving a nice thick head.  Smells of banana, orange, cloves, wheat and flowers.  It has a very nice, light and carbonated mouthfeel.  Its a pretty complex beer, I could pick up lots of different notes but it seemed to be dominated by citrus, bananas, cloves and slight hop and alcohol presence.  One of the better hefeweizens Ive had the pleasure of drinking, although it reminded me of other German hefeweizens (like Paulaner).

500ml bottle and its organic! Filled to the brim of my trusty Duvel glass. Two fingers of white head sit atop a murky, hazy brew, with an apricot, pink grapefruit hue. Pinkinsh at the core, but yellow and dull around the edges. Strong and layered nose. Hints of flowers, bananas, cloves, bubblegum, slight cedar, straw, citrus zest. Playful on the palate. Definitely not too heavy or overly sedimented. Lively and zesty with citrus notes popping out. Typical Hefe flavors, bananas and cloves, but so much more. Dry bitter pine hop finish. Ever so slight alcohol burn at the back of the throat. Vanilla and pepper. Cloying sweetness that holds the bitter burn! Yep, this is good. Not the best Hefe Ive ever had, but its up there.

Bottle. Hazy, dark yellow body. Hefe aromas of banana, orange and spice (clove) along with notes of toasted grain, flowers and yeast and just a hint of vinegar. The flavor is lightly sweet and lightly bitter. Lively carbonation in a medium body with a watery texture. Finish remains lightly bitter and a little tart. Nice enough, but a bit of a mess in the balance and texture.

500ml Bottle - Gravity Beer Market - Olympia, WA 
Aroma  Big wheat malt aroma.  Very little other aromas.  
Appearance  Golden in color, Nice head and very hazy. 
Flavor  Good wheat malt flavor.  Has a great banana and grapefruit essence through out.   
Palate  Huge wheat Alcohol Mouthfeel, good texture with a dry sweet finish. 
Overall  A very nice wheat beer.  This was wheat with a capital W.  Great with some dinner and this will sit heavy on the tummy.

This weizen beer has a pretty good wallop, 6.2 % alcohol.  It is spicier than most weizens with a complex group of esters, none dominating like the banana or citrus that characterize so many.  It is a pretty good weizen but not the best of the Bavarians.  I would definitely buy it again.Earlier Rating: 3/2/2008 Total Score: 3.7Unlike most German weizens this one has a hint of bitterness.  It is full of the fruity esters characteristic of its type.  The bottle was stamped "organic", so God knows what kind of bug defecated in it.  Nevertheless it is a solid weizen, not the best but very good.
On tap:  Cloudy yellow in color with aromas of clove, banana and dough.  These flavors followed into a medium-bodied beer that was dense and quite enjoyable with just a touch of sweetness.

Bottle poured into weizen glass- poured very slightly murky dull golden orange yellow, medium carbonation of tiny bubbles, white head bubbled away as I wrote this, aroma of coriander, banana, and wheat.  Hits the mouth with a thin strong body, banana very present, finish of slight bitterness.  Yeah!

Bottle.  Pours a yellowish-orange with a small and quickly-dissipating white head.  Aroma is banana, citrus, and slight coriander.  Taste is the same, with citrus and banana up front dissolving into a vanilla/coriander aftertaste.  Very smooth and a great example of the style.
Hoppy. flat aroma.  murky, yellow brown. good lacing.  A strong hefe taste.  Not my taste, but very good for the style
500ml bottle.   Orange with a dying head.   Big banana aroma is pretty sweet.   Dryer flavor than usual for the style, and a litlte less tart.  Medium, crisp body.   Pretty standard and well made.

Bottle. Poured a clear golden yellow with a good amount of head. Fairly standard as German Hefs go, but this one has more banana-like esters, and theres definitely some chamomile notes in there as well. A really great wheat beer. Nice, clean, refreshing, crisp, an easy drinker. Recommended.

Breathtaking good beer.  Pours a cloudy mixed gold colour.  Nice hefe solid head.  Bananas and clove predominate.  More full on than the usual wheat beer.  Wish I had been around for the 1940s Octoberfest for the original of this...

Pours a lightly hazy golden with an average creamy/bubbly white head that left some lacing.  Aroma of banana, clove, citrus and wheat.  Flavor of yeast, clove, Ginger, some banana, bubblegum, wheat and mixed citrus.
500ml bottle. pours hazy orange with white head. nose has banana and cloves with medicinal undertones. flavor has banana, cloves, yeasty-wheaties with a spritzy orange going on. a very solid hefe.

yeasty/ clove/spice on nose.
very cloudy/dirty appearance.
flavor is intense wheaty, with some citric undertones, flavor lingers on for at least a minute or more. very clean and balance is almost perfect. this is basically a double weisse  & the best weisse beers ive had. KICK ASS BEER
head and shoulders above the rest of the weisse beer field
Clove yeast and coriander.  I loved the nose, very sweet and full.  It is lighter on the mouth than other hefes but the mellow clovey mouth is nice.

July 2006 - Man, can I have a little more beer with my cloves, please?  If it werent for the excessive clovey nature, this would have been better than the original.  Beautiful crystal clear golden color.  Nice wheaty, clovey aroma.  Flavor was CLOVES under, around and on top of a nice wheaty base, bananas and bubble gum. Mouthfeel was carbonated.  Very good, but Ill still take my Paulaner, please.
Pours a hazy straw yellow with white head.  Citrus, floral notes, lemon zest, banana, wheat grain.  Also a bit of spice.  An excellent hefe that is very refreshing and drinkable.

Cloudy yellow/orange with a medium sudsy white head (I prefer creamy heads on hefes).  Nice spicy banana wheat aroma.  Flavor is heavily citrus and clove, very spicy.  Peppery finish, and again cloves and some vanilla.  Nice full palate, but still light and drinkable.  Different.

Bottle. Light notes of grain and cereal, moderate aromas of lemon, barnyard and musty up front, with pear, clove and wet paper in the background. head is small, fizzy/frothy, white with fair lacing and is fully diminishing. Color is clear amber. Flavor starts moderately sweet and acidic and finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is medium, watery to creamy in texture and has a lively carbonation. Texture and body was perfect for this type of beer. One of the better Weisse beers Ive had.

Bottled, 500ml. Golden amber with white head. Smooth, fruity weizen, initially quite light but still quite a depth of flavour with a banana note to the fore. Spicy, probably more than my tastebuds can cope with, clove and corriander seed come to mind, then a yeasty, wheaty finish with a slighly herby hop. Certainly a well crafted beer and much enjoyed.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2008 Pours a hazy golden orange/honey lemon tea color. Head is light, fizzy, and dissipates remarkably fast for a Bavarian weizen but this one is cold and not served in proper glassware either. It’s aromatic and fruity. The requisite banana is there. So is the yeast and yogurt smells but there is also papaya and even citrus. That pineapple aromas might be due to the somewhat surprising addition of organic Cascade hops. The palate on this baby is superb. It bursts in the mouth then subsides for easy sipping. Creamy, soft, and playful. Flavors are all in the right place at the right time. There is considerable complexity here. Hops are predominant in the aftertaste but considerably challenged by the hefe. Balanced and honed as a German car.

Bottle.  Hazy golden color with a thin white head.  Wheat and yeast all over the aroma - light hops, orange, slight spice notes (coriander, pepper, cinnamon).  Flavor is simple but enjoyable.  Light finish.  Nice beer.
Strong grain and yeast aroma. Cloudy dark golden color with a small white head. Sweet grain taste that fades to a slight bitterness. Light bodied for a hefeweizen.

Pours a golden yellow with a slight orange tint and a huge foamy white head.  Sweet citrusy aroma with hints of lemmon and orange peel, yeast and alcohol.  Very smooth crisp flavorful beer.  Tastes of lemon, orange, banana with a slight touch of sour matly alcohol.

bottle, thanks a lot for sending it to Munich pivnizub :-). Orange, low head. Fruity (oranges) aroma. Very nice fruity base, oranges, peach and banana, almond - essentially all the sweet bits of a Aventinus with a aromatic hop bite. Great retronasal note.
bottle: malty with a hint of fruit aroma. pretty cloudy light brown with very little head. flavor is pretty malty with a slight citrus taste. pretty good beer.

Pours a hazy dark golden bronze with a an airy white head.  Aroma of spicy clove, some sweet banana esters and a touch of bready German yeast.  Body is fairly full and wheaty sweet with some peppery clove spice and doughy flavors toward a slightly more bitter noble hop finish.  Well-balanced and pretty drinkable.

500 ml bottle from bevmo. This is the Organic version. Pours a cloudy unfiltered gold color with an ample white head that slowly fades to a thin film. The aroma is very reminiscent of a Belgian wit rather than a German Hefe. The aroma is strong with notes of wheat and cloves and something funky. The flavor mirrors the aroma--there is plenty of cloves, light wheat and a touch of banana. The mouthfeel is full and slightly soapy. The Finish is long with lingering cloves and cinnamon. Overall: this is a first rate hefe--Recommended.
Light opague orabge color with a short lasting head. Aroma of cloves and bananas and spicy bready flavors.

22 oz certified organic bottled poured, coppery yellow with a big white pillowy head, tons of carbination, Aromas of wonderful belgium yeast bananas, some nice bread dough.
Clean pallot bubbles roll of the tounge, flavors of light wheat, lightly sweet, not much hops, this is a great hefeweizen, I wish i would of found it closer to summer it would of been my go to beer.

Certified USDA Organic version purchased from A Southern Season. Pours a light yellow color with a heavy fog of cloudiness. Smell of bananas and malt. The label reads organic Cascade Hops; however, I do not taste them. The taste is wheat, banana, and malt. Thin finish, but a thicker aftertaste. Sticky head.
user_location: Heart of the Rockies, Colorado, USA

text:
purchased at puget sound wine cellar in port orchard, washington.
pour is semi-cloudy golden yellow with a small white head, above average carbonation.
smell is wheat, popcorn, touch of citrus, bit of banana, yeast.
taste is very nice, wheat, citrus hiding in the background, tingles the tongue and ends nice and dry, way in the background there is a hint of spice.
this brew is nice, just a touch of sweetness to it, im very impressed, a must.

Sample, at the Mondial de la bière, savoured June 2 2006; eye: hazy straw, tiny ring of foam around the glass, no effervescence; nose: soapy bubble gum, smoked ham; mouth: finale in soapy bubble gum with pepper from the alcohol, average bitterness, medium body, good carbonation, lightly sweet

FRANÇAIS 

Échantillon, bue au Mondial de la bière, savourée le 2 juin 2006; oeil : paille voilé, petite ligne de mousse autour du verre, pas deffervescence; nez : gomme balloune au savon, jambon fumé; bouche : finale en gomme au savon avec poivre de lalcool, amertume moyenne, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, légèrement sucrée

Bottle into mug, purchased at Frugal MacDougals, Nashville.  Pours with a huge creamy soapy head.  Yeasty, banana, lemon, clove and wheat aroma busting out all over the place; very fresh and inviting, very nice.  Hazy orange straw in the glass.  Fairly light on the tongue, with juicy light wheat flavors settling into a yeasty, bready finish that tingles at the sides with spiciness (ginger, cardamom, black pepper).  Carbonation is near perfect, just enough fizz to tickle the tongue and accentuate the freshness of it.  The middle has this wonderful fresh lime taste to it that is exactly what Miller Chill was trying to achieve with adjuncts (and failing miserably).  Finish also tastes of a very light banana cream, but only in the flavor: the feel is light and crisp throughout.  Wonderful hefe.

Golden pour with frothy, billowy white head.  Perfect weiss aroma with notes of clove, banana and other yeasty esters.  Crisp flavor with mild bitterness on the palate to finish.  I got some sourness as well, but it didnt overpower the overall flavor.
A golden amber color slightly clouded by the sediment from the bottle fermintation. A tall foamy head. Has a malty/wheat aroma with a crisp bite. Very good!

Pours out a nice cloudy yeloow color with a large white head.  aroma is full of wheat and yeast with hints of citrus.  Flavor is slightly sweet and has a nice hop balance to it.  Over all a nice brew.  I enjoyed this one

Bottle:  Full pour yeilds cloudy light brown with film head.  Nose is fruity ...pears and mangosteens.  Light sweet malts start the medium body and wheat malts come forward second.  Steady mellow hop pulse thuout.  Finish is sweet with the same hop pulse. Nice

Pleaseant white head with a wonderfully appealing color.  Aroma is nice, filled with fruity wheat, and hints of cloves.  the taste is less impressive but sufficient non-the-less.  definitely a well constructed wheat beer with a pale, slightly bitter finish.  good stuff

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2007 Nice label that evokes the world of the past, when men in straw hats sipped perfectly pleasant, but not the kind of thing yosteins under their handlebar moustaches.  Wow, this has a big fluffy head.  It goes down smooth, then fizzy.  Nice on the palate, and it is organic too.  Unfortunately, it weakens a bit after this promising start, since the flavor turns out to be a little bland for a hefe.  It is dry and wheaty, very pleasant overall.  This appears to be an export bottle, not sure if it is the same stuff you get in Deutschland.
50cl bottle.  Poured a hazy, traditional hefe look with good carbonation and a nice stable head.  Lots of banana in the aroma.  Very well balance hefe.
500ml bottle-pours a thin foamy white head and cloudy yellow color.  Aroma is wheat, some clove.  Taste is wheat, some clove and banana/lemon, light hop.  OK carbonation.  Some crispness at finish.

Exceptional hefeweisen. Usually taste is bad when see organi claim but this is nice. Low acidity, high carbonation, clean crisp mineral taste. Typical yeasty, banana, clove taste with a more unusual hint of pine.

(bottle) Cloudy, orange colour with a big foamy, minimal off-white head. Sweet wheat-malty nose with citrus (ripe oranges), banana, a moderate phenolic touch (cloves, vanilla) and even vague hints of hops in the background. Moderately sweet flavour with a light acidity, medium to light bodied, a bit overcarbonated mouthfeel. Good wheat character, yeasty and slightly fruity taste with balancing phenolic spice; light sweet, wheaty and a bit fizzy finish with spicy notes and a piney hops shining through. Complex aroma, decent taste; really a nice one.

Pours cloudy yellow with a medium off-white head and lots of bubbles chasing the glass.  Nose is banana and clove ester with a medium wheat component.  Flavor is initial banana and clove, well balanced, with a rush of strong wheat flavor.  Very good wheat taste.  I like it lots.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2010 500 mL bottle.  Translucent copper-orange with a small head.  Smells much like Schneider Weisse Original.  Maybe a little milder.  Flavour is definitely milder; less yeast, more citrus.  You get some of the Hallertauer  hops at the end.  No alcohol presence.  Body is medium-thin.  Quite heavily carbonated.  Only a disappointment when compared to other Schneider products.

Re-rate.  Getting much more of a hop presence than I did last time, particularly a pine-citrus C-hop presence, from middle to finish.  Not strong, but strong for the style.  Theres is also a really nice brown spice presence at the end, which fills out the body.  Much better than I remember.

Pours hazy amber with a soapy white head.  The aroma has fairly bready traits, lots of banana esters, light citrus and an overall richness.  Medium / thick body with quite a bit of sharper carbonation.  The flavor starts with an excessive amount of peppery spice, banana and sweet thick wheat.  The finish adds even more spice.  This beer is okay, but not up to the brewerys standards.

500 ML Bottle-Cloudy golden straw color w/a moderate white fizzy head. Light sweet flavor of wheat, banana, bread dough, citrus, peach, floral hops, cane sugar, & a touch of spice. Very smooth & fresh, kind of made me think of a quality Belgian. Like their Schneider & Brooklyner, but less aggressivly hopped, just had a touch. Easy drinking brew, you could really but a few of these away. This one was a winner.

Name: Weisse Edel-Weisse
Date: 06/22/2001
Mode: Draft
Source: Taco Mac, Cumming

cloudy yellow, thin head, citrus aroma, rich fruity flavor, touch of sweetness, 
-------- />
Name: Weisse Edel-Weisse
Date: 07/05/2007
Mode: bottle
Source: aa

strong clove aroma, strong clove flavor, the strong clove leads to a very spicy character, only a hint od any balancing esters, 

Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 10/20
Rating: 2.6/5.0Score: *4

orange gold with yeasty cloudiness and medium fluffy head. light aroma of bread, bananas and some clove, with a hint of cookie. medium creamy body with crisp but full carbonation. the cookie becomes more prominent with some honey bread, spice, and a light fruitiness. smooth drinking, complex and balanced

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2013 Bottle: Cloudy, clumps of yeast visible, visible carbonation, mid-sized fluffy white head, not very persistent; solid fruity-wheaty nose with a faint citrousy acidity in the wings - and almost a tinge of hops; very robust sweet-sourish flavour with a light, but distinctive bitterness, medium to full bodied, fizzy MF; distinctive sweet -(orangey)fruity and wheaty finish with a bitter tinge and a touch of yeast. Fine Märzen-Weizen, unfortunately not avaible in Germany.......

500 ml bottle in the official Edel-Weisse glass....beautiful two-inch head on a healthy golden-orange hued body....corriander and citrus accents with a heavy clove aroma--apparent from opening of bottle to after-pour, quite reminiscent of the Original...soft and flavorful palate but strikingly absent on the tongue...smooth, with the slightest release of alcohol when chewed....definitely a refreshing presence...a bigger body than the Original, but not enough to discourage....no aftertaste--a plus, or a detraction?....makes a case of this--whatever the cost---quite desirable...a perfect compliment to the thunder/lightning storm Im experiencing on my deck...
Draft.  Wow, a very clean tasting weiss. Not a whole lot of acidity and very clean, not a lot of aftertaste.  Great beer.

The Wiesen Edel-weisse (bottle) is distinguishable from other hefeweizens because of its extreme banana flavor (and an incredibly ripe smell to go along with the taste). Its really not as citrusy or spicy as other hefes either. When we got down to the bottom of the bottle, it was cloudy like a sweet, delicious gravy. All in all, this is a solid option, maybe the best of this style.

Bottle. Citrusy, malt aroma with banana and touch of spice. Not much yeast aroma. First sip is delectable. That classic hefeweizen flavor is unmistakeable and a good example stands out in the crowd. This is one and this is how it should taste. Soft, malty banana and cloves, subtle note of gum and barely noticeable hop aroma/flavor. Perfectly carbonated, medium body. Excellent. Im sure this would be a 4.8 or better on tap.
100.Bottle.Cloudy amber.White head.Clove banana and light citrus aroma.The clove quality really stands out upon tasting.Spicy semi sweet flavor.Very nice.

500ml bottle in Weihenstephan glass.  Pours coudy orange amber with lasting white head.  Aroma of yeast and slight lemon.  Flavors of wheat tanginess, lemon tartness, bubblegum, and slight bitter finish.  Nice mouthfeel.  Refreshing.  I think I like this better than Schneider Weisse.

cloudy golden pour with a head that wont go away...definite yeast aroma with some lemon zest. lively bodied and crisp. flavor is five spice clove with some fresh apricot dominated by yeast. nice refreshing brew...

Pours a cloudy medium gold with a medium-dense, medium-fine head.  Aroma is classic Bavarian hefeweizen yeast characteristics with some bright, fruity fruit notes over a bit of wheat malt.  Flavor is light and fruity with some sweetness, spice, wheat malt, and hefe yeast.  Body is light too, but with good substance, and the result is a well-balanced, flavorful beer with character.

bottle: pours a cloudy yeloow colour with a large lively froathy white head that diminishes quickly. aroma is spicey clove, wheat, some banana and yeast. slight floral hop. flavour is yesty and spice, some wheat and seems a little heavy on the palate.

Firm banane aroma backed by hints of spice. Hazy orange tinted gold color with a frothy white head. Medium bodied with creamy carbonation. Strong clove flavor nearly obscures the banana. Its really impressive. Wakes one up. The finish is nearly dry, slightly astringent, and the clove persists. Banana sort of floats along. Really good hefe.

Aroma is banana, but with a rubber quality that dominates. Slightly cloudy golden pour with a thick vanishing white head. Relatively weak flavor of banana and maybe nutmeg. More hops in the finish than can normally be expected from a wheat. It tastes good, but lacks strength.

Poured mellow-gold with a 1-inch white head that stayed for a bit. Decent lace. Smells of wheat, some sour yeast, and a little pepper. Tastes of citrus, grains, hints of coriander. Aftertaste of canned meat. Moderate to full carbonation. Very well-balanced and refreshing.

(500mL bottle): Pours a cloudy amber brownish color, with a very fizzy carbonated white head, quickly diminishing. Malty aroma, earthy, potato or wheat or something rotten, not appealing Fizzy potoaey taste, clean aftertaste, not a lot of flavor.
A very good hefe.  Wheaty nose with strong banana and spices.  Smooth body with a lots of banana and spice in the body but a slightly watery finish.  Probably the best organic beer Ive had.

Bottle, organic version.  Pours with an orange to light-brown body and white head.  Slight malt and fruity aroma, predominantly orange/apricot.  Most of the flavor comes on the front and middle of the palate, finishes kind of watery, but clean.  Light body with fruity flavors, some malt and clove.
lovely banana & lemon aroma. with similar flavors. pours hazy gold with 1 finger head that disapates to a fine film.  no lacing

500ml - Aroma of bread dough, lemon and sweet malts.  Pours transparent gold with constant bubbles, a big fluffy lasting head and great lacing.  Flavor matches aroma.  Palate is tart and crisp.  A refreshing and tasty Hefe.
red/amber color.  hint of banana, smoke and clove spice. slightly acidic.

500ml bottle. Weizen glass. Cloudy yellow with a moderate head. (Aggressively poured.) Aroma was fairly strong and of the typical wheat, clove and banana of a hefeweizen. Taste was heavy on the clove with some spice and citrus and a touch of malt. Well carbonated with a tangy bite to it.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2007 Pours murky yellowish-orange with a small bubbling white head (i.e.-stagnant urine). Fairly typical but pleasant aroma of light banana, wheat, clove, and just a bit of lemon zest. Fruity, zesty, and spicy mid-palate. Palate is light, dry, spicy, and effervescent. Not great, but a very balanced, easy drinking hefe.
Pours copper with a sparse white head.  Smells of sweet malt, some lemon, not much else.  Tastes of oranges, bananas, some lemons.  Mouthfeel is dry with a spicy finish.

Bottle, Weizen glass. Tons of banana, cloves and citrus aromas. Pours a very light and cloudy color. with a small but lasting white head. Nice big full rounded flavor, Nice sweetness, with just a touch of bitter hops at the finish. A nice weiss and the light hops is a bit of a suprise for the style.

bottle . . pours slightly cloudy amber with a thick foamy head . . aroma is raisin, tropical fruit, bananas, pineapple, white grapes . . taste is dried fruit, bubble gum, bananas . . strange sweet under-lying flavor . . leaves a GREAT finish . . i enjoyed this . .

Organic version in 500mL bottle.  Unsure how this differs from non-organic version.  Pours  with huge, foramy white head, looks delicious. Dark amber/golden color with lots of bubbles.  Bannana and vanilla notes in the smell and hearty wheaty and yeasty tones are present as well.   Tastes of yeasty, bready flavors but there are subtle hints of spice and citrus zest too.  But in the end the flavor is a little muted. There is a little bit of a warming effect from the alcohol.  The body is not heavy or too lilght, and a good balance and mouthfeel for the style.  Overall a pretty good beer, and good for a hot day.
Nice thick head, good aroma.  Fruity taste with slight bitterness.  Best german wheat I have had in a while.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a nice thick white head.  The aroma is of wheat, some clove, and citrus fruits.  The taste is sweet with some malts in there follwed by the citrus fruits.  The orange and banana flavors come through and are very good.  Has a nice mouthfeel and a real smooth finish.  A great hefeweizen.
Robe blonde paille voilée surmontée dune mousse blanche épaisse qui persiste. Arômes de bananes et de levures. Saveurs de bananes, de citron, de blé et de levures. Texture crémeuse.

Bottle. aroma of malt, citrus, yeast, vinager. Taste of vinager, malt. yeast. The hefe definately set the tone for this beer. Great blend of hefe malt and hallentauer hops. Bit of a vinious edge. Quick finish. Disappointed that this beer did not keep its head longer and have a longer finish. Still, very refreshing and good. i would drink  this one again.

This had a very malt dominated aroma.The taste was also dominated by malt.Tasted more like a Bock style than a wheat.Not a bad drink,though.I was just expecting a wheat style beer.Flavor has a somewhat biting ,spicy,twisted malt wheat flavor.Palate was average.Kind of flat finish.It finished like you were wanting something more and were let down.Still better than most beers.There are several wheat beers that are much better than this.
In bottle at Palmer Place in LaGrange IL.  A decent hefe-- all the traditional flavor.  It just felt like a weaker version of the Schneider Original Weiss, which is an outstanding hefe.

Bu au Mondial 07. Blonde brumeuse un peu foncée, pas de collet. Arome plaisant de blé crèmeuse, un peu de banane et quelque petits fruits. Goût de blé et de banane crèmeuses avec quelques épices doux.

Pours a lightly cloudy copper wit ha fluffy white head. Bananas, wheat, and yeast present in the nose. Flavor is a robust and strong hefe, bananas with a dash of cloves. Sharp carbonation and a nice alcohol warmth. Full mouthfeel and that Scheider smoothness similar to that found in Aventinus. Excellent hefe.
Complex, spicy nose with hints of banana.  Flavor doesnt back up the complexity.  Its smooth but not as flavorful as the aroma promises.
cloudy brownish golden color.  Aromas of ripe bananas.  The flavor is quite nice, with sweet malt and banana.  A respectable Heffeweizen...
Organic version.  Pours light amber. Spicy cinnamon banana flavor.  Very good.  My fourth Schneider and Ive enjoyed them all.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2007 500 ml bottle (organic version). Cloudy apple cider-honey color with huge fizzy head that quickly settles into a nice small cream. Excellent spicy-yeasty, banana, and mildly peppery nose. Flavor is similar with some wheat and slight bubblegum taste added, balanced nicely by a very small taste of alcohol and tart and spicy yeast. Palate is a little more than light, and is tingly-dry and refreshing.
16.9 oz. bottle at Zenos, Penn State.  Pours hazy orange with thin white head.  Plenty of banana and spice in the flavor.
Lots of flavor and a great spicy finish.  A well balanced and overall great hefe.  Would love to try on draft.
20 oz... it completes me... love the flavor, love the color, love the pour, love the grain... great!

Unassuming, but authentic Bavarian hefe nose - mild clove with banana-nut-bread yeastiness prominent in nose.  Murky gold, with disappointing soapy cream head that faded very quickly.  Yeast and wheat give clove & very mild banana mix with weak mealiness- as per style.   Sharp wheat acidity seems to meld with fruit notes of banana and yeast esters -  works with the ingredients and style

Im all excited because this one is a truly organic beer - yea!  It sure looks delicious and meaty, with his heavily clody, yeasty, dark yellow-hue, with some majoryeast-floaties.  The aroma is quite spicy, and full of wheat.  On eo fthe best Ive had.  Not too much citrus, and the spices/wheat are well balanced with a honey-filled, malty sweetness.

Ive been on an organic food kick lately, so I finally picked this up - cloudy golden/orange pour, with a large, well-sustained, foamy head - semi-biscuity, gingerbread-like aroma, with clove and other spices - light tartness up front, followed very quickly by the expected banana and clove flavors, along with slight phenolics/band-aid flavors (but not enough to detract from the enjoyment) - a hint of smokiness through the middle - hints of vanilla, perfume/floral notes, wheat and other grains near the end - a well-balanced, flavorful hefe.

Bottle Yellow pour with lots of bubbles and a thick white micro bubble head that died quickly, no lacing. Light citrus and wheat aroma with some spices. Bit of banana and clove in the finish. Pretty good but semi-average hefe.
