Draft. Hazy amber beer with a big off-white head. Light wheat and spice aroma. Spice and wheat flavor with a bit of fruitiness and floral tones. Medium body - lingering spice/wheat.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2007 16.9 oz bottle into a wine glass.  Pours a very hazy and cloudy amber orange color with a bit of yeast sediment at the bottom of the glass.  Aroma is very yeasty and banana filled.  The flavor is exactly what a hefeweizen should be.  A nice and light banana flavor coated in clove spice, with a nice yeast kick towards the finish.  It ends in another clove spice kick.  Fairly carbonated.  This is by far one of my favorite hefeweizens!

(Bottle) Organic beer blind tasting at Brouwerss in Seattle, March 3, 2007. Coating of foamy white atop a peppery, sediment-filled deep clouded amber body. Nose of sweet banana esters, nail polish and vanilla. Flavour is tart with undertones of banana. Milky finish.

Rather clear with just a touch of haze.  Very fizzy head fizzed to nothing very quickly.  Aromas were very matly, some spice, light fruit.  Touch of banana.  Banana in the flavor as well, with a definite wheat twang.  More strong malt with some breadiness in there.  Average.
Pours a slighlty hazy golden with a white head.  The aroma has a strong spice and fruit element.  The flavor is ligjhly fruity with spice and a slight tartness.
bottle.  golden/copper pour with white head and a lot of carbonation.  suprisingly strong aroma of yeast, banana and citrus.  mouth is creamy and taste follows the aroma.  a bit of spice.  eh

Another nice german hefe. Aroma is semisweet. Appeanace is light cloudy brown. Mouthfeel is smooth with a little malty aftertaste. Flavor is fair with a nice texture. Its basically an average beer, well produced.

My first orgainic beer.  Id never intentionallly purchase an organic beer but this is my third beer by Schneider&Sohn and I knew there was no chance theyd make a bad beer.  It didnt disappoint but Id choose the regular weiss or the aventinus over this anyday

Pours a foggy gold and amber with a thin white head.  Aroma is heavy nutmeg, cinnamon, and cloves with banana esters, light citrus, and pineapple.  Taste holds true with the aroma but with a lower dose of the spices, the banana, and other fruits mesh well and come out very well.

Pours a cloudy gold with a big fluffy white head.  Smells of wheat, nutmeg, clove, and citrus.  I love the flavor in this beer.  It has alot of sweet nutmeg (almost tastes like root beer) and clove in the taste which is different then alot of wheat beers Ive had.  At the en you get the orange citrus which blends nicely together.  I think this is my favorite hefeweizen.  Its killer.

Aroma of citrus with some spicy notes. Bubbly head with good lacing. Very effervescent.  Solid mouth feel with the same spicy and citrus qualities. Some banana and yeast as well. A little sweet like honey. Good beer! Very refreshing.
Has the apparent look and feel of a German-Hefe. Its got the taste of Banana and cloves. The taste is a tad watery. Otherwise its very drinkable.
Pours a nice cloudy amber color without much of a head to it.  Still nicely carbonated and refreshing.  Strong aroma coincides with the complex flavors of malt and bananas.  Thoroughly enjoyable.

This is my favorite hefeweizen... I dont love the style, but this beer is a delight to drink.  The pour is cloudy and yellow with a fizzy head that disappears quickly.  The flavors include fresh bananas, bread, pepper, alcohol, and a hint of citrus.  The fruit and spice go great with the light body and high carbonation.   This will go well with the onion and avocado pizza that just came out of the oven.  This is the perfect representation of the style IMHO.

Pours a hazy pale yellow, with a very thick two inch head that was very slow to fade to a thick cap, leaving behind a dense sheeting of lace.

Smell; a very solid grainy wheat bread profile dominates, with hints of bananas, lemon zest and cloves.

Tase; for the most part the flavor follows the aroma, with lemon peel, bananas, cloves, with a fairly pleasant bread dough wheat backbone. Theres some hints of a sweet malts, with just a bit of hop bitterness to offset the sweetness. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied like most hefes, and pretty darn easy to drink.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text: As a fan of hefeweizens I can say that this is one of the best Ive had.  Pours a cloudy gold color with a medium white head.  Smells of fruit and wheat, and tastes of yeast, banana and spices.  Great hefeweizen.

Bottle pours golden slightly cloudy with a short white head.  Aromas of cloves bannana and a little yeast.  Flavor is bannana, yeast, cloves, and other typical hefe flavors.  Palate is soft pretty airy and easy to drink.  Not bad...
Bottle. Pours a big head and cloudy pale body. Aroma is of cloves, bananas and yeast. Flavor is a little soft but good. Bananas and spices first in the taste but disappears quick.
Pours a hazy amber into a weizen.  White micro head quickly subsides to skim rim.  Banana and clove aromas.  Crisp clove with a medium lasting nutmeg finish.

500ml bottle serving it chilled in a wiezen glass. Very nice aroma; bubblegum, apple, banana and clove. Pours a hazy gold body with a bit of dying white foam and plenty of floaties. Creamy palate full of sweet candy apple and tropical fruit flavours with a good touch of clove and spice towards the finish. I really like this one.

hazy golden with tall white head, this product has a nice spicy aroma, which translates nicely into the flavor. Carbonation is vigorous, and combined with the spice burns my tongue a bit.  Not bad at $2.49/500ml
Aroma is bready and malty.Pours a hazy yellow with not much head.Lots of yeast in the taste with a little spice as well.Medium mouthfeel with a fruity and bready finish.

Not a bad beer.  Tasted just like the normal hefeweizen, but had something else going on.  There was a flavor that I could only describe as floral.  It gave the beer an odd taste that I did not particularly care for, but it is by no means bad at all.
UPDATED: NOV 26, 2006 Pours a hazy gold color. Smells of banana and clove with some sweet malt.  Taste is the much the same however there is some peculiar tang that didnt fit the style.

(500 ml bottle from <A HREF=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/maine/wells/tul target=blank>Tullys) Typical hefe taste with a nice texture...Pours lightly cloudy gold-yellow with a very tall off-white head. Aroma of wheat malt, citrus and yeast. Mouthfeel is quite smooth and elegant. Flavor is pretty much same as aroma - citrus, wheat and yeast. Has a slightly sourish tang. Nice hefe if not the most immensely flavorful.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2007 Bottle.  Pale, lemon golden hue.  Foamy, micro, bubble foam.  Grainy, wheaty, in aroma with hints of lemon, lime, and citrus.  Similar notes in taste that disappears quickly, leaving a bread-like after-burn.

Two 500 mL bottles enjoy with my brother.  Pours deep golden-orangy, and of course, murky.  Moderate, sl. off-white head.  Nose:  spicy, yeasty, doughy, clove (almost peppery), with hints of fruits and squash and maybe tomato vine or something green.  Med. full mouthfeel and fairly intense carbonation.  Malty and yeasty in the mouth with a short aftertaste and very sl. bitterness.  Tasty!
Sampled at Issac Newtons with Stegosaurus and Beerded_one. Golden pour with hints of wheat and spice. A little thin in body for my taste but not bad.
not bad nice clove bubble gum aroma. pours dark copper. taste a bit irony maybe. but for an organic weisse not too shabby. not as good as tschneiders others

Sample from a bottle at Binnys "Fall Festival of BEERS." Nice clovey, and to a lesser extent cardamon-y, Weiss. Surpsising, as I usually dont like these. Good clove on both nose and palate. Pours thick, golden.

Bottle sample at Union Beer Trade Tasting, NYC. Hazy golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is an interesting combo of typical weisse notes and a sharp, tandy hoppiness. Nice body and mouthfell. Flavours are well-integrated, with the pronounced hops melding nicely with the lemon and banana weisse flavours. Pretty nice stuff.

label reads "schneiders organic wiesen edel-weisse".  slightly hazy orange gold with no head.  banana, and caramel aroma.  flavor is sweet and fruity with mostly banana standing out.  some spices and hops too.  light body.

Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow/orange, with a medium sized white head. Aroma is banana, bread, light citrusy notes, clove, and a bubblegum sweetness. Flavor is banana, spice, the sweet bublegum-like note, and bread. The high carbonation takes away from the flavor though.

From a 500 ml. euro brown bottle with a coded freshness date on the back label. Poured like you would with any hefe weizen, swirling the yeast in the bottle.

Poured a cloudy amberish dull orange with a foamy white head that settled into a thin lacing.

Aromas of wheat breadiness and lemon, spicy clove with a little nuttiness and very estery.

Moderate carbonation and a malty crisp, creamy smooth medium bodied mouthfeel.

The clove spiciness is the first thing I noticed in the taste with a dry pepperiness to it, sour bready malts meshed a with nuttiness from the yeast, a nice lemon fruitiness towards the end where you start feeling alcohol warmth as well, and a sour wheat malty finish.

Classic hazy yellow pour with tiny ring of a white head. Aroma is assertive with sweet malts, wheat and yeast. Flavor starts off with sweet malts, banana and some yeast spiciness. Then the wheat flavor takes over briefly. Flavor ends mild and somewhat sweet. Nice brew.

Pours slightyl hazed, dirty pale yellow w/ a medum spritzy froth. Aroma of sweet malt w/ a slight tartness. Light to medium nectar w/ ample residual effers. Flavors are very malty w/ a defined holiday spice. Finish has a nice crisp bittering w/ spice. Complex. Tastes better as it warms. Overall: an enjoyable specimen with a spicey character.
Dark golden body with a heavy white head.  Wheat and yeast dominate the aroma.  Light citrus with yeast accents, some fruit in the taste.  A yeasty ending.
Very slightly hazy light amber body with a small of-white head. Sweet light banana and honey aroma. Sweet banana flavor, some orange peel hints, and a touch of spice.

Bottle.  Tons and tons of visible sediment in the cloudy golden-orange pour.  Over-carbonated.  Strong aroma of citrus over wheat, clove, hops, and yeast.  Really a big nose.  Alarmingly crisp taste from all the carbonation, citrus and wheat are the strongest notes.  Body still seems light, though, visually, it might be the opaquest Weisse Ive seen.  Light acidity and light sweetness.  Theres a note somewhere between yeast and bread dough, and one of vanilla.  I prefer the "normal" Weisse from Schneider to its "bigger" cousin, though this offering isnt without its own charm - as it warms, it becomes downright tasty!

500 ML Bottle. Sweet start with a lemony finish, light body, lots of citrus.  Very good.  Really enjoyed the citrus finish instead of a bitter finish like a lot of Hefes.  Could drink a lot of these in the summer. Would have liked a little more body and head but good nonetheless.

hazy light orange.  Small quickly diminishing head. aroma is light banana, citrus and spices.  Taste is of mainly, citrus, spices, and bready/earthy yeast, with a bit of banana on the back of the palate. Refreshing smooth finish.

Bottle. Poured a darker yellow/tan, leaning to a dunkelweizen color with a tan head. Scents of yeast and banana.  Lots of citrus, muting the banana sweetness.  Thinner mouthfeel than anticipated.  This improved as it warmed,  but still an unusual spin on a hefeweizen. Thanks to Secret Santa (July) for the bottle.

This was hard to rate, certainly a unique extreme to the style, but a bit overdone. Pour was hazy straw-amber color, huge dome-like head in the 0.5L weizen glass. Lacing was weak. Aroma was cloves, pepper, and spices first and bananas second. Flavor was tons of phenolic spices (cloves and peppers strongest) over rich and sweet bananas, some yeast, some citrus, and a zingy finish (hops interaction with the spices?). Mouthfeel was full for the style, a little too rich/cloying for a hefe, but at 6.2%, I guess thats what they intended. A cool beer, but not a good regular - a sipper.

Cloudy yellowish-brown, with slight shows of green around the edges; lots of particulates; disappearing head.  Medium clove, honey, and wheat in the nose, with touches of lemon.  Less engaging than Schneider Weisse Original in appearance.  Fresh hops, plenty of banana; candy sugar on a medium finish.  Enjoyable hefeweizen, though Id prefer its big brother (sister?).
Hmm, it is 102 Farenheit here, and this may make me rethink my anti-hefe bend. Yeasty but refreshing, with muted banana and finishes crisp.

Bottle shared with and courtesy of Jerc on a  very hot day in his back yard!  Dark hazy yellow, streaming bubbles, small white head.  Very yeasty taste - quenching citrus as well.  Mild citrus and yeast aroma.  Dry.  Very tasty, and excellent beer for the day!

Organic. Bottled. Hazy pastel orange witha  good sized white head. Quite yeasty with notes of sweet malt and a tart wheaty character (7+).  Solid weisse, bit fuity with a yeasty character throughout with minute hints of banana and wheat bite. Medium palate. (3+) Very nice on a warm day in the backyard!

Hazy golden color, compact head, vanished quickly leaving a thin rim. Very fruity and a little herbal: aroma of banana, apple, hay wheat and yeast. I find the yeast imparts an herbal freshness that is very enticing, doesnt have the clove aroma. Flavor is sweet and sour and finishes a little bitter (more bitter than other hefeweizen Ive had).  The palate is watery and finishes chalky. Overall, it is enjoyable and refreshing, not my favorite hefeweizen but an interesting example, distinctive.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2006 Poured an orange/amber hazy color.  Aromas of wheat, malt, citrus, slight banana and spice elements.  Coarse, bubbly head faded quickly, leaving nothing behind other than a single stream of bubbles emanating from the yeast collected at the bottom of the glass.  I was surprised when this single stream of bubbles eventually created an additional "secondary" head through the slow accumulation of bubbles.  This was quite odd--Ive never seen anything like it before.  This "secondary head" was made up of ultra-fine bubbles and it lasted throughout the life of the beer.  The flavors were predominantly on the wheat/yeast end of the spectrum.  Less of the fruity/citrusy/spicy flavors.  There was actually even a slight (very slight) hoppiness to the brew.  I enjoyed this beer thoroughly, as I do with most German Hefeweizens.  Id drink it again and again.  And its organic, thats a bonus in my book.

somewhat dark golden color with not a lot of haziness.  Strong bana and cloe flavors, with a hint of citrus.  More bitter than a noraml hefe, but with a very nice flavor.  Very good balance, one of my favorite hefes.

16.9oz, no date.  Pours a hazy light golden with a moderate, fizzy white head.  Aromas of the typical banana and clove, with some added grapefruit thanks to the cascades, though it isnt very strong.  Somewhat tangy, fizzy carbonation with a little more bitterness than what I usually get with a hefe.  The carbonation is just a little to sharp and detracts from the flavors.  After about five mins. of agitating the hell out of this, I only get a little pepper and more wheat.    An above average hefe, in my opinion (and ave. for me isnt 2.5).
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Pale yellow appearance  no head- nose yeast, sour, green apples, and cinnamon  grain apples sour/sweet, dried fruit taste  clean light palate- aftertaste clean green apple
On tap.  Pours a very hazy bright golden color with a big fluffy white head.  Aroma is yeasty and sweet.  Taste is yeasty, with wheat, banana, and sweet lemon citrus.  Very good hefe.
Nose of wheaty bananas with a citrus note; hazy goldenbody with a small, quickly disapating white head; flavor of sweet, spicy, fruity wheat with a nice hoppy finish. Great hefe!
"what a good beer. Poured a nice hazy yellow with nice head and good lacing Aroma was yeasty and bready some citrus to it. FLavor was much the same with banana and cloves in there. Nice solid beer. "

Bottle. Poured an amber color with an average frothy white head that mostly diminished with fair lacing. Moderate sour citrus clove aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture. Medium sweet flavor with a small bitter finish of moderate duration. Drinkable but not my style.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2011 In short: A classic german hefe
How: Bottle 500ml, consumed relatively fresh the day of purchase (as fresh as it can be in North-America)
The look: Cloudy yellow-orange body topped by a persistent small white head
In long: Nose is typical hefe-yeast bananas with spicy notes of cloves and ginger.  Taste is very crisp, plenty of wheat, sun dried yellowed hay, dry staws, fresh bananas, cloves, ginger.  Carbonation is very active.  Compared to the German big top-3 most distributed quality examples of the style (Franziskaner Hefe-Weissbier, Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier, Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier) Id say that this one is more on the spicy side.  Another good one from the Weissbierbrauerei brewery, Im glad the town of Kelheim ended-up on the right side of the wall.

500 ml bottle.  The hefeiest of hefewiezens Ive ever seen.  Thick, opaque, milkshake appearance, orange/golden with a thick white head.  Very sweet aroma of banana, light clove as well.  Some lemony citrus notes as well.  Flavour is quite good initially, wheaty spice and a wonderful balance of yeasty fruit and spice.  Slight citric acidity into the finish.  Late bitterness as well.  As it warms, some peppery notes seem to come forward and the balance goes a little out of whack.  Spiciness increases at the expense of the fruit.  Quite different from other hefes.

Beautiful looking beer. Stong hints of bannana and wheat. Slight hint of clove. Pour and off-amber golden yellow, and very, very fizzy. Head dissiaptes quickly from a 1-2 inch froth down to a 1/16th inch head within a minute. Almost has a "oily layer" on top. Slightly sweet a watery, but lacking bitterness. The mouthfeel is smooth and silky. Citrus tends towards an orange/apple side, when detected.

(Bottle Pour - 6/3/2006)

Aroma:Wheat aroma all the way,banana...
Appearance:Very hazy gold,light head....
Flavor:good wheat flavor,banana...

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2006 Bottle sampled with Stegosaurus. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus and yeast. Flavor is citrus, banana, and a little off, maybe a bad bottle. Rerate, much better perhaps it was a bad bottle, or a change in my palate first rate 3.2 now 3.4

This is one excellent summertime beer. If it was available more often, this might just be in my hand every summer. Nice yeasty nose with heavy cloves, some bananna and a bit phenolic. Appearance was a hazy yellow color with little head. Mouthfeel was EXTREMELY soft, very subtle. Flavors were clovish, bready, bananna, and some grain. Not filling in the lease, this is one of the best hefes Ive tried in sometime now. OUTSTANDING!

App: Hazy gold/bronze. Foamy, fizzy white head. Nose: wheat, grains, incense, flowery hops, light fruits, touch of bready yeast. Flavor: same plus cloves and spiciness. Palate: medium, well carbonated. Ovr: crisp, refreshing hefeweizen. Excellent.

Bottle (500ml).  Sunny day, summers on the way, time for a efe.  Poured very bubbly cloudy yellow (hint of orange to it), with a huge - huge - lasting foamy white head, drapes of lacing eventually left behind.  Spicy/yeasty aroma of lemon, banana/apple/pear, some wheat, quite sweetly malty, almost candyish.  Taste is also yeasty and peppery, more tart lemon and less sweetness all around - quick finish but a tart, lightly metallic aftertaste.  Thinnish body, astringent and nicely carbonated - pretty decent Hefe, slightly artificial around the edges.

Gorgeous!  Hazy pale amber with a HUGE meringue soapy head that vanishes leaving a clear glass.  Uninteresting nose.  Taste of wheat and rye bread, lemony citrus, but I dont get any of the hoppy / clove / banana that I would have found in an Aventinus, with a surprising skunky finish.  Average mouth.

Pours a cloudy golden body with a good amount of small floaties. Nice big bubbly white head. Grassy, lemon aroma. Full bodied wheat flavor with real good bannana hints. Good sweet clove finish. Enjoyable hefeweizen.
Has a cloudy orange appearance.  Flavor is lightly sweet with spices (cloves and coriander)   Very Wheaty.  There is a lot of carbonation -  Overall: a good beer.
Pours a bright yelow. with a distinctly floral aroma and high, white head. Tastewise, its yeasty and doughy, with a lasting honey-floral palate. Its a good beer.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2006 Bottle sampled with Beerded_one. Pours hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus, and musty yeast. Flavor is carbonated, slight banana maybe, not a bad brew, i prefer most of the others i drank from this brewery.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2007 Well, i wondered, but i guess there are some differences between this and the normal schneider weiss.  This one is USDA organic for one, the other is not.  This is gold in color and has a pretty huge bubble gum aroma.  I think this one is lighter in body and more fruity.  Crisper and more refreshing.  This is a damn good beer and I think more close to a normal german hefe. I think this is pretty darn good and 6.2% to boot.  Highly recommended.  Everytime I have this I like it more and more.  rerate. the smell of wheat is overwhelming in this.  it smells exactly like this bag of flour tortillas im holding.

a cloudy dark yellow liquid with a bubbly white head.  musty nose of bananas, yeast and spice.  German bavarian yeast flavors pitch up front with a sweetness of banana esters.  some suble spices and citrus flavors.  a light beer, suppose this makes since for a weisse.  easy drinkn for the summer time.
Cloudy golden color with a big fluffy white head. Big aroma of banana, spice and some floral. Flavor is right in check with the aroma, banana, spice clean finish. Very plesant, quenching beer.

The aroma is sweet, spicy, and fruity with the requisite banana and coriander. It also has a little incense. The appearance is a perfect cloudy gold with a large foamy head. The flavor is malty with all the elements of the aroma. The palate is thinner than expected. Overall this is a classic must try for everyone.
Bottle: Good example of a Hefeweizen, well balanced with wheat and sweetness, enjoyable to the last sip.

500ml brown bottle. Poured a hazy dark gold with no head. Big clove aroma and flavor, also banana. Light to medium body. slight hop bitteness and big wheat flavor. Effervescent mouthfeel. slightly sweet flavor balance. Not as crisp and clean as other Schneider wheat brews.

500ml. bottle. Hazy light golden color with a medium sized white head that dissipated quickly. Aroma of bananas, cloves, bubblegum. The flavor was yeasty, fruity with some citrus and cloves along with the banana. Not a great example of the style.

Light copper pour with a thin white head.  The aroma is very shallow...cloves, bananas and some citrus...kind of musty.  Small bits of sediment floaties.  Flavor is fresh and citrusy with some cloves and  grassy.  Not one of the best weizens Ive had.    The aftertaste urks me...very similar to hydrogen peroxide...lingers a little long and wrong on the back of my throat.

500ml bottle and its organic!  Filled to the brim of my trusty Duvel glass.  Two fingers of white head sit atop a murky, hazy brew, with an apricot, pink grapefruit hue.  Pinkinsh at the core, but yellow and dull around the edges.  Strong and layered nose.  Hints of flowers, bananas, cloves, bubblegum, slight cedar, straw, citrus zest.  Playful on the palate.  Definitely not too heavy or overly sedimented.  Lively and zesty with citrus notes popping out. Typical Hefe flavors, bananas and cloves, but so much more.  Dry bitter pine hop finish.  Ever so slight alcohol burn at the back of the throat.   Vanilla and pepper.  Cloying sweetness that holds the bitter burn!  Yep, this is good.  Not the best Hefe Ive ever had, but its up there.

The beer poured out of the bottle hazy and golden brown with a lot of sedimentation ... little black flecks throughout and even huge chunks toward the end.  It smells like lime and brown sugar, with some hints of spice.  The taste is sweet with tepid citrus notes, sort of like a beer mixed with flat diet sprite.  The ABV (which is rather high for a Weisse beer) comes through in the finish, so you can taste the alcohol a little bit.

Considering how much I enjoy some of Schneiders other brews, Im really surprised how awful this one is.  Im not altogether certain what style the Edel-Weisse is meant to emulate.  Perhaps I got a bad bottle?
Soft palate, clovelike with citrus overtones. I was a bit frightened at the sour lime smell coming out, but the flavors were well balanced. It was an excellent beer.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2006 In the 0.5L bottle at the Huber Haus. Pours a cloudy brownish gold color. Actually, it is so opaque that it resembles something in which one might grow Tetrahymena. Nice white poofy head dies out toward the end of the beer, but starts out impressive. Incredible aroma of cloves and banana esters. But mostly cloves. I mean, its like you shoved some cloves up your nostrils. The beer becomes donimantly sweet tasting at the end, but that may be from the spice fatigue your palate earns about halfway through. I think this just might be an under-rated beer. UPDATE 4/11/6: Toasted caramel aroma, slight medicine flavor. This one stands out when poured side by side with a dozen others at a tasting.

03 December 2005.  
Schneider Wiesen Edel-Weisse.  
Bottle.  
The first thing about this beer that *really* stands out is the lack of head for a weisse.  Ive poured it into my tall wheat glass; this glass has plenty of head space for wheat beers, and I almost always need it since theyre usually so expansive.  But this one had large, clear-ish bubbles that quickly and loudly (ok, relatively loudly) popped, leaving nothing but a thin layer of white on the surface.  
The flavors are pretty classic, though: bubble-gum, a little clove, fruity yeast esters.  This could be the kid-sister of the Aventinus  good, promising, but lighter all around (and not world-class).  
I wish I were tasting this side by side with the regular Schneider Weisse; itd be interesting to see what the Edel- (and organic) adds, as it were

Bottle. Pours a crystalline light honey color with white head. The aroma is strong yeast, some citrus zest, grain, and banana. The flavor, though, isnt quite as assertive as the aroma. Its very grainy with some yeast and citrus. Ok, but not great.

My bottle stated that it was a BIO beer(Organic) thats always a plus. I was suprised how much color was lacking in this beer, but I dont think theres filtering. Taste was great, and smooth, very fruity, and a bit of sourness. Very nice, Id drink anytime!

1 pint bottle poured in weizen glass.  When I opened the bottle I was greeted with a wonderful aroma of yeast and lime.  It pours nicely with a thin creamy head.  My glass was opaque so I cant really see the coloration.  It had an excellent weizen taste with a bit of lime.  It had a nice dry finish and a bit of tartness on the back edges of the tongue.  This is a really good beer.

Pours an expected hefeweizen brown cloud with little yeast residue at the bottom. Medium carbonation offers a bountiful nose that accentuates the best in wheat aromas of banana, light nut aroma, and clove. Mouthfeel is a little light, as is the body. Flavor is incredibly smooth and lightly sweet with nothing new from the aroma. A very drinkable hefeweizen that is one of the best of the widely accesible German offerings.
I cant say enough about this one, just makes me happy to drink. I enjoy it all year round.

A truly attractive beer, it is honey gold one monent and an orange color the next.  First taste was quite bitter and that was a surprise but the hefe flavors quickly settled in.  What a super beer!  Quite dry for a hefe but lots of personality make for a delightful bottle of beer.

this brew has somthing to do with being the  "origional" or "lost" recipe or somthing like that ( not really sure of the whole story ) regardless it is pretty tasty. the usuall banana, clove, citrus elements are present but a nice aroma of citrus blossoms and banana are really noticable. not as consistant as the "origional" but still nice and worth a pour.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2009 Poured a deep yellow with rich orange flowing through (happens when the beer is charged properly)  A light head that disappated quickely.  The driest, and least sweet of the wheats I had this day.  Would make an excellent spring/summer beer.

Bubbles continually emerge from the bottom of the glass only to quickly dissipate once contact with the surface is made.  A casual glance into the brew reveals only murky orange colors that seem to catch the light differently from one another.  Like a mood ring the colors shift from gold to light amber to a restless brown, to a deep orange . The taste and smell also does not dissapoint.  The  baker uses clove and vanilla to sweaten his bananna bread.

Aroma is mostly over ripe banana with some malted wheat earthiness in the background.  The short-lived creamy head offsets the prickly mouthfeel.  More clovey banana in the body, as well as cookie, lemon and vanilla.  This Hefe wraps up nicely with a smooth, wheat enhanced finish.  This may be reaching the end of its shelf life, as some sourness appears as well.
A slightly more interesting, citrusier, flowerier version of their original Heffeweizen.  An improvement.  Kudos.

Poured a slightly dark orangey body into its official weizen glass. Big banana aroma. A little bit of citrus in there as well. Flavor is the same, uninteresting. Not nearly as good as the other German Hefe I had today. Still, it was nice.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2007 Cloudy orange with no head, and therefore no lacing. Some nice tiny bubbles cruising their way to the top of the glass redeem it for a passing mark on the appearance, though. Banana based aroma, of course, with some bugglegum and peppery spice. Delicious refreshing flavour the ensures the beer slides down with the greatest of ease. Slightly bitter and well balanced, it is very sessionable (is that a word?). Medium bodied with a warming alcohol glow, this a good one.Re-rate: Poured with a big head that hung around a little while then disappeared to nothing. Sort of milky aroma, and probably has the strongest clove notes of any beer Ive had. Still one of my most favourite hefes. Go organic!!
Really delicious brew. Lots of lemon zest, spices and banana, with a slight bubblegum sweetness. I was pleasantly surprised with this one.

Light yellow with no head at all.  Grassy aroma with a hint of honey.  Light body.  Flavor mirrors the aroma a lot...grassy notes, mostly, with a touch of honey sweetness and a bit of bitterness coming in at the end.  Definitely more of a session beer for me.

Bottle.  Sour wheat aroma with hint of banana.   Golden yellow-orange color - cloudy with decent head.  Nicely blended sweet banana-wheat flavor mixed with sourness - hint of cherries in the finish.   Very nice - one of the best especially if you like less sweet Weizens.  Superbly crafted Weizen.

(500 ml bottle: $2.89 at Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, CA) You know, I wasnt all that fond of the highly-regarded Schneider Weisse Original, so I wasnt expecting much out of this beer either, but this beer is outstanding.  Malty, very bready, fairly sweet, and spicy, wow, a whole lot of clove in here and quite a bit of banana too.  Damn, this is delicious.  Im totally digging the clove finish.  Cloves play a huge role in the nose as well, with aromas of banana and a bready maltiness solidly in the mix as well.  Medium-full bodied, not sticky per se, but getting there, but the spices and good carbonation really help to keep this beer lively on the palate.  Golden in color, and somewhat cloudy, but because I swirled the bottle like crazy to break up the sludge, the beers final pour is fully cloudy.  The off-white head pours on the small side, and unfortunately, doesnt stick around for long.  But thats a minor issue to me.  I bow to this fantastic beer.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2007 I was pleasantly surprised by this beer.  It has a malty flavor with strong yeast characteristics.  Banana and bread overtones are definately present.  A nice cloudy beer with a good head. If you like Hefe-wiesens, you will definately like this.

Pour is a cloudy yellow with a white head.  Aroma is a nice mix of yeasty breadyness and cloves.  Flavor is above average with lots of sugar and spicies.  Very tasty and prob one of the better hefes out there.

Pours a deep, dark gold and very cloudy. Abundant bubbles make for a very large, white head. Something about the fermentation process of this brewery makes for some of the most consistently carbonated beers around. Smell is present, without being overpowering, of sugars, banana, clove, canned corn, bubble gum, and a tad of allspice. Nice yeastiness to flavor. Fruit/banana malt cling to the tongue and leave a nice strong flavor of banana, corn and clove. Really delicious how all of this comes together. Fine beer by a fine brewery. Purchased at Whole Foods in Vienna, VA. Also, of note, is that my bottle label has "organic" printed on the top left, and the sample label on this page does not.

Clear-amber to start, then hugely murky when those last bits dropped in. A creamy dollop of a head. Chalky-dry aromas were spiced apple, banana, clove and smoke. Flavor was woodsy and dirty, lightly bittersweet. A little thin with a chalky ending and clove in the finish flavor which was rather nice. Somewhat mysterious but thoroughly enjoyable.
<font size=-4>A perk of working for a <a href=http://www.workinlate.com/bier.html>mag that occasionally runs beer reviews :)<font size=-1>
Cloudy lemon yellow pour.  Orange, clove, banana are all present in the taste.  Mildly bitter palate.  Good Hefeweizen.  Crisp and clean.  Good hot summer day beer.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2006 Poured a hazy pale yellow.  Very light body.  Notes of bazooka joe and oranges.  Just a touch of spice. 7/3/7/3/14......

7//6/06: Lightly hazed dark yellow.  Aroma if citrus, caramel and lemon.  Acidic, caramel and lemon flavor with notes of honey.

Pours a hazy gold with a thin ivory head. No lace. Smells of banana and lemon. Light hints of clove.

Taste is spicy and lemony. Hints of banana. Sweet wheat malt. Mouth is crisp but a bit thin. Certainly drinkable but nothing special as far as hefes go.
Cloudy, typical wheaty appearance.  Im not sure that I picked up on the banana that everyone else seems to sense.

Held onto a bottle of this for quite some time (for reasons unknown) and decided it might be time to taste it. I became a little hesitant when I cracked it as it failed to pssshhhrt! Poured it into an Aventinus glass, it was relatively lifeless, raising only a thin white pad of foam, that managed to last the length. The body of beer a clean hazy gold with only the lightest amount of fine carbonation popping to the surface.  Subtle spicy and grainy nose, sweet bubblegum and overly ripe bananas with a little note of tangy fruit. The aroma was quite pleasant but lacked the oomph of a good hefe, as did the flavour. Thin, watery body, light and spritzy in carbonation, it had an odd plastic feel mid-palate and a light lactic and gluggy feel in the back of the mouth, before finishing off with a short herbal and sweet swallow. Flavours were subtle with only a little of the normal bubblegum and clove-like phenols and fruity esters associated with a good example of the style. A little disappointed as I thought this may top the Weihenstephan and Spaten offerings, but it just lacked in all aspects. May be the higher alcohol content to blame for its lack of body and flavour. Still, a balanced and clean hefe-weizen that was easily quaffable.

Hazy yellow gold, moderate head, no lace, brown yeast sediment. Citrus oil, sweet spice (not clove exactly, but that sort of thing), and honey aromas. Sweet, wheat, a little yeasty, sweet spice, a bit fizzy on the carbonation. Overall a good weizen.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle.  Poured a nice cloudy yellow.  Very small head that did not last very long, no lacing.  Plenty of carbonation, and a little more thin and watery then some other hefes.  Overall, pretty good, but I would choose plenty of other hefes before this one.
Most enjoyable wheat ever, maybe?  Smooth and without a tinny aftertaste.  Beautiful.
Bottle, cloudy yellow pour.  Aromas and flavors of bananas, cloves, some slight spices, and bubblegum and vanilla.  Enjoyable.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2006 The first couple times I had this I really enjoyed it, but maybe thats partly because I was so impressed by the porcelain class it was served in, and the beers that preceeded my tasting. Something just tastes a bit off to me, especially in the palate.  Dont know why I ddnt notice this before. Good, but not great. Mahrs weisse and the regular Schneider Weisse are much better.
Poured a hazy straw color.Sweet flower aroma.Citrus on the taste with sweetness.finish was quite refreshing.I really enjoyed this one.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2009 draft @ redlight redlight re-rate.  This is probably my favorite hefeweizen so i thought it derserved a re-rate.  Spicy clove with hints of cinnamon and nutmeg with traces of citrus on the nose.  Pours a cloudy golden orange with a thick white head.  Spicy yeasty upfront with cinnamon, clove, and nutmeg up front with hints of banana and finishing with citrus, very earthy and flavorful yet still very refreshing and drinkable!  


(originally rated 9-20-05) Banana fruity aroma.  Golden color.  Nice fluffy head.  Tastes very earthy, nutmeg, citrusy wheaty.  Very good!  And its Organic.  Served in Ceramic glassware at Redlight Redlight in Winter Park, Fl.

Standard hefeweizen aroma of citrus with just a bit of banana.  Disappointing appearance; a simple cloudy gold with a medium white head, but no sediment at all.  Flavor is on the sweet side for the style.  Refreshing and enjoyable.

Jan 2005 - Wheaty with a slight sweet malt aroma.  Cloudy yellow-brown colour, poor head and lacing with sediment in the bottom of the bottle. Spiritous, with light banana flavour. Light mouthfeel that lacks body.

Bottle.  A misty light golden yellow color with a foamy white head.  Strong coriander, orange peel, and banana in the aroma.  Malty (bready) and spicy flavors with some lemon.  Feels thick and syrupy in the mouth.
OK, I was non plussed by this brew.  Light in palate and less than complex.  Yes some bananna in the aroma and a bit of yeast in the taste.  Other than that there is  not much here.

A pleasant and moderate amount of all the wonderful qualities to be found in a German hefeweizen aroma like clove, banana, and yeast.  Had to give it a rough pour to create at least some layer of head because i could see the angle degree i was pouring it wasnt causing any foam.  Once poured it is a glowing yellow that is easy visible through and has a slight sediment and dust cloud. In the drink i found a slight chance of banana and bubblegum as well as clove, but it was weak and hard to find behind a watery and malt flavor. Wasnt pleased with the carbonation on this compared to the white label Scneider & Sohn orginal hefeweizen. Still a nice beer to have tried from the scientist brewers of Gemrany.

USDA Organic Variant. Hazy, good yellow color for a wheat beer. Lasting white head. A sharp yeasty malty flavor touched with a bit of sweet apple left a heavy almost clingy mouth feel which I did not appreciate.

Bottle Pours a hazy dingy yellowish color with a very slight off white head. Distinct german hef aroma.  Yeasty and of light grain. Flavor is quite sharp of the musty yeast flavor.  Lots of carbonation and a slightly hoppy mildly biter trailer.  A bit metallic at the end.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2005   Very interesting Hefeweizen.  Poured cloudy golden with a descent white head.  Good lacing.  Aroma is malty with citrus and graitfruit.  The graitfruit is too pronounced in the flavor for me.  The palate is bitter with a nice touch of alcohol.  Pretty impressive overall.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2006 Pours dark golden and clear with a mostly receding white head. Aroma is fruity with banana, apple, perhaps some citrus. Taste is sweet and yeasty, with notes of honey and wheat. Effervesecent mouthfeel.  One of my favorites hefes.
Aroma was of when you are on the combine harvesting wheat. Gold body with white head and some lacing. Sweet fruit and sipe flavor that made it little heavy on the palate for me. Alright.

Cloudy yellow with a nice white head and lacing.
Aroma is sweet malt and citrus.
Flavor of citrus and grapefruit.
Gold Coloring with White Head.  Sweet Coriander Aroma.  Light Creamy and Dry..Fruity Notes, and Light Spice - Coriander - Enjoyable.

Hazy golden color with a small white head. Aromas of yeast apple and clove. Good clean mouthfeel, not to heavy.Flavors of clove,  fruit[apple maybe], some yeast and cookie. A very drinkable wheat beer, especially on a hot spring day.

Pours a medium golden color. Yeasty aroma. A bit of an apple like smell. Rich, slightly sweet flavor. Yeasty and a little grain as well. Nice rich mouthfeel.  Some malty flavor in there as well. Quite enjoyable.

Cloudy golden color with a rapidly diminishing near white head.  Little to no carbonation.  Aromas were very thin and of light malt, citrus (mostly lemons), and wheat.  Flavor was very watered down, hardly any mouthfeel or aftertaste.  A disappointing wheat at best.
Cloudy oraneg with a white head. Fruity, citrusy, thin, watery, tart. Lots of sediment present.

Glory-god.  Apply taste.  Mild but palpable texture on tounge.  Eye-opening.  A winner.  Not a blue-ribbon, but at least a red-ribbon winner.  Certainly changed my non-beer-aficionado friends perspective on things.
Poured a cloudy yellow, and and hazy (yeast). The nose  had orange, clove wheat bread and yeast. Not my favorite  hefe, . Tasted gritty and a bit dirty.

Cloudy yellow/orange appearance. Little to no head. Sort of dirty looking too. Big enticing clove aroma. Palate / flavor is sort of dry and yeasty w/ a little banana. A solid hefe but then again Im spoiled by Live Oaks hefe; nevertheless, Im not sure Id drink this again.
tastes just like my homebrew wiesen.  banana w/ clove, the body is fruity and sweet.

Excellent German hefeweizen, not the brewers best work, but very good all the same. Poured a caramel colour with a moderate head. Nice aroma, highly alcoholic but with typical banana and wheat notes. Medium-bodied and mild in flavour, with some warming alcohol in the finish. Beautifully balanced. Some fruit, a hint of cookies and strong tea. 
(Bottle)
Disappointingly still with a 7up head that fizzled immediately and overwhelmingly sedimented.  Flat feel and chalky texture with a lemon-zesty flavor.  Bummer.

Small white head even after the bottle is "jostled" to mix the yeast. Dirty yellow. Strong lemon cookie and yeast aroma. Body is a little flat and chalky. Tastes like lemon cookies. Some zest and refreshing qualities but not as nice as expected.

From the bottle this brew pours a very cloudy orange with a medium white head. A very spicy aroma of orange peel, clove, and wheat sits above. Taste starts crisp and refreshing with a smooth orange peel fruit along with the dry wheat malts. This finishes with spicy yeast esters and a crisp hop finish.
Slightly cloudy, moderate, tight white head which does not last at all well.  Slightly sour, wit like aroma, which carries over into the flavour, but with more malt int he flavour than expected.
Bottled. Pours a typical hefe colour with a reasonable head. Aroma is about right for the style - some hint of apple as well. A well balanced hefe without being outstanding.
Malty hop aroma. Cloudy amber colour with good head that dissapears as soon as it appears. Dead flavour like drinking nothing then a hint of honey and malt. Flat palate.

Clear dark amber pour.  Small creamy head that doesnt last long.   Aroma is fruity with apple and banana notes.  Flavor is also fruity and a little tart, with an apple cider character.  Light to medium body.  Fairly good and pleasant to drink but not remarkable.
Very simple, non-showy beer... but its very smooth and drinkable. Theres nothing special about it, its not something you should seek out, but when you have one, its a refreshing change.

This beer mustve been pretty old because sediment was the name of the game during this pour. Goldeny yellow clear color aside from the million micro particles floating around in my beer. Very little fizzy soapy head which faded quickly. The aroma is cloves, banana, grapefruit, cinnamon, peppermint...heavy peppermint and a slight hint of pears. The flavor is medium to full bodied and long lasting. Pepperminty once again, with cloves, banana, grapefruits and pearish dryness. Dry malty and mildly sour finish. Good mouthfeel, full and round, sticky mouthfeel. Well rounded hefe.

Appearance: slightly cloudy and yellow-orange; tiny, fizzy head.  (Now, stick with me for a few sentences here and be sure to read this whole review, because I dont want this next part on aroma to throw you)  Smells of sour milk and yeast.  Definitely a weird smell for a hefe, but I carried on.  After tasting it, my thoughts on the strange aroma dissipated.  Unbelievably great tasting  sweet and yeasty, with predominant elements of vanilla, bananas and cloves springing up on the palate.  A full tasting weiss that doesnt cut any corners and does equal justice to all components that contribute to this beer.  Damn, this beer is great.  The best tasting beer Ive had out of all beers in the weiss category.  Too bad the marks against it in the "aroma" category bump it down a couple notches and prevent this weiss from acheiving a perfect rating.

Aroma: some apple, clove, citrus and a tiny hint of banana. Appearance: Yellow/light brown, cloudy with noticeable floculant yeast clumps. Small head. Flavour: lots of sweetness and a fair whack of clove. Palate: bubbly, medium mouthfeel and a light banana aftertaste.
Very refreshing summery beer.  I dont think this is at all remarkable, but it remains consistently clean, crisp, and refreshing.
A bit underwhelming. Maybe I drank this out of season, but this one did nothing for me. All the requisite banana/cloves/citrus was there, but it did not mesh well.

Hazy orange tinted yellow pour supporting a well defined and long lasting off white head.  Pungant earthy herbal aroma of cloves, straw and alcohol.  Initial malt flavor quickly overtaken by cloves with some fruity sweetness of banana and lemon.  Surprisingly clean finish.  I may have rated this beer a little higher if I hadnt looked forward to is as much as I did.  Overall, it was OK but a bit disappointing although Ill pour another bottle in a month or two to give it another shot.

light yellow with a cloudy character. thin white head. slightly sour grain aroma. bitter burning pepper taste that is somehow not quite right. very upfront and not much besides a lingering banana taste.

nice malty balance too this beer..  A sweet fruity taste and a yeast presence on the aroma and flavour. Very well rounded and full.  not much of a head but poured a cloudy golden-brown.  Alcohol is present but not too overpowerful.  A nice lemony finish. really smooth.

Malt, citrus hops, spice. Nice balance for its style, unique wheat. Grainly, prickly carbonation. Bittersweet lemony finish. Cloves, ginger, apple, banana. Medium mouthfeel and interesting aroma. Stronger yeast than expected from a wheat, though fruity. Alcohol warming.
Awesome is a word that comes to mind... well-balanced and just the right tang makes this one a must-try for everyone.  Germans not only make great cars; they make great beer as well.  Probst!
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Keg find... and as usual it was amazing!  Best served Ice cold and with a steak dinner to boot... Cloves and banana are the typical culprits in the drink -- just like the other Schneider products (including my alltime fave aventinus).  Light body, full colour, spicy like a typical weiss along with a slight carbonation and a citrus, tropical fruit and toffee flavour.  Another Schneider winner.

Cloves and banana in an intriguingly spicy aroma. Vanilla-mango melts into banana-nutmeg. Opaque, orange-tinged straw colour with plenty of suspended yeast and thin ring of white head. Falvour is very good, but not up to the standard set by the aroma. Strong on the cloves with underlying banana-cream pie, citrus-lemon and nutmeg. Body is somewhat lacking. A bit still in the mouth. Bottle enjoyed with MartinT, muzzlehatch and Rastacouere.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2014 Cloves and banana impersonations lure the tongue...Assertive carbonation pierces pores into the wheaty heft...Residual fruitiness comforts the senses and accompanies surprising leafy hops into a lively finish...

Clear, very pale yellow with a white ring. Huge banana onslaught in the nose! Cloves hints, lots of nutmeg, muddy, creamy pie crust. It makes me think of fruit flesh and while banana is a big part of it, its not the only one, also apples and others. On the tongue, Im immediately reminded of my nutmeg based french toast with a lemony hints. It tastes exacty like french toasts, with a banana syrup... Pretty good if not as interesting as the aroma. Rather high carbonation. The body may be the weakest link as it doesnt help holding onto the flavors and bores a bit. Better than the original to my palate, less cookie-ish and toasty, but more elegant and soft.
amber slightly murky body. it begain with a very wheaty taste, then turned sweet. the sweetness, while not strong, was almost artificial. it finishes smoothly with vanilla and rooty tastes.

This poured a slightly hazy yellow/amber with a short-lived modest white head.  The aroma is grassy with snippets of banana, orange, and some malty sweetness.  Its surprizingly carbonated, yet light-bodied.  Banana comes through in the taste along with vanilla and light hopping.  Clean finish.  Sokay.

Poured a murky dull amber with a white head that left a film on the beer.  Aroma is of normal hefe spiciness.  Taste is similar to schneider weisse though perhaps not as strong in its spiciness.  Drinkable and refreshing.

Assertive and complex aroma of yeast, citrus, banana, freshly baked cookies and vanilla. Lively peach colored look with good carbonation and a decent white head. Flavor starts sweet and heavy bodied, has yeast and bread flavors mingled with banana and clove and finishes with a little bitter bite. Very good.The label says it is made with Cascade hops. Very interesting...
This one has a great black peppery, wheaty, yeasty, bubblegum taste and aroma.  Very complex and refreshing.  Well hidden alcohol also.  Recommended highly.
Wheaty lemon, some alcohol & bubblegum.  Nicely sweet - honey, lemon, yeast, tart finish.  Quite smooth (this is an old bottle) some oakiness
Love the flavor..maybe a little spicy.  Goes down very clean.  Could drink this everyday.

Nice golden color with a few yeast particals suspended throughout the brew.Light bannana and a little bandaid aroma with a slight spice side.bandaid flavor with some bannana and spice,nice carbonation.The band aid really seems to get in the way of this brew.Could just be a bad bottle or something because ive never run into it before for this style.As it warms the bannana comes out a little better but then so does the Band aid.Ill rerate it after i get another bottle that might be better then this one.

Lots of yeast in this botle. A cloudy gold with an orange tint. Head dies quickly unlike some of my favorite Weizens. USDA Organic? Thats different. Peppery clove aroma with a slight perfume floral note. Body is medium and smooth with a creamy finish. Slight chalk from yeast sediment.Flavor is nice. Wheat malt gives a fresh flavor and a bit sweet. Clean and nice but I think I prefer the regular Weizen better. Overall a decent brew.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Cloudy deep straw body with abundant carbonation and a heavy fine particulate load. Thick, soft, cottony white head. Aroma of fried bananas, cloves, fresh bread, yeast, and spice. Flavor of fruity esters, light spice, phenols, and Noble hops and a touch of citrus. Moderate fullness on the palate. A fairly standard hefe, but good.

Murky orange.

Subtle, attractive aroma of banana peel, orange and deep clove along with an unexpected spicyness.

Hoppier, bigger in body, drier and more complex than the standard Schneider Weisse. Appealing, solid range of flavors including clove, vanilla, banana and quite a few citrusy fruits. The yeast pour brings delicate mustiness, less fruitiness and more vanilla.

Lovely.

I dont know if all of this beer is organic, but the bottle I got was.  It was stamped all over the bottle and cap.  This stuff was great.  It poured with a huge frothy head and it was unfiltered, so I had all the delicious dead yeasts and stuff clouding up the beer.  This is what a Wheat beer should be like.  The realest beer Ive probably ever had.  Like something you could make in your basement (it smells a little like a basement), but only if you were really good at brewing.  Pick this stuff up if you want to know what beer is.

Appearance: pours out a hazy, light orange color, pale, clear yellow at the bottom, yielding a full, bubbly snow-white head.
Aroma: Huge citrus, lemon and orange, sugar and spice, great hits of banana and clove, plus a little vanilla on the side, with an additional, and much appreciated bready/yeasty flavor. Fresh, wide open, and airy.
Mouth-filling texture, very tasty, flavor takes over, floods, and refreshes that entire cavern of the tastebuds. A trifle sour, but still mitigatingly sweet and fruity. Banana flavor continues, and the complex variety of tastes keeping company in the glass makes for very rewarding consumption. Finish is just long enough.
Much lighter, in taste and mouthfeel, as well as color, than the "Original", but in its own, a hallmark of this approach to the hefe weizen. Certainly the kind of beer American weizen brewers try to emulate.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2004 Not a very good beer from this otherwise great brewery.  I did enjoy it, but it didn?t really convert me from grabbing an Aventinus or other fine Schneider products, like Rob Schneider.  Mine did say Organic tho. And I've seen some that are not organic.

Wheat and very banana aroma. Cloudy golden color with a nice white head. Crisp and well spiced flavor, nice clove notes. Some doughy wheat flavors near the finsih. Moderatley bitter finish with light fruit. Not bad.

Bottle. Poured a small fizzy white head and fine-small size bubbles that quickly dissipated. Fast rising carbonation, transparent and a golden hue. Nose was malty, sweet, banana, spicy and clove. Flavor was banana, clove and spices. Smooth palate. Medium bodied beer with no lacing observed.

This bottled brew poured a medium sized head of mostly diminishing finely sized frothy white colored bubbles that left behind a poor lacing.  The body was carbonated transparent and orange in color.  The nose contained notes of malt and floral hops.  The mouth feel was initially tingly with and malty note to it and finished with a tingly hoppy mild bite.  The flavor contained notes of malts dough crisp mild hops and soft grass.

From bottle.  Nice light gold color, worked hard to get all the yeast out, it looked tasty.  Surprising fizz in the mouth, refreshing actually.  This ended up not tasting like what I thought it would, but actually better.  Good for a summer night

Bottle pours a cloudy light golden, quite murky with yeasty bits floating about, large white frothy head that slowly settles, sticky lacing, with little to no carbonation. &nbsp Cloves, banana, and soap on the nose. &nbsp Flavor is wheaty, slight cloves and other spices, but also somewhat dirty and muttled. &nbsp Medium body, full mouthfeel. &nbsp Finishes slightly bitter/sour, and slightly chalky. &nbsp Stick with Aventinus...
Big Yeasty aroma sits over a cloudy lemon merengue pie.  There is clearly some substance and depth in these murky waters.  The hops mix (Cascade and Hallertau) gives some sizzle and sweetness .

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2006 Poured with a thin head that compressed rapidly. A lot of dark yeast clumps floating in the yellow/brown color.  Smelled spicy and had a strong alcohol aroma.

Tasted spicy, yeasty-hay like and had a suprising amount of carbonation. Still managed to have a dissapointing watery aftertaste.

Suprisingly thick mouthfeel for such a watery end taste.

Decent and to be honest different, but not a showstopper.
Poured light amber with light color head...smelled a little lemony and a little metallic...tasted malty and yeasty...very spicy finish...mediocre I suppose...

500 ml. brown, slender longneck bottle. Freshness date of 04.020 1-1 on back label. Some kind of code, I imagine. Poured out a golden straw yellow color, with a fast fading white head. It left a slight ring of bubbles around the rim of my glass, and thats about it. Aromas are of phenolics big time, along with yeast, and malts. 
Slight citrus aromas as well. The hop aromas are non-existant.
Taste are of phenolics. Overpowering band aid tastes. Strong flavors of cloves. If it werent for the overpowering clove tastes, this might be a decent beer. Finished medicinal. Hard to finish this one off.

Pours a  hazy cloudy yellow with a thin white head. 
Alspice and clove aroma with a little fruitiness.
Flavor was clove, bannana, vanilla.
Very refreshing beer

Fruity, yeasty and somewhat metallic aroma.   Good label, hazy maple colored beer with a fizzy rafting head.  Some leathery yeast qualities on top of the fruit and yeast.  Vanilla cakiness as well.  Smooth, watery mouth, with only a bit of zip on the backend.  As close as this came to being a witbier, I think that it would have done better to go ahead and cross the line.

On draft at the Old Bay in New Brunswick.  Had this once before in a bottle and was unimpressed.  This time on draft, however, it was quite impressive.  Fruity (orange) and spicy (coriander) aroma and flavors more typical of a belgian strong ale than your typical hefe-weizen - I thought the barman had pulled the wrong tap handle.  Will have to go back and reassess the bottled version.

Pours a cloudy orange amber with fluffy head that went away. Aroma is clove, banana, and lemon. Flavor is yeasty with citrus in the middle and some hoppy spiciness in the finish. The flavor is a bit thinner than I expected. Very fizzy and refreshing and really hit the spot while I sit here at 8pm in 97degree weather......it will get extra points for that.
Light yellow color, little head. Sweet fruity smell, a little skunky. Dry tasting, with an aftertaste of bad hops. Could be better.
Murky yellow, lingering white head, some spiciness along with the wheat and citrusy aftertaste.  Pretty good stuff.
Gold in color with no head. Aroma reminds me of grape juice or wine. VERY watery with some white grape taste. Doesnt even have the bitterness of a Bud Light. VERY dissapointing.

Pours a nice golden yellow, kind of cloudy, with a medium head.  Aroma is pretty bland with some wheat.  The taste has some malt and some wheat, but its overall a very calm beer.  Decent enough, but Id never hunt it down again.

This was the organic version. Hazy golden in color with a medium white head. Very strong clove aroma and flavor with a spiciness too. Very light and refreshing, and deceiving alcohol. I cant believe it is 6.2 percent. After adjusting to the clove flavor, this is a good one.

Hazy amber with thin white head.  The aroma was a fragrant clove scent.  That appealed to the nose but the carry over of the potent clove in the taste wasnt as appealing.  Just too much clove.  This may be an excellent cooking beer.  The spice will go well in many foods.  For drinking, however, it didnt cut it with me.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2006 Rerate Too murky an fizzy this time around. Flavor about the same. Fresh aroma. Original 3.7  Light orange appearance, little to no head - starts out sparkly upon the pour but settles into a light murkiness; barely there head. Fresh, light fruity aroma, much different than most hefes not the traditional banana, more like nectarines and white grapes. Refreshing carbonation - not overdone. Mellow hefe flavor, not as estery as most hefes, a nice change. More lemon-lime like - not too different from a vodka tonic in some senses! Pick up a bit of yeast in the finish. Overall, a very decent effort from a superb brewer - have not been dissapointed with them yet.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2004 July 04: 22 oz glass at Resis Bierstube, Chicago.  Gorgeous, hazy, bright sunny golden with a smallish slow-dying head.  Bananas, vanilla and grapes on the rich nose.  Big malty caramel-pepper notes sitting side by side with subdued bananas, and a hint of lemon-lime.  Seems a little overcarbonated, but overall another nice offering from one of Germanys best. 8/4/6/3/14 3.5

Dec 2004, Swedish dregs, Alts etc tasting w/MartinT, tiggmtl and Rastacouere #3.  500 ml bottle.  Much more spice in the nose this time (clove, nutmeg and a hint of mango), still seems a bit watery but citrus-banana texture is prominent and delicious.  A near-masterwork.

Pale cloudy grapefuit coloured body with a fairly poor but mainly lasting white head. Cloves on the nose. A little watery in the taste but definitely cloves appearing once again, some bubblegum, banana and a touch of spice, light to medium body with a little bit of citrus on the finish.

Organic version.  Cloudy with huge head.  Banana nose with a very familiar hint of cascade hops!!!  Smooth and refreshing, i didnt notice that the alcohol is kicked up a bit in this.  Strong cascade hoppy finish is quite unique and unexpected. good stuff!

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2006 Organic version, sampled at the Southside Beer Expo. A good German Weizen, not quite as full of hefeweizen character as others, but well made. Subtle weizen character allows a surprising hop profile to show through. On a second tasting, I get some more clove character, and the color and taste comes close to an Oktoberfest style.

500ml bottle. 06.09.04  Pours a yellowish gold with fizzy, large head that disappears quickly.  Lots of hefe aromas: banana, clove, bubblegum, etc.  Some molasses?  Celery.  Flavor is big, mouthfeel is thick for a hefeweizen (to me) without some of the expected citrus flavor, but both sweeter and drier.  Some lingering caraway.  Good stuff.  Quite wheaty on finish.

Not as complex as I thought it would be, but still a good weissbier. Lighter than the original Schneider Weisse with an orange-tinted yellow color. Has all your basic hefe elements: cloves, spices, (light) banana. Low amount of dryness and bitterness, quite smooth.

Ive tasted cloves in hefeweizens before, but this was nuts.   Aroma of cloves.  Taste was spicey clove with bubblegum, citrus, and banana.  Spicy finish.

Cascade hops were on the ingredient list(!)
Tasted just as a Hefeweizen should. Hazy golden color with flavor of cloves, banana and bubblegum. Very nice.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2005 Citrus aroma. Body is pretty thin. Nice hazy orange color. Some yeast present, nice citrus taste and wheat taste. Decent. Rerate: Big white head but no retention. Taste is just a touch too sweet, and there is a little bit of off-sourness to the taste.
Pours a surprisingly clear yellow with a nice white head. Yeasty, citrus aroma and flavor. Another nice German hefe.
Pours cloudy, dark yellow. Aroma of yeast, fresh citrus and tartness. Flavor is like the aroma. Refreshing and nice.

Bottle:  Aroma is banana and cloves.  Pours a hazy yellowish orange with a large bubbled head that dies rather quickly.  Flavors are a nice mixture of cloves, wheat, citrus.  Very carbonated. Nothing to get too excited about, but not bad.
Very smooth. Reminded me of the taste of a belgian white (that smooth citrus taste), specifically a lot like hogaarden white.

Man,oh man.  This is my favorite new find.  Intense flavor, banana/clove/skunky goodness, spicy and bright.  Not your normal puss-cakes 4% hefeweizen.  Great on a sunny day when that wimpy American lager just won't hit the spot.
Pours with tall head that quickly dissipates.  Bananaclove-like aroma. Spicy.   Bready malty mouthfeel with low carbonation.  Excellent, clean, dry  finish.

Bottle--foamer.

beatufiul golden color--kristal.
not head to speak of except for the frothy white foam that kept oozinf out of the bottle after I popped the cap.  The head when I poured was white, large-bubbled, and disappeared literally before I could sit down with the beer!

Smells like mead--almost no hop aroma, maybe a bit of wheat, but the overall aroma is honey.

cidery taste, honey and wheat, with a bit of grass to it.  Definite citrus notes.

This may be over the hill, although I bought it at Spec's on Westheimer in Houston just two weeks ago.

finish a middlin' sweet with a bandaid edge.

Wonderful!  Smells like holunderblüten syrup, a syrup flavored with elderberry flowers.  Pale bubbly orange, looks great!  Very creamy silky smooth mouthfeel, very unique for a hefeweizen.  Flavor isn't quite as good, but still clean, very refreshing, and pleasant, great for a quick drink.  This is something unique that I have been wanting to find for a while.  A beer with the flavor of elderberry flowers that was done very well!

This Hefewiezen has a huge head that leaves the scene quickly, very much so for a hefewiezen. Golden color, also rather clear for the style. Nice banana nose and a pleasant smooth palate. Malty, fruity and refreshing. Good above average Hefewiezen.
UPDATED: JAN 4, 2012 (Bottle) Pours a murky yellow color with a thick foamy white head. Aroma of wheat, lemon, and mustiness. Has flavors of banana, wheat, and lemon peel.
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2004 Pours deep yellow with a big fluffy white head. Aroma of wheat and yeast. Light banana esters. Spicy with cloves. Decent but not as good as the regular Schneider Weisse.
Sweet, wheaty aroma. Sweet, Bread, wheat, and bananna flavors. Ok but I don't really like bananna flavor, also not much of a wheat beer fan.
Cloves, murky, Low carbonation. Flavours are a little small, banana and some spice. Very nice, just finished a run and it works beautifully.
Yeasty, bread-like aroma, nice white head, good lacing, and slightly cloudy yellow-amber color.  Smooth mouthfeel, but quite bread-like.  My first wheat beer...not too bad.
The aroma has ginger and maybe some banana. Fairly smooth, but the flavors are muted. A little grass and wheat. Also some bread. A strong entry for a wheat beer.

A wonderful example of German weissbier, with a lighter color than SchneiderWeisse, it goes better with meals.  Not a highly carbonated but great banana/clove nose and fantastic taste.  One of the best.

This hefe is well carbonated, lightly hazy, bright-deep-gold color without the yeast in the glass.  The head is off white.  Clove dominates the aroma, and there is a hint of banana as well as a bit of grain and a hint of astringency.  The taste is fruity, clove-like, spicy, sharp, effervescent, slightly acidic, and a bit sweet.  The carbonation is tingly and there is an astringent note in the finish.  This is a tasty Hefeweizen.  I like the spicy notes that are found here.  A very refreshing summer quaffer.

Pours cloudy dark yellow, almost orange with a medium white head. Not as carbonated as other weizens I've tried. Retention is alright. Yeasty, wheat malt aroma, along with the typical lolly-banana smell. Theres a citrus (almost cascade hop) aroma there too though. Mouthfeel is medium, a little watery but still smooth. Quite tart flavour. Lots of wheat malt flavour, yeasty spices and citrus. Nice lingering dry finish. Very refreshing.

Golden orange, medium white head and plenty of carbonation all around. Yeast and wheat aroma (of course) plus citrus and celery. Starts a little sweet, spicy, smokey at times, a bit like a lager, more firm than other hefeweizens, dry finish. Not your typical hefeweizen, good all around.
A bit cloudy and a slight amber color.  This beer is great.  A nice wheaty flavor with a great citrus finish.  It's one of the best Hefe-Weizen I've tried.
Crisp and refreshing. its a little lighter than your average hefe.  the head dissapates quick and more flavors come out as it warms.  schneider makes good stuff.
Man this is a good brewery.  I love what the bottle conditioning did for this weisse.  Just a little sweetness on the back end, or I would have rated it even higher.

Cloudy pale yellow pour with a fizzy white head. Didn't like the sound at all. Bubbles rise to the top. Great aroma though! Yeast, malt, and some wheat all in the aroma. Smooth taste. Very strong malt flavor. Some bubble gum, banana, and citrus linger as well. Overall not bad, but could be a little better!

Hazy medium gold, decent white head, some rather unappealing chunks, and I do mean chunks, of yeast floating around in it.  More than the usual by far.  Some even rose up, hit the foam on the surface, and disintegrated in the carbonation, staining the head with streaks of brown.  But, hey, it smelled good, estery with a good dose of clove and some banana.  Very estery, with bubble gum, banana, citric fruit, and cloves working nicely with each other, ending in a satisfying sour twang.  An underrated Hefe.

bottle-sampled at the Grapevine Market, Austin TX-nice banana aroma and cloudy yellow appearance, but darker tham most hefe's.  I need to have a larger sample of this one!  Banana is the big note here with some subtle hops.
Has a hazy orangish color with no head and moderate carbonation.  Smell is of citrus.  Taste is also citrus and finishes pretty dry.  Overall not my kind of wheat.

hazy, pale straw body, thick foamy white head.  estery and wheaty, some orange and lemon hints, seems pretty standard.  smooth and somewhat grainy.  cornflakey and dry later on.  a bit of a bite, effervescence and hop contributed.

Quite different from what I was expecting. 
Quite pale with really bad head retention. 
Aroma is mostly fruit (stone fruits, not banana) and vanilla with no real clove, which makes for a decent change. Alcohol faintly perceived.
Light and spritzy mouthfeel, quite crisp and refreshing citrusy flavour. Malt is there, but in the background. Quite different to most Weissbiers and probably not as good as their Original but in this case different isn't necessarily bad.

Nice citrus aroma.  Light head with some lacing.  Good carbination and lots and lots of bubbles.  My first sip gave me the impression of grape juice flavors with a subtle malt flavor behind it.  Very nice!

A very flavoursome ale with a bold head and cloudy body.  A strong but controlled clove flavour combines excellently with the mild citrus flavours. A true thirst builds in your mouth as you are drinking.  Too bad I only had the one 500ml bottle to sample.

The best beer i have had in a long while. Cloudy light golden, enormous white head. Fantastic aroma of banana, clove, wheat, citrus. Strong yet refreshing similar flavors, with an extra spiciness added in. Wonderful on the palate. An excellent weiss beer.

Hazy golden colour with strong orange highlights and a thin white head. Aroma of bananas, yeast, wheat, citrus and a bit of peach sweetness. Medium-bodied; Strong wheatie flavour with coriander seed and cloves present. Very clean and subtle aftertaste of some malt, a bit of spice and some sweetness. Overall, the alcohol is hidden well, just as most german wheats, but this one shows a decent amount of complexities and finishes well! I bought this 500 mL bottle at Beers of the World in Rochester, New York and sampled it on 13-December-2003.
Very easy to drink.  Slightly better and slightly more alcoholic than schneider weisse.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2010 Had to up this from a 3.9 to a 4.5. A very nice wheaty crispy hop beer. An excellent finish. 5 score both times.

Wow, a headless Schneiderwiesse.  Crisp and clean for a hefe. Apply and pearish. This brewery knows its business.
Super light for a weiss.  Clear, pale gold and a lemony freshness on top of substantial wheat.  Nice!
Plenty of spicy clove, bubblegum, yeast and fruits like banana  and pear. Slightly bitter and acidic. Nice example of the style and worth drinking.

My favorite hefeweizen.  Very spicy aroma and finish, with the most obvious clove flavor I've ever experienced.  Great yeast in this one, if you're a yeast fan.  Beautiful tan color, like none I've ever seen.  Head stays put for a while.  Rich flavored, crisp from the wheat.  I'd like more body, but that's not true to style.  Great beer.
Cloudy pale yellow. Banana/clove aroma. Good white head. Rich, full bodied and delicious. Like this the best among the German imported wheaties.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text:
I always pour all the yeast of a bottle-conditioned beer into the glass. Yeast... it's not only good, it's good for you!
Murky, pear-colored lager with a huge, frothy, white head to start. Almost fully diminishing and leaves little to no lacework.
The aroma is yeasty and malty with notes of clove, banana, bubblegum and pear.
Well-balanced flavor. Spicy and fruity up front. Lightly astringent on the backside.
Medium-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and very light carbonation. Short, spicy, sweet finish. Pretty darn good for the style.
I like wheat beers, and I enjoyed this one, but something is a little different.  Maybe it is the American hops, but I still like the original Schneider Weisse a little better.

Clear bubbly yellow.  Aroma has some hay, lemon, wheat, and gasoline.  Crisp, with a little bitterness in the middle and finish, but tasting lageresque, unlike their other wheats.  Not bad, a good summer beer.

Pours a deep hazed orange color, large white head that mostly diminishes to a small ring, lacing is decent.  Aroma is malty with some bread and cookie dough, some lemon, banana and clove in there as well, and a bit of floral hops in the background.  Flavor is sweet and doughy in the front, very citric in the middle and end.  Medium body, fairly acidic, medium carbonation.

A very nice golden color in the pour that is extremely cloudy with an obvious unfiltered look and a huge puffy cloud head.  Nice clovey bite in the flavor with some nice citrus highlights, slightly hoppy and spicy rounding out the finish.
Pours cloudy, unfiltered with big head. Aroma of cascade hops, some clove. Flavorful hops finishing spicy. A different hefeweizen.

Very unfiltered appearance with a puffy classic schneider head. Aroma is medium hoppy, full of cascade hops. Also in the nose is the traditional banana & clove esters from the belgian hefe yeast. These are not overpowering as in schneider classic. Flavor is moderately hoppy and flavorful. Finishes sweet and spicy. Very unique but terrific.

Strange, light hefe.  All of the typical flavors of a weisse.  I prefer Schneider's Aventinus to this one though, since it's heavier on the bready wheat and clove flavors.  More alcohol as well (though it's a weizen bock).

Edel-weisse, edel weisse, bring back my bonny to, me to me. The song is remarkably similar to the beer. Pretty crappy in other words. To me, this lacks most things that a good beer should have. The carbonation meant that it lost head very quickly, the body is thin and there is no real discernible character to this beer. Perhaps G.Schnieder should fire Sohn and get his son in to help.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: I'd need to do a few more head-to-head tests to fully comprehend the differences between this and the regular weizen.  Pretty damn good.
a surprise from the start with a fresh, grassy pils aroma. tastes of vanilla custard, with only faint traces of wheat. very pale and strangely prickly. unique

(bottle conditioned) Bready, sweet wheat aroma with hint of apple.  Cloudy, approriate yeasty pour with beautiful proud head that disappeared quickly despite proper pour.  Thinnish medium body with wheat fullness & nice light esters but quickly fading flavor.  Nice little tart apple hint at the end.  Lowish caronation keeps a soft feel.  I prefered this to their standard hefe-weizen.  Recommended.
I dunno if I like it as much as the regular stuff. It's bloody nice though and quite bread and buttery. You can't go wrong.

A refreshing beer for a hot summer day.  This brew pours dark golden and quite cloudy.  There is a medium large head that completely dissipates with no lacing.  The beer smells sweet like grapes?  Has a nice sweet flavor with a tiny acid kick in the finish.  Very drinkable and enjoyable.

Usually hazy gold under a medium sized bright white head. Very pleasant bready fruity and floral hops aroma. Average to light bodied for the style. Zingy sharpish hoppy start. Softer weaker maybe harsher middle and finish. Still plenty of flavour but it lacks the real smoothness and finish of say the Maisels or the Weihenstephaner.

50 cL bottle, hefe glass.  Hazy, medium straw colored body has swirls of yeast in it and there's a few large particles floating around.  Lightest colored Schneider I've had so far.  Large head due to swirling to get all the yeast out, but it's already gone as I write this.  Toasted light bread and wheaty malts.  Light flowery hops.  Doughy yeast.  I smell some banana esters, but the fruit overtones smell most like apples to me.  Fairly sweet throughout with a step up in acidity and bitterness at the end.  Bitterness at the beggining has an interesting sour apple quality to it.  Finish feels a little unclean, but that's probably due to the acidity and how smooth this beer starts out.  Medium body has a watery texture and soft carbonation.  There's really a lot of interesting light fruit flavors present in this beer.  Looking at the other ratings, I'm obviously crazy for detecting this fruitiness; but I already knew that.  I think this is better than their regular hefeweizen and it's the second best wheat I've had to date.

Something of a revved up hefeweizen, I had to double check that it was Reinheitsgebot because it seems to have a Hoegaarden like spiciness. Spicy clove aroma. Palate shows cinammon, clove, peppery spice and traditional banana flavors.

Very cloudy yellow-orange with a foamy head. Perfume and citrus in the nose along with a bit of spice. A bit thin on the palate. Notes of bananas and a slight hint of clove. A refreshing summer-time brew.

Thin head with decent carbonation.  Nice soft aroma of wheat and a sweet malt.  Color is a medium golden amber.  Flavor is smooth and not overpoweringly wheat.  Quite plesant with a hint of lemon.  Finish is clean with a little alcohol warming and a slightly bitter aftertaste.  A quite plesant wheat beer that is not a strong as some.
